Wilma is 33 years old and married with two young children. She lives with her family in the province of Rizal in the Philippines.  Her husband works at variety of jobs including welding, farming, and construction.  To supply additional income for her family, Wilma is starting a business buying and selling charcoal and wood in the neighborhood.  She is ambitious and determined to launch a successful business venture of her own.


Wilma would like to receive a loan to purchase more charcoal and wood.  As a new member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Wilma is thankful for access to capital and loans to support her entrepreneurial dreams.   Her long-term goals are to build a sustainable business, fund her children’s college education, and construct a more durable home that can withstand flooding common in her town.  With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that her new business will generate steady income to improve her financial stability and her family’s quality of life.


About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and wood.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria sells mouth-watering Nigerian cooked food and she has been in this business for a long time. The business has really been of great help to her family. She hopes to own a world-class restaurant in the future. Her husband is a farmer and they are blessed with four children. Her children are excelling in school and this gives her joy. She hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. Victoria is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy vegetables and spices

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C. is from the village of Malinao, Gingoog City. She is 35 years old. Gloria is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. (Gloria chose to remain at the 5,000 level for her ninth loan).

In 2003, Gloria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Gloria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: This village bank loan includes four people who all live in Prachum Angk village in Kandal province. All the members selected Mrs. Mom S. as the village bank president. They will use the loan for different purposes. She owns a general store and her husband, Mr. Thy Hab, is a sugar cane juice seller. This family tries to work hard with their business but they can't earn enough income. Thus, in order to improve the family's living condition, Mrs. Mom S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries and cane to re-sell. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are attending a local public school and one is too small to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more groceries and cane to re-sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 25 years old, married, and lives in the province of Rizal in the Philippines with her husband and two young children.  To supply additional income for her family, Rosita is opening a local convenience store in her neighborhood.

Rosita would like to receive a loan to purchase inventory including rice, sugar, shampoo, detergent, and canned goods.  Rosita believes in offering a relevant assortment and inventory of goods in her store for customers seeking convenient purchases.  As a new member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Rosita is grateful for the access to capital and loans to fund her entrepreneurial dreams.

Her long-term goals are to expand her retail business, fund the college education of children, and support her family financially.  With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, she is determined to achieve business success with her new entrepreneurial endeavor.


About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is married with eight children. Her children are excelling in school and she is happy about it. She sells groceries, drinks and foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers. She sees her business as a major source of support for her family. She is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more drinks and groceries to sell. She has a good relationship with LAPO. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and groceries to sell

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: Teresia is a single lady with two children who attend school.  She has a tree nursery where she has been selling seedlings for six years.  She also earns a living from dairy farming.  She was previously employed in Kenya Agricultural Research Institute (KARI).  She is a member of Faulu Kenya, which is a partner of Kiva. She feels her business has expanded from having 5,000 seedlings to 20,000 seedlings. She has requested a loan of Kes.40,000 to buy a cow and to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to educate her children, buy a piece of land, and build her own house instead of paying house rent. She sees herself being a major supplier of milk and having more cows on her farm.

loans.use: To buy a cow and pay school fees

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 40 years old and married with three children.  Her two eldest children are currently in high school while her youngest is attending elementary school.  Rosario lives in the province of Rizal in the Philippines with her husband, Manolo. To supply additional income for her family, Rosario is interested in launching her own fishing business.

Rosario would like to receive a loan to purchase raw materials like nets, bamboo, and a new fish cage.  As a new member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Rosario is thankful for access to capital to support her entrepreneurial dreams.  Her long-term goals are to build a profitable fishing business, send all of her children to college, and invest in her home.  With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is dedicated to launching a new business and determined to achieve financial stability for her family.


About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials like nets, bamboo, and a new fish cage.

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Mrs. Hem A. is 57 years old. She lives in Kandal village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Khoem Some, are farmers who own 2.5 hectares of land to grow rice to support their family. This family has a problem because their house is too old to live in, but they do not have enough money to build. Thus, Mrs. Hem A. decided to ask for a loan to buy timber to build her house. She will use the rest of the loan to hire construction laborers. She is the mother of two children who are farmers too. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy timber to build her house

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is an Ibo by tribe but she lives and works in Benin City, Edo state. She is married to a clergyman with children. Charity sells groceries, drinks and foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers.  She hopes to own a world-class supermarket in the future. Her business has been a major source of income for her family. She needs a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries, foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Anthonia

texts.en: Anthonia is married with two children. Her children are in secondary school.  Her husband also works to support the home. She has a computer center alongside her husband. She renders computer services to her customers and she sells computer accessories. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more computer accessories. She duly says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase computer accessories

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en: Ganbold is 51 years old and lives with his two children in the Ovorhangai province of Mongolia.  He and his two sons live in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent.  He operates a wooden furniture trading business and his two children help him paint the wooden furniture.  With the Mongolian Lunar New Year coming, demand for his services is high.  He started his business in 1990, and he has his own equipment in his home.  He is a hard working person, and his communication skills are good. He says, “I would like to expand my business and to buy a car for my son. Therefore, my son will be able to run a taxi service and it will be easier for us to transport our wooden products. ” He is requesting a 2,780,000-tugrugs loan to purchase wood and materials.

loans.use: To purchase wood and raw materials

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 34 years old, married with two children, and lives in the province of Rizal with her husband.  Her husband is involved in fishing and works as a welder to support the family.  Her two children attend the local elementary school in the community.

To supply additional income for her family, Jennifer would like to receive a loan to start a new food-selling business.  With the loan, she will purchase inventory for her snack store including hamburgers, rice, eggs, sugar, and fish.   She believes that offering a wide variety of delicious snacks will attract loyal customers in the neighborhood and attract a steady flow of patrons during the afternoon.

As a new member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Jennifer is grateful for access to capital and other services such as savings and insurance.  With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, Jennifer is hopeful that her new business endeavor will provide steady income and improvements in her family’s quality of life.

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To start a new food selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy plantains for reselling

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena is a widow with two children. One of her children just graduated and the other child is married with children. Philomena is very happy to be a mother and grandmother. She sells drinks, groceries and foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to expand her business. 

She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Near Soeng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has nine people who all live in Kandal village in Kandal province. Mrs. Near S. is a village bank president who has been selected by all the loan members, who use the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice for supporting her family. Her husband, Mr. Hung Horm, is a construction laborer. 

In the rice field, they have had some problems because it has a lot of insects and it is far from an irrigation system. Thus, Mrs. Near S. decided to ask for a loan to buy pesticides and will use the rest of the loan to buy fuel to improve the production of rice. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is a laborer, while the others are attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy pesticides

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 39 years old and is married with five children who are 5, 9, 11, 13 and 15 years old. Jeanne and her family live in Rulindo, a region of the Northern Province of Rwanda. Here, Jeanne lives by selling domestic animals including cows and goats. This is her ninth successful year in this business and her business hours are from 7 a.m. until late in the evening hours.

As Jeanne has gained experience in selling domestic animals, her number of customers has increased to the the extent that her original investment seems to be too low to purchase enough cows and goats for sale. She would like to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that she can increase her sales.

With this loan, and with her hope to satisfy the demand of her customers by selling at the cheapest price, Jeanne will do that and, of course, her profits will increase. With those profits, one portion will be used to build a secure future for her family and another portion will be used to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more domestic animals to sell

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a married mother of three children.  Her husband is a boat driver in the community while she manages her own fish business to supply additional income for the family.   Lilibeth is a hard-working entrepreneur who has been in business for almost five years.  

Lilibeth would like to receive a loan as working capital for her fish business to purchase raw materials like a fish cage, bamboo and rope as well as cover  labor costs.  A proud member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, since 2006, Lilibeth has been a dedicated member demonstrating regular attendance to weekly meetings and steady repayments on previous loans.

Her long term goals are to renovate her home as it was partially destroyed by Hurricane Ondoy last year.  Also, she hopes the profits from her business will fund the continued education of all three children.  With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, Lilibeth is determined to achieve business success to build more long-term financial security for her family.


About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the poorest in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: Working capital for her fishing business.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda C. is from the village of Guinles. She is 57 years old. Luzviminda is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Luzviminda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Luzviminda has been engaged in her business for more than 30 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP on average a month for these activities.

In 2007, Luzviminda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzviminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which also will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is 28 years old and married with two children. Her youngest child is 2 years old. Her husband is a commercial driver. She sells groceries, drinks, frozen foods and foodstuffs to make a living. She hopes to expand her business. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and frozen foods to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Munhzul

texts.en:
Munhzul is 39 years old and lives with her husband and four children in the Dornogobi province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband is a herder and has a few heads of livestock. He bought an apartment using the money he made from herding. 

During the day, Munhzul operates a bakery shop. She started her business in 2005, after working with her sister to sell children's clothes for two years. She used to supply her products to food shops. In 2008, she opened her own shop to sell her products. Now she is renting space built to house a restaurant and has three workers. Munhzul is providing baked goods to the Lunch Time Project for local high schools. 

She says, “I would like expand my shop into a factory, since I'm renting a place dedicated to restaurant anyway. Therefore, there is enough space for me to expand my business.” She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrugs loan to purchase a large amount of ingredients in anticipation of the Mongolian Lunar New Year when customers buy a lot of traditional baked goods.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is married and lives in the province of Rizal in the Philippines with her husband.  She is 55 years old and has one son, who is currently working as a computer technician.  Leonisa is an ambitious entrepreneur who has managed a sewing and dress-making business in her community for almost 10 years. 

Leonisa would like to receive a loan to purchase additional fabric in different materials including satin and cotton.  She believes that having a greater variety and assortment of fabric will help her design different styles of dresses to match her clients’ particular fashion tastes.  A proud member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, since 2007, Leonisa has been a dedicated member demonstrating regular attendance to weekly meetings and steady repayments on previous loans.

Leonisa’s dreams are to expand her business and eventually open up her own dress-making factory in her neighborhood.  With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, she aspires to grow her business and generate steady income to support her family’s long term financial security.


About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the poorest in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: Purchase additional fabric in different materials including satin and cotton.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy has been selling foodstuffs for three years. She enjoys her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She works for long hours to make her business sustainable. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. 

She is married with a child. Her husband is a building agent, and he also supports the home. Christy is itching for progress in her business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy S. is an example of a strong woman who can thrive and make a living without a man. A 31-year-old mother of two kids, she lives in the town of Angono, Rizal Province, in the Philippines. 

Joy’s main goal is to build a sustainable business to meet the needs of her children; she was thus encouraged to join ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), a MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2001. The previous loans she received from Kiva were carefully invested in her restaurant. Since then, the restaurant has been performing well and earning sufficient profit. She is grateful that she has been able to educate her children using proceeds from her business as she continues to expand. Joy needs a loan to help boost her business for increased profit.

Now requesting her sixth loan, she is requesting 40,000 pesos as additional capital for her restaurant, to be used to pay for cases of beer, liquor, pork, chicken, groceries for her enterprise and an additional videoke karaoke machine.

Joy is optimistic that she can achieve her dreams of providing a good life for her children and being able to send them to school until they finish college. She also hopes to expand her business and if possible she can have a branch in the town of Taytay, Rizal, in order to provide employment to others. She hopes that these dreams will come true and that ASHI will give the best direction and opportunity to her family.

She is happy that her living condition is better than in the past because she can generate more income from the business. Joy would like to send all the best wishes to all her lenders around the world. She hopes that they will support her again in the future.

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country

loans.use: Additional working capital for her restaurant.

loans.name: Elise

texts.fr: K. Elise est née le 15 aout 1970 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Il y a 15 ans que Elise vit à Adogléta, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à HOUNYEME Francis, un chauffeur, Elise est mère de quatre enfants dont certains sont scolarisés. Les enfants qui ne sont pas scolarisés n’ont pas encore atteint l’âge requis pour fréquenter l’école. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges familiales. Pour aider son mari dans leurs dépenses, Elise vend des pains sucrés et de façon secondaire du poisson frais à son domicile et par la méthode de distribution. Elise achète ses produits à la boulangerie et à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Elise a arrêté les classes au cours secondaire mais exerce son activité depuis 15 ans. Ayant déjà obtenu cinq crédits tous bien remboursés auprès de ALIDé, Elise est maintenant une cliente fidèle de ALIDé. Dans l’optique d’élargir son domaine d’activité et d’augmenter le stock de ses produits, Elise désire bénéficier d’un sixième concours financier auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Elise K. was born on August 15, 1970, in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. For fifteen years, she's been living in Adogléta, a neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to a driver, she's the mother of four children, some of whom attend school. The other children have not yet reached the minimum age to attend school. The couple supports the family together. To help her husband with their expenses, Elise sells bread and, as a secondary business, fresh fish at her home and through the distribution system. She buy her supplies at the bakery and in Dantokpa, an international marketplace in Benin. Elise dropped out of school in secondary level, but has been running her business for fifteen years. She already benefited from five loans from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, which were all repaid without problems. She's now a loyal client of ALIDé. With the goal of broadening her business scope and bolstering her stock, Elise would like to obtain a sixth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell bread

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a LAPO client. She is 38 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a businessman, and he also supports the home. She bakes, and she also has a restaurant where she sells cooked foods and drinks. With these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family. 

Caroline is requesting a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase a deep freezer and catering materials. She says this will help to attract more customers. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer and catering materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en:
Ganbaatar is 41 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in a house in Arhangai province, Mongolia. His youngest daughter, who is 13 years old, attends a local secondary school, and his wife helps with the family business. 

Ganbaatar operates a taxi service in his town. He transports people from Arhangai province to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Ganbaatar started his taxi service business in 2005 and besides his transportation business, he manages a consumer goods trading business in order to supplement his earnings. He says, "I am working hard in order to save some money for my children." He is requesting a 1,200,000 tugrug loan to purchase machinery parts for his car and some consumer goods for his other business.

loans.use: To purchase machinery parts

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 39 years old and is married with six children. Her husband is a carpenter and he also supports his home.

Juliet sells groceries, drinks and foodstuffs. She also has poultry where she rears birds to sell. With these combined businesses, she hopes to support her husband in meeting the basic needs of her family. She hopes to expand her businesses in the future.

Juliet is requesting the loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hairdressing supplies

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El Sr. Ángel es casado con la Sra. Mirian ellos aun no tienen hijos se han casado hace poco tiempo viven en su casa propia.
Ángel se dedica a la venta de ropas femeninas y masculinas de varias marcas, venden en forma ambulante.
El 95% de sus ventas son a crédito tienen aproximadamente 150 clientes en toda la zona.
El se inicio en esta actividad con la ayuda de su Sra.  Que trabajaba en una empresa que se dedica a la venta de ropas.
Junto un poco de dinero que gano con mucho sacrificio realizando todo tipo de trabajos.
El ya tuvo otros créditos con nosotros y cumplió en forma excelente con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Ángel is married, and his wife's name is Mirian. They have only been married a short time, and they do not yet have children. They live in a house that they own. Ángel's work is selling men's and women's clothing of various brands. He goes around to different places to sell his merchandise. 95% of his sales are on credit, and he has approximately 150 customers throughout the area. He began this activity with the help of his wife, who was working in a clothing store. He gathered together a little money which he had earned through much sacrifice, doing all types of work. Ángel has already had other loans with our organization, and he has fulfilled his obligations in an excellent manner.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing women's and men's clothing such as dresses, blouses, pants, shorts and shirts

loans.name: Queen

texts.en:
Queen is 35 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a welder and he also supports the home.

To make a living, Queen sells poultry in one of the major markets in Benin City and has been in this business for five years. She loves this business because it is highly profitable.

Queen is requesting the loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more poultry to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry to sell

loans.name: Abdulkhay

texts.ru: Темиров Абдулхай проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 31 год. Женат, детей не имеет. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Абдулхай более 11 лет занимается торговлей. Он продает каляски и детские кровати, колыбельнии. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота, т.е. увеличение ассортимента своего товара.
texts.en:
Abdulkhay T. lives close to Vahdat, Tajikistan. He is thirty-one years old, married with no children. His wife is a homemaker. He has been in sales for over eleven years. He sells strollers and cribs. He is asking for a loan to increase sales and expand the variety of products offered.

Translated from Russian by Susan Savkov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Naimanchuluun

texts.en:
Naimanchuluun is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His son, aged 5, is in kindergarten and his youngest, 1, has not reached school age yet.

Naimanchuluun operates a taxi service in his town. He transports people to and from Arhangai province and Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He started his business in 2001 and, with years of business operation, he has managed to establish himself in the business community and become well known for his excellent driving skills.

With his business earnings Naimanchuluun bought one more car which helped him to earn more money than before. He is a very careful driver who constantly maintains his car in order to provide a safe service to his customers. He says, “I want to expand my business in order to save enough money for my children's future.”

Naimanchuluun is requesting a 700,000 tugrug loan to purchase machinery parts for his business.

loans.use: To purchase machinery parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of soy beans

loans.name: Sofy

texts.fr: Madame Sofy S. habite à Bambilor. Elle est âgée de 51 ans et est membre de la caisse depuis janvier 2010. Elle n’a jamais bénéficié de prêt au sein de l’U-IMCEC. Elle  évolue dans le commerce de mil et de légumes depuis deux ans et demi. Madame S. a choisi cette activité pour gagner sa vie et faire face a ses besoins quotidiens. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus c’est l’aspect lucratif de l’activité. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs destine a l’achat des produits qu’elle commercialise. Le crédit lui permet d’avoir une indépendance dans son travail
texts.en:
Madame Sofy S. lives in Bambilor. She is 51 years old and has been a member of the U-IMCEC credit union since January 2010. She has never received a loan through U-IMCEC. She has been in the business of selling millet and vegetables for two and a half years. Madame S. chose this business to make her living and meet her daily needs. What interests her most is the lucrative aspect of the business. She is seeking a loan of 100,000 francs for the purchase of the products she sells. The loan will allow her to work independently.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Isoken

texts.en:
Isoken is a widow with six children and she is 57 years old. She is a friendly woman. She sells kerosene to make a living. She has been in this business for a long time. She uses her many years of experience in the kerosene business to attract and retain her customers. She also loves this business because it is highly profitable. 

Isoken hopes for a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more kerosene to sell. She hopes to be a major distributor of kerosene in her city. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
El Sr. Anibal es casado con la Sra. Celia hace varios años tienen 4 hijos mayores todos ya están casado e independientes de ellos.
Juntos montaron una despensa en su casa que esta ubicado  en un barrio muy poblado de la zona, se iniciaron con un pequeño capital que consiguieron con otros trabajos que han realizaron anteriormente como asalariados.
Gracias al trabajo que están realizando han  educando a sus hijos y comprando todas las necesidades de su hogar.
El Sr. Anibal además de la despensa trabaja como Guardia de seguridad.
El ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Anibal has ben married to Celia for several years; they have 4 adult children who are married and independent of their parents. Together, they set up a grocery store in their home, which is located in a densely populated neighborhood of the area; they started out with a small amount of capital that they earned from prior salaried jobs. Thanks to the work they have done they managed to educate their children and have bought all that they have needed for their home. Anibal, besides working the store, is employed as a security guard. He has shown himself to be a responsible and honest person with respect to the commitments he takes on.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted merchandise: sugar, rice, pasta, soaps. etc.

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Bayambasuren is 59 years old and lives with her daughter in Arhangai province, Mongolia. They live in a Mongolian traditional tent called “ger.” She operates a door-to-door meal business in her town. She makes and sells between 20 and 30 meals per day. She started her business in 2006 and has made much progress over the years. Even though she has been in operation for a short period of time, she is well known amongst her customers and she is planning to expand her business further. 

For the future, she is planning to have her own food cafe in her town. She is a very hardworking businesswoman with a good personality. She says, "I am working hard to improve my children's quality of life." She is requesting a 400,000 tugrug loan to purchase food items in order to widen the selection of meals that she sells.

loans.use: To purchase food items for production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of "pagnes" and baby clothes

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en: Lhagvasuren makes wooden products. He started this business in 1995. Besides his wooden product making business, he started a transportation service in 2008. He transports people's baggage and luggage throughout his province. Lhagvasuren is 37 years old and lives with his wife and three sons in Arhangai province, Mongolia. They live in a Mongolian traditional tent called a ger. His 9-year-old and 17-year-old sons attend the local secondary school and his youngest, age 8, is in kindergarten. Lhagvasuren is planning to maintain and continue his business. He is a very open-minded and hardworking businessman. He says, “I want to start a block manufacturing business in the near future. I made some calculations and realize that it could be a very profitable business in Mongolia.” He is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase a large amount of wood for his wooden product making business.

loans.use: To purchase wood for wooden products

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en: Loveth is indeed happy hearing about Kiva lenders! She sells groceries, drinks and foodstuffs. She also sells cooked foods. She is 23 years old and single with children.  She works for long hours to support herself and her young ones. She hopes to grow her business. She is requesting a loan of 90,000 nairas to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Lhamsuren

texts.en: Lhamsuren operates an iron product making business in his town. He makes a variety of iron products such as pots, garages and doors, etc. He started his business in 1997 after running a transportation service for several years. Lhamsuren is 51 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His family lives in a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent called a ger. His second daughter, who is 20 years old, studies at university and his wife is a hairdresser. Over the years, Lhamsuren has worked hard to expand and improve his business. Now his working capital is 2,400,000 tugrugs (~$1700 US) with a monthly net profit of 450,000 tugrugs (~$320 US). He buys all his raw materials from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He is a hardworking man with good communication skills. He says, "I am planning to have my own workshop in the future." He is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase raw materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his business

loans.name: Awareness Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are members of the Awareness group from the township of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They are all small scale businesswomen who have formed a group to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person from SMT and Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is 28-year-old Isatu M..  Isatu, who sells soap, cotton, shoes, rubbers (plastic containers), and women’s clothes, is married to a soldier and they have six children. Their children are still attending schools – three are in secondary school and three are in primary school.  Isatu has two years of experience in business. With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by buying more wholesale inventory.

loans.use: To buy bathing soap, cotton, shoes, rubbers (plastic containers), and women’s clothes

loans.name: Watch You Neiber Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the Watch You Neiber group. They are small scale businesswomen in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have formed a group of five women to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member from SMT and Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they can attract more customers, make more sales and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is 28-year-old Zainab T..  Zainab is married to a police officer and they have two children who are attending primary school. Zainab has four years of experience in selling shoes, dishes, cottons, soaps, creams, and women’s clothes. With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by buying more inventory wholesale.

loans.use: Buy shoes, dishes, cottons, soaps, creams, and women’s clothes

loans.name: Sipola

texts.en: Sipola is a 58-year-old married lady with five children, two of whom are still in school.   She has been selling kales and spinach in Kawangware open air market for three years.  She feels her standard of living has improved since she joined Faulu Kenya.  She wants to take her first loan of KES 20,000 to buy more spinach and kales. She hopes to succeed as a business-lady in the future.   She sees her business expanding and generating a huge profit.  She describes herself as hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: Purchase of spinach and kales

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Néné

texts.fr: Néné S. est une dame de 34 ans qui évolue dans le commerce de légumes et de condiments pour la cuisine depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle habite Bambilor. Elle  est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 1 et 13 ans. Elle est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis janvier 2010. Son désir est d’éviter l’oisiveté et d’ avoir la possibilité de satisfaire ses besoins. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs dans le but d’acheter les produits qu’elle commercialise. Son intention est aussi d’acheter de l’encens pour diversifier son commerce. Ce crédit lui permettra aussi d’agrandir  son lieu de travail dans le marche.
texts.en:
Néné S. is a 34-year-old lady who has been active for over 10 years in the trade of vegetables and food condiments. She lives in Bambilor. She is married and the mother of four children, aged between 1 and 13. In January 2010 she became a member of the Bambilor branch of the microfinance institution U-IMCEC. She wants to avoid idleness and be able to provide for her needs. Néné applies for a loan amounting to 100,000 CFA francs to buy products that she trades in. She also intends to buy incense to diversify her inventory. In addition, the loan will enable her to increase the size of her vending space in the market.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 44-year-old married man with four children in school. He is employed as a supervisor in a petrol station. Besides that, he has a business with a pool table. He employs two people to assist him. He also earns extra income from a furniture workshop and a general store.

Faulu Kenya has motivated him to aim at excelling in his business and in life. Hence, he is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy one more pool table. He hopes to grow his business so he can meet his family’s needs. He sees himself having his own home in Nairobi and rental houses.

loans.use: To buy an additional pool table

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.en:
This group was formed by Teresa P., a resident of the Virgen del Rosario neighborhood in the city of Coronel Oviedo. She approached Fundación Paraguaya to learn more about its Committee of Enterprising Women program, and then invited her friends and neighbors to form a group in order to get ahead and improve their quality of life. The group is made up of 20 very hard-working, humble women who work every day to earn a living.
 The loan the group took out from Fundación Paraguaya was disbursed among them, and each member invested the money in their respective business. 
 One of the group members is Gloria, who sews high-fashion wedding dresses and evening gowns. Her work is impeccable and very valuable. She does very lovely embroidery and designs, so she has many clients. She used her loan to buy the materials she needs, like colored thread, beads for embroidery, and fabric. 
Each one of the group members works at their respective job to support their family:
1. Teresa P.: Grocery store 
2. Aurelia B.: Clothing sales
3. Blanca V.: Fast food sales
4. Gloria M.: Fashion designer
5. Laura B.: Fruit and vegetable sales
6. Edelida M.: Grocery store
7. Edith V.: Hardware store
8. Elva González: Fruit and vegetable sales
9. Mª Graciela Arzamendia: Food sales
10. Estelbina B.: Grocery store
11. Graciela R. Díaz: Food sales
12. Laura A.: Food sales
13. Mirna M.: Fashion designer
14. Del Rosario P.: Street vendor
15. Zoraida I.: Food sales
16. Nilda L.: Grocery store
17. Liz V.: Hardware store
18. Celsa O.: Fast food
19. Celia Z.: Fashion designer
20. Mª Ilda Z.: Food sales

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread and accessories

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La Sra. Blanca está casada  con el Sr. Roberto hace varios años tienen 4 hijos menores que aún están en la escuela primaria.
Juntos montaron una despensa en su casa que esta ubicado  en un barrio muy poblado de la zona, se iniciaron con un pequeño capital que consiguieron con otros trabajos que han realizaron anteriormente como asalariados.
Gracias al trabajo que están realizando están educando a sus hijos y comprando todas las necesidades de su hogar.
El Sr. Roberto además se la despensa trabaja como Moto taxista en su propio vehículo para ayudar a la Sra. Con los gastos de la casa.
Ella a demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos
texts.en:
Blanca has been married to Roberto for several years; they have 4 minor children that are still in elementary school. Together, they set up a grocery store in their home, which is located in a densely populated neighborhood of the area. They started out with a small capital investment that came from savings from prior salaried jobs. Thanks to their work, they are educating their children and buying what their household needs. Roberto, in addition, provides public transportation services with his own mototaxi in order to further help his wife with household expenses. She has shown herself to be a responsible and honest person with respect to the commitments she takes on.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted merchandise:  sugar, rice, pasta, baked good, dairy goods.

loans.name: Ndeye

texts.fr:
Madame Ndeye N. est une femme âgée de 50 ans. Elle habite a Bambilor et est membre de la caisse depuis janvier 2010. 
Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle évolue dans le commerce de légumes (tomate mil, carottes, etc.) depuis très longtemps. Elle pratique aussi la vente d’eau dans un robinet publique depuis 4 ans. Elle n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit. La gérance du robinet publique lui procure des ressources importantes et cette gérance elle l’a obtenu par le biais du chef de village. Madame N. a été victime d’un détournement de son encaisse mensuelle durant son absence par celui qu’elle avait confie la gestion. Par conséquent elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs pour payer son arriéré de facture. Ce crédit lui permettra de reprendre son activiste de vente d’eau aux familles environnantes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndeye N. is a 50 year-old woman who lives in Bambilor. She is married and has four children. She joined the credit union in January 2010 and has never taken out a loan. She has been selling vegetables (tomatoes, carrots, etc.) for a very long time. For the past four years, she has also been selling water from a public faucet. The management of the public water faucet was assigned to her by the chief of the village and provides her with significant revenues. Mrs. N. was embezzled of her monthly cash payments by the person she had asked to stand in for her while she was away. As a consequence, she is requesting a loan of 150 000 francs to settle her overdue bill. This loan will allow her to resume the sale of water to families in the neighbourhood.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reinforce her business

loans.name: Joram

texts.en:
Joram is a 27-year-old married man with a one-year-old child. He has a butcher shop in Nairobi which he has been running for three years. He sells mainly pork and chicken and employs two people.

Joram took his first loan of Kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya and increased his stock. He plans to take a loan of Kes 40,000 to buy eight pigs for Kes 32,000, ten chicken for Kes 6,000 and use Kes 2,000 for transportation costs.

Joram hopes to have a business which can effectively support his family. He describes himself as hardworking and committed to his work.

loans.use: To purchase eight pigs and ten chickens

loans.name: Candido

texts.es:
El Sr. Cándido es casado con la Sra. Maria tienen 2 hijas menores que aún son pequeñas están en la escuela primaria.
El se dedica a la venta de cubiertas y en el mismo lugar tienen  una despensa en donde venden mercaderías el por mayor.
El se dedica a esta actividad hace aproximadamente 10 años, El se inicio en esta actividad en forma ambulante hasta que consiguió un local para abrir su negocio.
Además de su actividad la Sra. Maria tiene un puesto de venta de ropas en el micro centro para que con sus ingresos le ayude a Cándido con los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijas.
El ha demostrado ser  una persona muy responsable con sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Cándido is married to Maria; they have two daughters, who are still little and go to elementary school. He sells retread tires but also has a wholesale products market. He has been in this line of work for about 10 years; at the beginning he did not have a fixed location from which to sell. Maria has a small clothing sales stand so that earnings from her sales can help Cándido meet household expenses and their daughters' educational expenses. He has shown himself to be a very responsible person with respect to his commitments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various merchandise to stock his store.

loans.name: Ope

texts.en:
Ope is 39 years old and married to a teacher. They have three children and their children are excelling in school.

Ope provides printing services to his customers in Ibadan. He is a hardworking man and he hopes to lift his business and family above poverty.

Ope hopes to expand his business and is requesting the loan of N160,000 to purchase more printing materials. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more printing materials

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata N. habite à Bambilor. Elle est âgée de 35 ans et mère de 3 enfants. En plus de ses enfants elle a aussi deux autres personnes en charge. Elle est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis janvier 2010. Elle pratique l’élevage depuis plus de 4 ans. Elle est aussi mère-assistante a la case des tout-petits. Elle gère une boutique. Elle a choisi l’activité d’élevage de poulet par  amour mais aussi a cause du fait que c’est une activité lucrative pour quelqu’un qui veut gagner sa vie. Elle sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs pour l’achat d’aliment concernant le démarrage, la croissance et  la finition pour 250 poussins. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices lui permettra d’avoir une certaine stabilité sociale.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata N. is a 35 year-old woman who lives in Bambilor. She has three children and two other people to care for. She is also a foster mother at the early childhood development center ("Case des Tout-Petits"). She joined the Bambilor credit union in January 2010. She has been breeding chickens for the past four years and manages a shop. She chose to raise chickens, not only because she loves it, but also because it is a profitable activity that helps her make a living. She is requesting a 400 000 francs loan to purchase feed to support the birth, growth and termination of 250 chicks. Increasing her revenues will allow her to achieve some social stability.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Mirian Gimenez

texts.en:
Mirian Gimenez is 18 years old, is married, and has a 2-year-old daughter. Mirian sells men's, women's and children's clothing, including pants, T-shirts, undershirts, shorts, etc. She has been in the same line of work for over a year, and has been able to help her husband with the household expenses and increase their quality of life.

Mirian learned about Fundación Paraguaya through advertisements in her neighborhood, and asked for help in purchasing her merchandise since she has many orders to fill. She is very thankful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the support they have given her.

loans.use: To purchase shirts, shorts, children's clothes, jeans and slacks

loans.name: Donathile

texts.en:
Donathile is 24 years old and is an unmarried mother with one child. She lives in Ruramba, a region of Nyaruguru situated in the Southern Province of Rwanda.

Donathile was originally a farmer before thinking on how she could start a small business so that her life situation could be improved. She thought of starting to sell a variety of goods in a shop and this is her third successful year in this business. Her shop is open from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Donathile, after these three years of experience, now has so many customers that she can’t even satisfy them. To end this, she needs to request a Kiva loan which will allow her to add a variety of requested goods such as beans, rice, sugar, etc. With this loan, she is planning to increase her sales and she hopes that her profits will also increase.

With these profits, Donathile will reinvest a portion in her business with the purpose of keeping her business sustainable.

loans.use: To buy additional goods including cosmetics

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a lovely and hard-working woman. She is determined to excel in her business and family life. To earn a living in Ibadan, she sells paints at wholesale and retail prices. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to be a major paint distributor in her city. She hopes for a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more paint to sell. She is 42 years old and married with four children. Her children are still dependent on her and they go to school. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more paint to sell

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en:
Godwin sells electronics and electrical materials at retail prices to his customers.  He has been in this business for a long time. He hopes to own an electronics company in the future.  

He is 45 years old and married with four children.  His wife sells building materials to support their home. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction with his customers. He is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more electronics to sell.  He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.en:
This group was formed by Mrs. Ramona C., a resident of the San Isidro neighborhood of the city of Coronel Oviedo. She found out about the program through the Mujeres Unidas group. She then invited her friends and colleagues from the local bus station, who decided to form a group in order to get ahead and improve their quality of life. The group is made up of 15 hard-working, humble women who joined together with the hope of improving their living conditions.

Each one has their own independent business activity according to their respective skills.  
One of the group members is Mrs. Ana Maria S., who sells snacks like empanadas (savory pastries) and milanesas (breaded meat), as well as some traditional Paraguayan foods like bori-bori (vegetable soup with balls of corn flour), Paraguayan soup (made from corn flour) and other meals. She used her loan to buy the ingredients she needs to prepare these foods, as well as several tools, like meat grinders and dough mixers.

loans.use: Buy mixers, meat grinders and ingredients like meat, vegetables and spices

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou G. est un jeune couturier de 31 ans qui habite à Bambilor. Il  a démarré son activité depuis 1992.Il en est à son premier crédit. C’est après avoir abandonner les études qu’il s’est oriente cette activité. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus dans cette  activité ce sont les relations  qu’il entretient avec la clientèle. Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs destine a l’achat de tissus qui vont servir a la confection  de prêts a porter. Ce crédit va lui permettre d’augmenter ses bénéfices et a mieux subvenir a ses besoins.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamadou G. is a 31 year-old tailor living in Bambilor. He started his business in 1992 after having left school. What he likes the most about this business is the relationships that he has with his customers. He is requesting a 100 000 francs loan to purchase fabrics to make ready-to-wear garments. This will be his first loan. It will allow him to increase his revenues and better meet his needs.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 37-year-old married father of two.  He sells sweet potatoes, potatoes, carrots and cabbage among other foodstuff in Kangemi open air market.  He has been in the business for five years and Faulu Kenya has really helped him plan his business.   He has requested Kes. 20,000 to buy potatoes, carrots, tomatoes and cabbage. He hopes to have a big business and have a wholesale stall for his products in the future.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Pedro Bautista

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan es casado con la Sra. Nidia ellos tienen 4 hijos mayores ya independientes ellos tienen sus propias casas.
Don Juan es Zapateros el tiene un local cito en el centro de la cuidad donde repara zapatos usados y vende zapatos nuevos.
El Sr. Juan es muy conocido en el lugar por su buen trabajo.-
Aprendió su oficio con su padre que también era zapatero .
El ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Juan is married to Nidia; they have 4 adult, independent children, who live in their own homes. Juan is a shoemaker; he has a shop downtown where he repairs used shoes and sells new ones. Juan is known for his good work. He learned his trade from his father, who was also a shoemaker. He has shown himself to be a very responsible and honest person with respect to his commitments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes and tools like: nails, leather, adhesives, etc.

loans.name: C 9454 Dufatanye Group

texts.en:
Gratien is 37 years old, and married. He has two children, ages 3 and 4.  Gratien is the president of a group called Dufatanye. Gratien and his group sell a variety of goods including second-hand of clothes and shoes etc… in the Gicumbi a region situated in the northern province of Rwanda. The business hours are from 7 AM to 5 PM every day.

After 6 years of experience in the business, Gratien and his team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their business through purchasing additional various sizes of shoes and clothes to satisfy their customers. With this loan, as it will allow them to increase their original investment,  they hope that their sales will be increased as well as the profits. Through the progress of the business, Gratien and his team have a hope for the future.

loans.use: A variety of goods including clothes, shoes etc for sale

loans.name: Marie Goreth

texts.en:
Marie Goreth was born in 1975. She is married and has two children,  the one was born in 1998, and the last one in 2004. Marie Goreth and her family live in the Gisozi, a region of Gasabo district, one of the districts of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.  Marie Goreth owns a small shop where she sells foodstuffs such as rice, con flour, beans, sugar and some cakes usually bought by children.  The business hours are from early in the morning until late in the evening hours every day except Sunday.

Marie Goreth is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase a large quantity of foodstuffs so that she can satisfy the demand of her customers.  Marie Goreth with these additional purchased foodstuffs for sale, she hopes to earn more profits which in turn will be used to reinvest in her business as well as taking care of her family.

loans.use: Purchasing more foodstuffs and cakes for sale

loans.name: Kudirat

texts.en: Kudirat sells body cream and groceries at retail prices. She loves this business because it is highly profitable. She is 50 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a businessman, and he also supports their home. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more body cream to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more body cream to sell

loans.name: Nasra

texts.en: Nasra H. is an entrepreneur and married woman. She runs a business selling cosmetic goods at her shop at Kombo Street at Dar es Salaam.  She purchases goods from wholesale and retail sales shops at Kariakoo's city market shopping center and sells them to retail customers. She meets her family's daily needs by selling the business goods. She plans to expand the business to a wholesale shop. She needs a loan of 1,000,000TZS to buy more goods

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Pius

texts.en: Pius is a 46-year-old married man with three children in school.  His wife is a primary school teacher while he does welding and owns a barber shop.  Formerly, he was a taxi driver.  He has been running his business for three years and employs two people.  As a member of Faulu Kenya, he has previously taken out two loans and plans to take another loan.  He has requested a loan of Kes.30,000 to buy welding materials.  He hopes to buy a piece of land in the future.  He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: Buy welding materials

loans.name: Fatai

texts.en: Fatai is 50 years old and married with six children. His children are excelling in their jobs and education.  His wife sells snacks to support their home. He makes a living selling electronics and CDs (compact discs). He hopes to own an electronics company in the future. He is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more electronics to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en: Wilfred M. is an entrepreneur and married man with three school children. He runs a business of keeping dairy cows in Yombo Buza ward in Dar es Salaam. He sells milk at wholesale and retail to customers for domestic and business consumption, such as in cafes and hotels. He has been in the business for six years and the business income enabled him to buy four more dairy cows and meet the daily needs of his family. He needs a loan of 1,200,000 TZS to expand the business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en:
Onesmus is a 36-year-old father of three children who attend school.  His wife is a farmer and also a business-lady.  He has a retail shop located in Mwala market in Machakos where he sells household goods.  He has been in the business for six years.  He also earns extra income from farming.  

Onesmus is a member of Faulu Kenya, and he plans to take a loan of Kes.20,000 to add stocks of radios, utensils and other kitchenware.  He hopes to buy more cows, which he feels will bring him more income in the future.  He dreams of having a wholesale shop selling household goods.

loans.use: Add stock of radios and kitchenware

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: C9454 Dufatanye Group

texts.en:
Gratien is 37 years old, married with 2 children who are 3 and 4 years old.  Gratien is the president of a group called dufatanye.  Gratien and his group operates the business of selling a variety of goods including second hand clothes, shoes etc in the Gicumbi, a region of Byumba situated in the northern province of Rwanda.  The business hours are from 7 AM to 5 PM every day.

After 6 years of experience in the business, Gratien and his team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their business through purchasing additional various sizes of shoes and clothes to satisfy their customers.  With this loan, as it will allow them to increase their original investment,  they hope that their sales will be increased as well as the profits.  Through the progress of the business Gratien and his team have a hope for the future.

loans.use: A variety of additional clothes and shoes for sale

loans.name: Boubacar Sidy

texts.fr: Monsieur Boubacar Sidy B. est un couturier yoffois qui habite dans le quartier de Ndenatte. Il  est  sociétaire de  la caisse de l’U-IMCEC Yoff depuis septembre 2009. Il est âgé  de 22 ans et exerce l’activité  de couturier  depuis 2002. C’est un métier qu’il a hérité de son père et pour lui  c’est le seul moyen de gagner sa vie, satisfaire ses besoins et aider ses parents. Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000frs pour compléter son épargne en vue d’acquérir une machine a coudre cornière. Ceci l’aidera a mieux rentabiliser son activité et répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle. L’augmentation de ses revenus va lui permettre de mieux assurer l’entretien de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Boubacar Sidy B. is a tailor and a native of Yoff living in the Ndenatte district. He has been a member of the Yoff UIMCEC credit union since September 2009. He is 22 years old and has been working as a tailor since 2002. He inherited this career from his father, and for him it is the only way of earning a living, meeting his needs and helping his parents. He is asking for a loan of 100,000 francs CFA which, combined with his savings, will go towards the purchase of an embroidery machine. This will help him make his business more profitable and meet his clients’ needs. With his increased income, he will be able to better ensure his family’s well-being.

Translated from French by Chelsea Rosendale, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 32 years old and married with four children, ages 12, 10, 8 and 4, with all four children currently attending school. She is a farmer in the Kisii region in western Kenya. She's been farming for six years and sells milk at the local market. She also earns supplementary income from small-scale tomato and maize production. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of a ready market for her products at all times.

Rose requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for KES 60,000 to purchase a chuff cutter. A chuff cutter is a device for cutting straw or hay into small pieces to feed cattle, saving a significant amount of time over doing it by hand. She says that the extra income from this loan will enable her to sell more milk to help pay for school fees, and also to improve the health of her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business to have ten good dairy cows for milk production.

loans.use: To buy a chuff cutter

loans.name: Andres

texts.en: Andres is 55 years old and married to Soriana Cabral, who helps him with the household chores.  They have five children together who are now grown up, and some of whom work with Andres in producing and selling charcoal.  Andres inherited his profession from his father, with whom he worked since he was very young.  Andres starts work at 5 a.m., traveling to local corner stores to sell his charcoal.  One of his sons helps him sell the product, while another produces it.  Andres is seeking the loan to purchase wood for his business.

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Naftali

texts.en:
Naftali is 56 years old and married with four children, ages 36, 28, 24 and 21. He is a farmer in the Kisii region in western Kenya and has been farming for over 15 years. His primary business is to sell milk at the local market, and he also earns income from selling tea leaves, tomatoes, onions, and cabbages. Naftali is also the owner of a posho mill, which is a device that grinds wheat and maize into flour. He says that the main challenge to his business is his lack of knowledge in good animal husbandry.

Naftali requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 45,000 to purchase a dairy cow, with insurance. He says that the extra income from this loan will go to providing for his family and improving their health. In the future he would also like to own an agrovet, a small agricultural store that sells drugs and supplies for livestock.

Naftali is looking forward to Juhudi Kilimo expanding in his area, as he believes it will help improve their living standards.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 27 years old, married and has one child. He has a taxi business and also practices dairy farming. He has been in the taxi business for six years. He feels that, through Faulu Kenya, he has become financially stable and he believes that Faulu Kenya is a bridge to success. He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy taxi spare parts, paint the taxi and buy new tires. He hopes to become a prominent businessman in Limuru area. He sees himself having a fleet of cars, buses and vans in the future.

loans.use: To buy spare parts, paint the taxi and buy new tires

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma K. is an entrepreneur and a married woman with two children in school. She runs a food shop in the Yombo Kiwalan Ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells varieties of good food, including rice, maize flour, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. She has been in the business for five years. 

Salma purchases the business goods from the city market business center and sometimes directly from wholesale suppliers. She managed to double her capital from the initial funding of T.shs 500,000 to 1,000,000 T.shs. She needs a loan of T.shs 1, 000, 0000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Nyaboke

texts.en:
Nyaboke is 36 years old. She is married and has four children, ages 19, 17, 15, and 13. Three of the children currently attend school. 

She is a farmer in the Kisii Region of Western Kenya. She's been farming for 16 years and sells milk at the local market as her primary source of income. Nyaboke also earns supplementary income by selling cabbage, potatoes, and bananas in her hometown. She says that the main challenges to her business are pests and diseases affecting the products, leading to poor yields.

She has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 45,000 to purchase a dairy cow. She says that the extra income from this loan will enable her to sell more milk and make additional profits to pay for her children's school fees. In the future, she would like to own more dairy cows for increased milk production.

Nyaboke thanks Juhudi Kilimo for helping people to obtain loans to improve their lives.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Sabitu

texts.en:
Sabitu sells beef. He purchases the cow and slaughters the cow to sell. In this picture, Sabitu just finished slaughtering the cow. He loves this business because of the profit he makes from it. He hopes to expand his business. 

Sabitu is 65 years old, married with four children. Sabitu’s wife sells jewelry to help her husband meet the basic needs of the family. He is requesting a loan of 70,000 nairas to purchase more cows to slaughter and sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cows

loans.name: Roca Blanca Group

texts.es:
Cascada, es un centro focal mediano situado muy cerca de una embotelladora de gaseosas llamada “Cascada”, muy famosa hace unos años.  La asociación comunal “Roca Blanca” esta en formación con el deseo de asociarse para solicitar crédito e impulsar sus negocios.
Los negocios son diversos, como  venta de víveres, taller de mecánica – soldador, tejido de mantas, venta de cosméticos, artesanìas en aguayo y madera, tejido de chompas y confección de buzos.

La señora Valentina C., casada con 4 hijos, 2 varones y 2 mujeres, desea iniciar este primer crédito para incrementar el capital de su negocio que es tejido de mantas.  

Estas mantas pasan por un proceso de tres pasos:  primero se teje la manta en sí, con el diseño que este de moda, despues de lograr un rectángulo de 70 centìmetros por 150 centímetros, la socia teje por el borde con un ganchillo haciendo un diseño especial de unos doce centìmetros, finalmente se añaden largos flecos, que con anticipación habían sido torcelados para rodear la manta.  Las mantas son vendidas en la zona 16 de Julio los jueves y dómingo, de 5 a 7 de la mañana.
texts.en:
Cascada is a medium-sized focal center located very near a soft-drink bottling plant called, "Cascada," that was very famous a few years ago. The "Roca Blanca" communal association is organizing itself with the goal to seek financing to push their businesses forward. The businesses are diverse: food sales, machine shop, welding, blanket weaving, cosmetics sales, multicolored woolen cloth and wood crafts, sweater weaving, sweatshirt making. Valentina C. is married and has 4 children: two boys and two girls. She wants to start her first loan in order to increase her working capital; she is a blanket weaver. These blankets go through a three-step process: first, the blanket itself is woven with whatever design is in fashion. Once a rectangle measuring 70x150 centimeters is attained, the member weaves the edges with a weaving hook making a special, 12 centimeter, design. Finally, long fringe, that had previously been knotted and twisted to encircle the blanket, is added. The blankets are sold in the 16 de Julio zone every Thursday and Sunday from 5am to 7 am.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cones and balls of wool.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is 55 years old and married with eight children between the ages of 2 and 27. Six of them are attending school. She is a farmer near Kisii in southwestern Kenya and has been farming for 16 years. She grows onions, cabbages and plants and sells them in the local market. She says that the main challenge to her business is the small market for her perishable goods.

Rael requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for 45,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that with the money from milk sales she can pay her children's school fees and have a healthy family. In the future, she hopes to acquire more training in dairy farming and expand to have five good dairy cows.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en: Sergei is married and has one grown-up daughter, Irina, and one teenage son, Evgeniy. Sergei runs a greenhouse and raises tomatoes and cucumbers. He started this business four years ago. Today he's got ten greenhouses and wants to add even more. He was able to purchase a mini tractor to cultivate the land. Last year his greenhouses were damaged because of heavy snow. He needs a loan of 10,000 hryvnia to purchase seven units of film to cover the damaged areas. Sergei is a hardworking person and enjoys his farming business very much.

loans.use: To purchase film to fix greenhouses

loans.name: Zulfa

texts.en: Zulfa R. is a married woman who runs a small business as a food vendor at Vingunguti ward in Dar es Salaam. She prepares and sells varieties of food for both cooked and fried food. She services many industrial manual workers and other small business people around the area. She purchases the business goods from wholesale and retail shops in Dar es Salaam. She has been in the business for three years and her plan is to open and run a café as her income grows. She needs a loan of TZS 800,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Monisola

texts.en: Monisola is 51 years old and married with three children. Her children are still dependent on her and they attend school. Her husband is a teacher and he also supports the home. She sells books at retail prices to her customers. She hopes that her bookstore will grower bigger in the future. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more books to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more books to sell

loans.name: Alexei

texts.en:
Alexei is married and has a two-year-old son.  He runs a family business growing tomatoes, cucumbers, and radishes in greenhouses. His wife and her parents help Alexei in this business. 

Alexei started this business seven years ago. The early grown vegetables are in high demand in this area and the business is successful. Last year Alexei bought a second piece of land and put one greenhouse there. He needs a loan of 10,000 UAH to build another one to use all the land.

Alexei's goal is to fix his house and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to build a new green house

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca is 41 years old and lives with her husband and youngest son.  Her other two children are grown up and live on their own.  Blanca learned her trade on her own, and as her neighborhood did not have a corner store to supply the community with basic items she decided to open one.  Currently, Blanca's corner store is one of the best stocked and attracts many clients due to it's central location and proximity to a popular spa.  The loan will be used to purchase sugar, noodles, flower, meat, oil and other products for her store.
texts.en:
Blanca is 41 years old and lives with her husband and youngest son. Her other two children are grown up and live on their own. Blanca learned her trade on her own, and as her neighborhood did not have a corner store to supply the community with basic items she decided to open one. Currently, Blanca's corner store is one of the best stocked and attracts many clients due to it's central location and proximity to a popular spa. The loan will be used to purchase sugar, noodles, flower, meat, oil and other products for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, noodels, flower, meat, oil

loans.name: Fe Y Amor 5 Group

texts.en:
Carmelina is the coordinator of her group Fe y Amor (Faith and Love), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the slums surrounding Santiago, a city famous for its production of tobacco and beef, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. As a single mother with her two children, she makes her home here in a simple structure.

Carmelina is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and having the opportunity to expand her business with low interest capital. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a beauty salon by purchasing a power generator. As you can imagine, this will be a large improvement in her beauty salon which is in an area where blackouts are common. She will use the profits to invest in her children's future by enrolling them in a private high school. Her long term goal is to save enough money to own her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: a power generator

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. María es casada con el Sr. Modesto  con 3 hijos, ella vive en un barrio muy conocido de esta ciudad.
