Ella tiene una peluquería y una  despensa bien  surtida que consiguió con mucho esfuerzo y la ayuda de su marido salieron juntos adelante.
Ella monto la peluquería para poder tener más ingresos en su hogar. Estudio con una amiga que le avía incentivado para poder tener una profesión.
Sus hijos le ayudan en los que aceres de la casa, para que ella pueda cuidar mejor de su negocio.
Su marido hoy día trabaja como taxista en el micro centró y así ayuda a la Sra. María con los gastos de la casa y los hijos.-
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y demuestra ser muy responsable con sus compromisos financieros.
texts.en:
María is married to Modesto; they have three children. She lives in a well-known neighborhood in this city. She has a beauty salon and a well-stocked store that she got through much effort and with her husband's help; they have succeeded together. She set up the beauty salon in order to have higher income for her home. She studied with a girl friend who motivated her to have a profession. Her children help her with household chores so that she can better tend to her business. Her husband works as a taxi driver and helps María with household expenses and the children. She is a very hard-working person and has shown herself to be very responsible with her financial commitments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy salon supplies like: shampoo, creams, hair dryers, etc.

loans.name: Jumoke

texts.en: Jumoke is a teacher and a dry cleaner. She combines these two jobs to enable her to support her family. She is married with 2 children, both of whom are excelling in school. Her youngest child is 6 years old. She hopes to expand her laundry business in the future. She is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more laundry soap. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more laundry soap

loans.name: Nueva Jerusalen Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. emprendimiento NUEVA JERUSALEN cuenta con una mesa directiva que esta conformada por:

La Presidenta es la Sra. Jenny, cliente antigua, madre soltera con 5 hijos 2 aun dependientes, , trabaja en la compra D. soya por cantidad para luego embolsarla y venderla al por menor  lleva en este oficio 10 años, vive en una casa como cuidante hace 8 años anhela con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo poder comprarse su propio terreno y luego construir su propia vivienda, con el dinero del credito comprara soya por mayor y luego poder enbolsarla por cantidad.

Como Tesorera esta la Sra. Guadalupe cliente antigua, madre soltera con 6 hijos 3 aun dependientes, , trabaja en la compra D. soya por cantidad para luego embolsarla y venderla al por menor  lleva en este oficio 5 años, vive en una casa alquilada hace 6 años anhela con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo poder comprarse su propio terreno y dejarles algún patrimonio a sus hijos, con el dinero del credito comprara soya por mayor y luego poder enbolsarla por cantidad. 

Como Secretaria esta la Sra. Viviana cliente nueva, madre D. una niña conviviente hace 3 años, promotora D. productos cosméticos hace 2 años, vive en una casa alquilada desD. hace dos años atrás, con la ayuda D. esposo pronto compraran un lote D. terreno para construir su propia casa y formar una familia estable con el dinero del credito comprara productos D. belleza que estan en promosion para despues venderlos a un precio normal.

Todas las socias son personas responsables y dinamcas la mayoria mantienen solas el hogar, utilizaran el destino del credito para la compra D. mercaderia y asi poder incrementar su capital D. trabajo.

Todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Board of Directors for the “Nueva Jerusalen” (New Jerusalem) Communal Bank consists of the following members:

Sra. Jenny is the President. She is a long-time client and a single mother of five children, two of whom are dependents. She buys soybeans in bulk, which she later packages and sells at retail. Jenny has been in this business for ten years. She lives in a house for which has been the caretaker for the past eight years. Through her hard work, Jenny hopes to buy land so that she can later build her own home. She will use the money from her loan to buy soybeans in bulk so that she can package them in large quantities.

Sra. Guadalupe is the Treasurer. She is a long-time client and a single mother of six children, three of whom are dependents. She buys soybeans in bulk, which she later packages and sells at retail. Guadalupe has been in this business for five years. She has been living in a rented house for the past six years. Through her hard work, Guadalupe hopes to buy land so that she can leave an inheritance for her children. She will use the money from her loan to buy soybeans in bulk so that she can package them in large quantities.

Sra. Viviana serves as the Secretary. She is a new client who has been in a common law marriage for three years and has a daughter. Viviana has been selling cosmetics for the past two years. She has been living in a rented house for two years. With the help of her husband, she hopes to soon buy land so that they can build a house and establish a stable family. She will use the money from her loan to buy beauty products that are on sale that she can later sell at regular prices.

All of the members are responsible and dynamic people. Most of them support their families alone. This loan will be used to buy merchandise as well as increase their operating capital. They are grateful to Kiva and Emprender for trusting them by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Hussen

texts.en: Hussen N. is married and a businessman. He runs a butcher shop in the Vingunguti ward of Dar es Salaam. He purchases the meat directly from wholesale suppliers and sells to retail customers. He has been in this business for five years and its income has enabled him to buy a plot of land for residential house construction and to meet his daily needs. He requires a loan of TZS 1,000,000 to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Tossivi

texts.fr: A. Tossivi est née en 1953 et vit depuis 25 ans à Hlacomey, à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à ODO Christian, un transporteur, Tossivi est mère de sept enfants dont seulement deux sont encore à sa charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Le couple vit ensemble avec ses enfants. Tossivi et son mari se partagent les dépenses familiales.  Tossivi mène comme activité la vente de charbon de bois en détail et en gros, elle vend également de l’huile végétale et de l’huile de palme. Tossivi vend ses produits à son domicile mais s’approvisionne à Bassila et à Pahou, tous deux des grands marchés du Bénin. N’ayant jamais fréquenté l’école, Tossivi exerce néanmoins son activité depuis environs 13 ans. Tossivi est une très bonne cliente de ALIDé car ayant reçu déjà sept prêts qui ont tous été bien remboursés.  Tossivi souhaite faire un approvisionnement en quantité suffisante pour pouvoir dégager une marge de bénéfice plus importante mais est limitée par les moyens financiers. C’est la raison pour laquelle Tossivi désire obtenir un huitième près auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Tossivi A. was born in 1953, and has been living in the Hlacomey district of Cotonou, Benin’s economic capital, for 25 years. Married to Christian Odo, a transport driver, Tossivi is the mother of seven children, only two of which she still supports. All of her children attend school. The couple lives together with their children. Tossivi and her husband share the family expenses. Tossivi’s business is selling wood charcoal, both retail and wholesale. She also sells vegetable and palm oil. Tossivi sells her products out of her own home, but she does her buying at Bassila and Pahou, two large markets in Benin. Though she never attended school, Tossivi has been managing her business for about 13 years. Tossivi is a great client of ALIDé, because she has received seven loans which have all been paid back. Tossivi would like to buy a quantity of stock large enough to increase her profit margin, but she is limited for financial reasons. This is why Tossivi would like to take out an eighth loan with ALIDé.

Translated from French by Chelsea Rosendale, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing 100-kg bags of wood charcoal and bottles of peanut and palm oil

loans.name: Felicial

texts.en: Felicial sells drinks and juice at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to expand her business. She is 42 years old and married with three children. Her husband is a civil engineer and he also supports the home. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction she has with her customers. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more drinks to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Catheline

texts.en:
Catheline is 44 years old and is married with four children who are of school age. She and her family live in Kicukiro, one of the districts of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Catheline is in the business of making windows and doors through joining metal items with a soldering machine. This is her second successful year in this business which she starts early in the morning, not finishing until late at 6 p.m. every day.

Catheline is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase more soldering machines and metal items so that she can make more windows and doors. Catheline, by the use of this Kiva loan, hopes that her number of customers will be expanded and her customers will be interested in buying her products as she will make more good quality doors and windows.

Through the expansion of her business, Catheline and her family have a hope for the future.

loans.use: To buy additional metal items and more soldering machines

loans.name: Wendy Lizet

texts.es: La Sra. Wendy es un cliente nueva que vive en la calle 27 de Cota Cota y tiene un negocio de venta de licores en la calle Sucre en el centro de la ciudad la señorita trabajo desde muy pequeña en el negocio de su mama que tiene una tienda en su mismo domicilio, hace un año su tia la Sra, Dina le dio a conocer una oportunidad de negocio por su zona ya que exactamente al frente de la licoreria existe una salon de eventos, ademas de  tres cuatro night clubs y ningun proveedor cerca, desde ese dia hasta la fecha Wendy atiende esta licoreria, ahora necesita un monto mas grande para comprar mas whisky y helados para tener un freezer y guardar hielos. En el presente año la señorita esta en tratativas para adquirir un local un poco mas grande en la esquina de la misma cuadra, es una persona responsable y trabajadora, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Wendy is a new client. She lives on the 27th of Cota Cota Street and she has a liquor store on Sucre Street in the center of the city. She has been working since she was very young, first in her mother's business which is a store in her mother's home. A year ago, her Aunt Dina told her about a business opportunity in her neighborhood. Right across from where the liquor store is located there is an event space and three or four nightclubs but at the time there was no place selling liquor. Since that day until now, Wendy has had her liquor store. Now she needs more capital in order to buy whiskey and a freezer where she can store ice. This year Wendy is in negotiations to move to a bigger space on the corner of the same block She is a responsible and hard-working person and she is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for having the confidence in her to offer her a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Eldridge, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy whiskey and a freezer

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Don Wilfredo es casado, padre de 4 hijos, 2 mayores de edad quienes le ayudan con el cuido de la finca y 2 menores de edad estudiando la primaria, habita en la comarca Salvadorita de Puerto Principe, jurisdiccion de Nueva Guinea, desde hace 35 años tiene como principal actividad la ganaderia y agricultura, está solicitando su 2do crédito a AFODENIC y espera ser beneficiado con el fondo kiva y realizar la  compra de dos vacas paridas, para tener la producción de leche, y poder comerciar productos lacteos y mejorar la raza lechera y de esta manera garantizar la alimentación y los ingresos económicos del nucleo familiar. Su finca presenta buenas condiciones tècnica para el desarrollo del hato, don Wilfredo es muy reconocido en su comunidad por su liderazgo, en su futuro espera mejorar la calidad de vida del nucleo familiar y aumentar su inventario ganadero.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is married and the father of 4 children: 2 of them are grown and help him take care of the ranch, and 2 are still in primary school. They live in Salvadorita County in Puerto Principe, in the jurisdiction of Nueva Guinea. For 35 years, Wilfredo's main occupation has been farming and ranching. He is requesting his second loan with AFODENIC and hopes to receive benefits from the Kiva fund so that he can purchase two cows which have given birth. This will allow him to produce milk on his farm, sell dairy products, and improve his dairy herd, thus ensuring that his family unit will have sufficient food and income. Wilfredo's ranch offers good technical conditions for the development of this herd. In his community, Wilfredo is highly respected for his leadership. In the future, he hopes to improve the quality of life for his family and increase his inventory of livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing milk cows

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with one teenage daughter. She owns a small retail business selling women's clothing. Her kiosk is located at a small market in Melitopol town. She makes about 4,000 hryvnia (UAH) per month. Svetlana started this business 10 years ago. She offers good quality products to her clients at affordable prices. Svetlana has many repeat clients that come back to purchase new clothing from her.

Svetlana would like to receive a loan of 13,000 UAH to increase her assortment, especially of her spring inventory. She hopes to increase her income and purchase kitchen appliances for her apartment.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of clothing

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
La Sra. Reyna esta casada, vive en la localidad de brecha 7 Platanillo, ubicado en el municipio de la guardia, su actividad principal es la venta de abarrote en su propio domicilio, su esposo se dedica al transporte publico, tienen 3 hijos en edad escolar lo cual ella se dedica a cuidarlos y atender su venta y así apoyar a su esposo en los ingreso del hogar, es una persona responsable y dinamica que siempre esta al tanto de sus hijos y de su negocio. El dinero del credito lo utilizara para la compra de productos de primera necesidad para poder surtir su tienda y tener mejor atencion a los clientes.

Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en otorgacion del credito
texts.en:
Mrs. Reyna is married and she lives in the 7 Platanillo community, located in the municipality of De la Guardia. Her principal work is selling groceries from her home. Her husband works in public transportation. They have three school-age children and Reyna takes care of them as well as tending to her store. In this way she is able to help her husband with the household income. She is a responsible and dynamic person who is dedicated to her children and her business. She will use the loan to buy more basic products in order to stock her store and to provide better service to her customers. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have shown her by offering her a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Eldridge, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Luis Isaias

texts.es: Luis Isaias es casado, padre de 3 niños menores estudiando la primaria, habita en la zona # 6 del municipio de Nueva Guinea, tiene 13 años de laborar como pequeño comerciante, esta solicitando a la instituciòn de AFODENIC su primer crèdito esperando ser beneficiado con el fondo kiva para mejorar su casa cambiandole el techo y construyendo la cocina y asi mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, su mayor sueño es mejorar poco su casa de habitaciòn y de esta forma darles un lugar digno y bonito a su familia. Luis Isaias es bien reconocido en su comunidad por sus buenas costumbres, y por ser muy trabajador.
texts.en:
Luis Isaias is married and the father of 3 children in primary school. He lives in Zone # 6 of the municipality of Nueva Guinea. For 13 years, he has worked as a small-scale businessman. He is requesting his first loan from the AFODENIC organization, hoping to receive benefits from the Kiva fund in order to improve his home. He wants to replace the roof and construct a kitchen, thus improving his family's living conditions. His greatest dream is to make some improvements to the home where he lives, so that he can provide his family with an attractive and dignified place to live. Luis Isaias is well-recognized in his community for his good habits, and he is very hard-working.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replacing the roof and constructing a kitchen

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en: Cesar is 48 years old and lives with his mother and two children, ages 12 and 9, who are in school.  Cesar has four cows, and produces and sells milk. For the last 17 years, he has started work every day at 4 a.m. milking the cows and then traveling throughout the city selling milk door-to-door.  Previously, he worked in Argentina in construction, but since 1992 he has been in Paraguay working in his current profession.  He is seeking the loan to enable him to purchase a milking cow as demand for his milk is high due to its excellent quality and his good service.

loans.use: Purchase a milking cow

loans.name: Ubaldina

texts.es:
La Sra. Ubaldina vive en la localidad de brecha 7 Platanillo, ubicado en el municipio de la guardia, su actividad principal es la venta de pan de trigo en su propio domicilio, su esposo hace unos meses fue encontrado muerto y fue un golpe fuerte para toda la familia superar la muerte del Padre y esposo por lo tanto quedo como única responsable de llevar adelante su hogar, tiene tres hijos todavía a su cargo los cuales estan en edad escolar, por lo tanto tiene que trabajar en su propio domicilio para así ayudar a sus hijos que también trabajan para apoyar a su madre, uno de los deseos de la Sra. Ubaldina es ver a sus hijos profesionales, es una persona responsables y trabajadora. Con el dinero del credito comprara harina de trigo por mayor y otros productos para la elaboracion del sus ricos panes.

La Sra. Ubaldina esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sra. Ubaldina lives in the neighborhood of Brecha de Platanillo, located in the town of La Guardia. She sells wheat bread out of her home. A few months ago her husband was found dead. The loss to the family of their father and husband was a stunning blow. Ubaldina was left alone to maintain her home and support the three school-age children who help her. One of her wishes is to see her children become professionals.

Ubaldina is a responsible and hardworking person. With the money she is requesting, she plans to buy wheat flour in bulk and other products for making her delicious breads. She is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for trusting her with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wheat flour in bulk & other ingredients

loans.name: Rosa Guadalupe

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cochapamba se encuentra formado por un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras que siempre buscan la manera de salir adelante y ven en cada oportunidad una forma para seguir creciendo personalmente y a nivel familiar, este banco está ubicado  en la comunidad Cochapamba en  la parroquia El Valle al sureste de la ciudad de Cuenca, localidad muy reconocida por su producción de maíz  y su atractivo turística la laguna llena de Totora.

Rosa B. es socia del Banco Comunal Cochapamba se caracteriza por ser una mujer  muy colaboradora y sociable manteniendo  una gran amistad con todas sus amigas del banco comunal con apenas veinte y tres años vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo de cinco años, su pareja trabaja de lunes a viernes en la construcción y los fines de semana hace fletes en su camioneta, gracias al esfuerzo mancomunado lograron construir su casa propia.

Ella  se dedica a la cría y venta  de pollos pelados bajo pedido y ganado vacuno,  lleva dos   años realizando esta actividad para ello los compra en crías los tiene un tiempo y ya grandes los vende en la feria libre o a sus vecinos de la comunidad.

Rosa  tiene cuatro años trabajando con los prestamos de la fundación y fue Gladys Arpi otra socia del bankito quien la incentivó a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres emprendedoras, nos comenta que los créditos le han beneficiado mucho para terminar su casa y  con el nuevo préstamo va a comprar más pollos, ganado y alimento para seguir e incrementar  su negocio para hacer realidad su  gran sueño de salir adelante y entregarle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The Cochapamba communal bank is made up of a group of enterprising women who are always looking for ways to succeed in life and who see in every opportunity a way to continue growing both personally and at their family level. This bank is in the community of Cochapamba, El Valle parish, in the southeast part of Cuenca. This area is well-known for its corn production and its tourist attraction: its lake full of bullrushes. Rosa B. is a member of the Cochapamba communal bank. She is a very sociable and cooperative woman; she maintains deep friendships with the other members of th bank. She is just 23 years old and lives with her life partner and her 5 -year-old son. Her husband works in construction Monday through Friday and on weekends he makes deliveries in his van. Thanks to their joint effort, they have managed to build their own home. She raises and sells dressed chickens on order and cattle. She has been in this line of work for two years. She buys them when they are chicks, raises them for a period of time and, once grown, sells them in the free markets or to her neighbors. Rosa has been working with loans from the foundation and it was Gladys Arpi, another member of the bank, that motivated her to be part of this group of enterprising women. She tells us that the loans have been of great use to her because she was able to finish her house and the new loan will allow her to buy more chickens, cattle and feed to continue and grow her business. Her greatest wish is to succeed and give the best to her son.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicks, cattle and animal feed.

loans.name: Juana Nelly

texts.es:
Juana V. de 63 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento solo cuenta con luz y agua como servicio básico. 

Juana empezó cocinando desde muy pequeña con su mama, cuando dejo de tener un empleo estable decido tener su propio restaurante.

Juana ahora trabaja desde las 10h00 hasta las 15h00 todos los días, algunas de las comidas que prepara es arroz con pollo, tallarines, carmes con menestras. Una de las complicaciones que tiene son las lluvias de la temporada.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, piedras, arena para construir y adecuar mejor su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener un buen restaurante.
texts.en:
Juana V. is 63 years old. She lives in the outskirts of Guayaquil along the Perimetral ring road. Her house is made of cement and has only basic electrical and water connections. Juana started cooking alongside her mother when she was very young. When she no longer had a stable job, she decided to open her own restaurant. Now, Juana works every day from 10 in the morning until 3 in the afternoon. The meals she prepares include chicken with rice, noodles, and beef with beans or lentils. One of the complications she is facing is the heavy seasonal rain. With the loan, she would like to buy cement, stones and sand to construct and equip her business more effectively. In the future, she would like to operate a good restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, sand and stones to reinforce her restaurant

loans.name: Leandra

texts.es: Leandra, tiene 65 años, es viuda y tiene tres hijas de las cuales todos dependen de ella. Leandra forma parte del banco comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” de la Asociación Arariwa. Leandra alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención de su tienda de abarrotes, ella nos cuenta que los domingos vende en el mercado de Huancarari y de lunes a viernes vende golosinas en la Plaza de Armas de Huancarani de forma ambulatoria. Ya son dos años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella requiere el préstamo de los 700 soles, que invertirá en comprar comestibles como arroz, azúcar, fideos, gaseosas y leche. Leandra se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Leandra is 65 years old. She is widowed and has three daughters who are dependent on her. Leandra is a member of the community bank "Once de Mayo - Huancarani" of the Arariwa association. Leandra alternates between doing housework and taking care of her grocery store. She tells us that on Sundays she sells at the Huancarani market and Mondays through Fridays she sells candies as a street vendor at Huancarani's Plaza de Armas. She has dedicated herself to this business for two years and things have gone well for her thanks to the determination with which she does her work. She is requesting a loan of 700 soles (PEN) which she will invest in buying groceries such as rice, sugar, pastas, soft drinks and milk. Leandra is thankful for the opportunity offered to her through this medium so she is committed to making payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries such as rice, sugar, pastas, soft drinks and milk.

loans.name: El Milagro Group

texts.en:
In the city of Paraguarí, 15 kilometers from the neighborhood of San Roque, a group of women met in order to form a committee and take out a loan. They wanted to hear more about the program, and chose to join because of the various benefits afforded to them by the program. 
 The group is call El Milagro (“The Miracle”), and is currently in its 9th loan cycle, with an excellent credit rating. The group is made up of 19 hard-working women, who strive their hardest to improve their quality of life, both for themselves and for their families. All of the group members are hard-working women and have invested their loans in their respective businesses. 
One of these women is Mrs. Dionicia C., who sells “yuyo” remedies (natural herbs used in teas for certain ailments).  She sells these remedies in the local market, where she has a small stand. She starts working very early each morning in order to offer her products to her clients. Her work requires a lot of sacrifice, but she is grateful for her job, because it helps support her family and allows her children to go to school and get ahead in life. She is thankful to Fundación Paraguaya for this loan, which she will use to buy certain products her clients have requested, like natural skin creams, natural cough syrups and other items.

loans.use: Buy natural skin creams, cough syrups and other products.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
El Sr. Moisés vive en la localidad Santa Rita municipio de El Torno, su actividad principal es el servicio de transporte de personas con su mototaxi, tiene como segunda actividad la venta de ganado los fines de semana, lo cual le ayuda para poder mantener su familia, su esposa con la cual tienen 2 hijos solo se dedica a los labores del hogar, no tienen domicilio propio por lo que vive en la casa de su hermano, como portero, ya que a viajado al exterior. Uno de sus deseos es de tener una casa propia y tambien ver a sus hijos profesionales. Con el dinero del credito comprara otra motocicleta ya que la que tiene esta con algunas fallas y lo que el desea es brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Esta agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sr. Moisés lives in the Santa Rita neighborhood in the town of El Tomo. He provides passenger transport services in his motorcycle taxi. He also has a side business selling livestock on the weekends, which helps him support his wife and two children. They do not own a home so they live at his brother’s house and his wife takes care of the domestic work. When he was a soccer goalkeeper, he had the chance to travel outside of the country. Among his wishes are to have his own house and see his children become professionals.

With the money he is requesting, Moisés will purchase another motorcycle since the one he currently has experienced numerous mechanical failures. He hopes to provide better service to his customers.

Moisés is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for trusting him by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Has Lo Justo Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina” Has lo Justo “ están en el Quinto Ciclo   con 18  integrantes , es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias  y responsable entre ellas , las mismas poseen un ahorro de gs 3.575.470 gs.
Cada una de las integrantes retira un monto para destinar a la actividad al cual se dedica. Por ejemplo la Señora Clotilde Martiñez Quien abrió una despensa después de formar parte del comité, y actualmente le va muy bien tiene muchos clientes y nos comenta que ayuda mucho con los gastos de la casa. 
A la señora nos ayuda Clotilde tiene varios hijos quienes le ayudan a ella para atender la despensa y así ella también realiza las labores de la casa.
Se citan las actividades que las demás integrantes realizan:
 1
Felicia N.
 Venta de Frutas y Gallinas
2

4

Venta de Frutas.
9

Venta de Ropas
10

11

13

Venta De Verdura.
14

Venta de Comida
15

18
Emiliana R.
Venta de Bebidas

loans.use: Purchasing staple goods: rice, sugar, flour, oil, fruits, vegetables, meats, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Felix Ignacio

texts.es: Don Feliz Ignacio es pequeño productor que habita en la comarca La Tigra, El Almendro, junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa Deysi, su hija mayor Anielka que es casada, Josué y Mariana que son menores de edad y estudian la primaria en la comarca La tiegra, esta familia trabaja en la unidad de producción de la finca en coordicion con don Feliz, el realiza su actividad ganadera desde muy pequeño, de esta forma a luchado por obtener su propio inventario de ganadero y su finca la cual presenta buenas condiciones técnica, su mayor sueño es tener un buen inventario ganadero, esta solicitando su 3er credito y espera ser beneficiado con el fondo KIVA para comprar terneros de desarrollo  los cuales engordaria para comercializarlos a un mejor precio y obtener ganancias que le permitan mejorar la calidad de vida del núcleo familiar, Feliz Ignacio se caracteriza por ser un hombre responsable, honesto, con alto liderazgo en la comarca.
texts.en:
Feliz Ignacio is a small producer that lives in the La Tigra, El Almendro region. He lives with his family: his wife Deysi; his oldest daughter Anielka, who is married; and Josué and Mariana who are minors and attend grammar school in the La Tiegra region. The family works together with Feliz on the land. Feliz has been raising livestock since he was young. He has fought to obtain his own inventory of livestock and his land which has good technical conditions. His biggest dream is to have a good inventory of livestock. He is requesting his third loan and hopes to be a beneficiary of KIVA. He will use the loan to buy calves which he will raise for commercialization. The profits will allow him to improve his family's quality of life. Feliz Ignacio is known for being responsible, honest and a leader in the region.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves.

loans.name: Familia Unida De Inversiones 6 Group

texts.en:
Justino is the coordinator of his group Familia Unida D. Inversion (United Family of Investments), and his story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. His group is located in the slums surrounding Santiago, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home here in a simple structure with his long-term partner and their two children.

Justino is excited to be taking his third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and expanded his business. He plans to use this loan to invest in his small colmado (convenience store) by supplying it with the basics such as rice, beans, cooking oil and sugar. He will use the profits to invest in his children's future by purchasing their school supplies. Additionally, he plans to save towards his goal of someday owning a supermarket. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: beans, rice, cooking oil and sugar

loans.name: Emakulata

texts.en: Emakulatha K. is an entrepreneur who is married with three children, one in secondary school and two in primary school. She runs a grocery business selling alcoholic and soft drinks. She purchases her goods from wholesale suppliers and agencies. She has been in this business for five years and its income enables her to pay school fees, meet daily family demands and complete house repairs. She needs a loan of TZS 1,000,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: 3 De Febrero Group

texts.es:
El Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación se encuentra en la zona de Exaltación, en la ciudad de El Alto, que a su vez le debe su nombre a la Virgen de la Exaltación.  En esta zona se formó el grupo “3 de febrero”, 9 mujeres trabajadoras esperan recibir un crédito para mejorar los negocios.  Las clases de la escuela han comenzado y las socias manifiestan que como madres, deben trabajar más  para responder a las necesidades de sus hijos.

Los negocios son variados: Transporte público, venta de material escolar, confección de mantas, venta de verduras y vajilla.

En el caso de la presidenta Fanny C. M., es una joven de 19 años de edad, muy entusiasta y llena de vitalidad que ha terminado el colegio el año pasado y ahora piensa que mientras inicia las clases en la Normal (Educación superior para formación de Profesores de colegio), ella estará gustosa de guiar a la asociación comunal.

Los últimos años ha tenido el negocio de venta de papa a los restaurantes y pensiones.  Tambien, tiene un puesto en la zona 16 de julio que comparte con su  madre para la venta de mochilas.

Por ahora está muy interesada en fortalecer su negocio pues tiene a su cargo una hijita de un año, con quien es feliz.  Su situación de madre y padre al mismo tiempo no le limita a realizar sus actividades.
texts.en:
The Community Center of Villa Exaltación is located in the District of Exaltación, which was named after Our Lady of the Exaltation. In this district, the February 3rd Group was formed by nine hardworking women who hope to receive a loan to improve their businesses. Since school has started and the members are also mothers, they say that they must work harder in order to meet the needs of their children.

The businesses represented are diverse. They include public transportation, school supply sales, manufacture of blankets, vegetable sales, and dinnerware sales.

Fanny C. M. is 19 years old and serves as president of the group. She is enthusiastic and full of vitality. Now that she completed high school last year, she is considering starting classes at normal school (a higher education program designed to train school teachers). Fanny is happy to be leading her Community Association. In recent years, she has managed a business selling potatoes to restaurants and boarding houses. Fanny also has a place in the July 16th District where she and her mother sell backpacks. She is now interested in strengthening her business because she is responsible for a one year old daughter, who is happy. Her role of being both mother and father to her child has not limited her in pursuing her activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
La Sra. Fanny vive en la localidad de Brecha 7 platanillo ubicado en el municipio de la Guardia distante a 20  km. De la ciudad de Santa Cruz, no cuenta con domicilio propio por tal motivo se encuentra viviendo en la casa de  su madre, tiene un hijo pequeño, su esposo se encuentra trabando en España, y esta en tramite de divorcio, lo cual se le hace mas dura la vida fue una situacion dificil pero ella sigue adelante a pesar de todo ya que tendrá que criar sola a su hijo; su actividad principal es la crianza de chancho, la cual es su única fuente de ingreso. El dinero del credito lo utilizara para la compra de alimento balanceado para los animales, para alimentarlos mejor y asi poder venderlos mas caros. 
Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgaciondel credito.
texts.en:
Fanny lives in Brecha 7 Platanillo in the La Guardia municipality, which is 20 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz. She does not own her own home; she lives in her mother's house. She has a small son and her husband is working in Spain. She is in the middle of divorce proceedings which makes her life even more difficult. It was a difficult situation but she continues to move forward despite everything since she will have to raise her son alone. Her main commercial activity is raising pigs; this is her sole source of income. She will use the loan funds to buy nutritionally balanced feed for the pigs so that she can nourish them better and be able to sell them for a higher price. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Bose

texts.en:
Bose sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to expand her business in the future. 

Bose is 35 years old and married with three children. Her eldest child is 14 years old. Her children are still young and they depend on her. Her husband is a welder and he also supports the home. 

Bose is requesting a loan of 70,000 nairas to purchase more groceries to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Caminando Con Jesus Group

texts.en: Mercedes plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a colmado (small corner store) by purchasing the basics including rice, beans, oil and sugar. She is the coordinator of her group Caminando Con Jesus ("Walking with Jesus") and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the slums surrounding Santiago, a city famous for its tobacco and beef production and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. Mercedes is excited to be taking out her first loan with Esperanza because of the opportunity to grow her business with low interest capital. She will use the profits to invest in constructing her home which is currently incomplete. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, oil and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es: Mayra es casada, tiene 3 hijos en edad escolar, habita en la zona # 6 de Nueva Guinea, desde hace 10 años trabaja como pequeña comerciante de ropa, cometicos y zapato, sale a vender sus productos a todas las comuidades del municipio, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien asume los gastos del hogar. Esta solicitando su primer credito a la institución de AFODENIC esperando ser beneficiada con el fondo KIVA, para realizar mejoras en su casa de habitacion, pues necesita construir un dormitorio para sus  niños con el objetivo de mayor comodidad y privacidad a sus hijos. Mayra se caracteriza por ser un mujer trabajadora, emprendedora,  dedicada a su trabajo e hijos, su mayor sueño es tener una casa con las condiciones adecuada para que sus hijos se desarrollen en un ambiente agradable.
texts.en:
Mayra is married and has three children who are in school. She lives in District #6 of New Guinea. For ten years, Mayra has managed a small business selling clothing, cosmetics, and shoes to the communities within her town. She has the support of her husband, who takes care of the household expenses.

She is requesting her first loan from AFODENIC and hopes to be the beneficiary of KIVA funds in order to make improvements to her house. Mayra needs to a build a bedroom for her children to make them more comfortable and give them privacy. She is known for being a hardworking, enterprising woman who is dedicated to her children. Her greatest wish is to have a home with adequate conditions so that her children can develop in a pleasant environment.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a bedroom for her children

loans.name: Paz Y Amor Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Paz y Amor, inicia su 16 ciclo con 24 socias. Las socias son D. la comunidad D. Huayllapampa que se ubica a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes en general, fabricación D. ladrillos, verduras, carne, cochinilla, frutas, tara, bebidas, comida. 

Como es el caso D. la señora Guillermina que es casada, tiene 41 años y 1 hijo, Guillermina tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, Guillermina necesita un préstamo D. 300 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz.

Mientras que Lucia es casada, tiene 43 años y 4 hijos, Lucia se dedica a la fabricación D. ladrillos artesanales, sus ventas los realiza en el mismo lugar, lucia necesita un préstamo D. 300 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago D. los peones.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 10,650 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, verduras, carnes, frutas, tara, cochinilla, leña y para el pago D. peones.

Los sueños D. las socias son ampliar sus negocios, sus hijos culminen sus estudios, compra un carro y construir su casa.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Paz y Amor” (Peace and Love) is starting its 16th loan cycle with 24 members who are from the community of Huayllapampa, which is located 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho.

The members are engaged in different businesses selling groceries, bricks, vegetables, meat, cochineal (an insect used in making red fabric dye), fruit, tara (a plant extract that has various uses), beverages, and prepared foods.

Such is the case with Sra. Guillermina. She is 41 years old, married, and has one child. Guillermina has a store in her home where she sells groceries. She needs a loan of 300 soles in order to buy rice.

Lucia is 43 years old, married, and has four children. She manufactures and sells handmaD. bricks from the same location. Lucia needs a loan of 300 soles in order to pay her workers.

The members need loans of different amounts ranging from 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, to 900 soles for a total of 10,650 soles to the entire Communal Bank. The funds will be used to buy rice, vegetables, fruit, tara, cochineal, firewood, and also pay laborers’ wages.

The members dream of expanding their businesses, helping their children finish their education, buying a car, and building their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Zoila Beatriz

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cochapamba se encuentra formado por un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras que siempre buscan la manera de salir adelante, este banco está ubicado  en la comunidad Cochapamba en  la parroquia El Valle al sureste de la ciudad de Cuenca localidad muy reconocida por su producción de maíz  y su gran atractivo turístico la laguna de Totora.

Zoila tiene 36 años de edad vive en la comunidad  San Isidro sector de Chilcapamba con su esposo de oficio albañil y con su única hija de trece años, con el esfuerzo y mucho trabajo pueden contar con su casa propia que era uno de sus sueños.

 Zoila  trabaja en  una empresa de limpieza desde hace un mes su  horario de trabajo es de  8 a 12h00,  anteriormente ya trabajó en ella por casi tres años pero renunció por una calamidad doméstica y como sus jefes sabían la situación por la que estaba pasando le permitieron regresar. Además de esta actividad también se dedica a la cría de cuyes, chanchos, gallinas tanto para el consumo personal como para la venta en su comunidad.

Se encuentra en el segundo ciclo gracias a su prima política la que la motivó a formar parte del equipo de mujeres emprendedoras y  con el crédito solicitado va a comprar cemento y arena para enlucir las paredes de su casa y construir un baño.

Su gran sueño es ver a su  hija salir adelante en los estudios y que llegue a ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
The Cochapamba Communal Bank was formed by a group of enterprising women who always look for ways to get ahead. This bank is located in the community of Cochapamba in El Valle Parish, which is southeast of the city of Cuenca. This area is known for its production of corn and its great tourist attraction, the Totora Lagoon.

Zoila is 36 years old and lives in the community of San Isidro in Chilcapamba with her husband, who works as a mason, and their three year old daughter. After much work and with great effort, she was able to fulfill her dream of owning a home.

Zoila has been working for a cleaning company for the past month. Her work schedule is from 8:00 to 12:00. She had previously worked for this company for almost three years, but resigned due to personal problems. Her bosses were aware of her situation, so they allowed her to return. In her addition to her job, Zoila raises guinea pigs, pigs, and chickens both for personal consumption and to sell in her community.

Zoila is participating in her second loan cycle thanks to her cousin who convinced her to join this team of enterprising women. With the loan she requested, she plans to buy cement and sand for plastering the walls of her house and to build a bathroom. Her ambition is to see her daughter get ahead in school and become a successful professional.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement & sand to plaster the walls of her house and build a bathroom

loans.name: Nilba

texts.es:
Nilba es una madre de familia de 27 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de un año de edad en el sector Colector del distrito de San José, ubicado a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la ganadería desde hace seis años, tiene actualmente seis vacas de las cuales cuatro están produciendo leche, la leche que producen la vende a una empresa acopiadora que visita el lugar y que se las compra a 0.90 céntimos el litro. Este negocio es de mucha ayuda para el sostenimiento de su familia, ya que lo que su esposo gana como taxista no es suficiente para solventar los gastos familiares.

Adicionalmente, Nilba siembra forraje para sus animales en una pequeña extensión de terreno cercana al área donde vive. Ella desea comprar una nueva vaca que le permita aumentar su producción y así poder seguir sacando adelante a su familia, durante algunos meses ha estado ahorrando dinero, pero lo que actualmente tiene no es suficiente para lograr su objetivo. Por eso se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su mayor anhelo es darle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida. Nilba es una mujer trabajadora y que gusta mucho de lo que hace. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus cuotas. En la fotografía aparece junto a su hijo mostrandonos la leche que sus vacas han producido durante el dia y que espera ser recogida.
texts.en:
Nilba is a 27 year old mother who lives with her husband and one year old son in the area of Colector in the District of San José, which is located twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Nilba has been raising cattle for six years. Of the six cows that she currently owns, four are producing milk. She sells the milk to a collection business that comes to her farm and purchases the milk for 0.90 PEN per liter. Nilba’s milk business has been a great help in supporting her family. Her husband works as a taxi driver and his earnings are not enough to cover the family expenses.

In addition, Nilba grows fodder for her animals in a small plot of land near her home. She wants to buy another cow so that she can increase her milk production and continue to move her family forward. Nilba has been setting aside money for a few months, but she still does not have money to carry out her objective. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles.

Her greatest wish is to give her child a better life. Nilba is a hardworking woman who enjoys what she does. She has previously worked with our Institution and demonstrated that she is a timely and responsible client when it comes to making her payments. Nilda appears in the photograph with her son and is showing us the milk that her cows have produced and is waiting to be collected.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Said

texts.en: Said M. is an entrepreneur and married man. He runs a business purchasing and selling goats and sheep at the Vingunguti auction city center. He purchases from the wholesale animal suppliers and sells retail for slaughtering. He also sometimes sells to farmers. He has been in the business for three years and has managed to expand the business from purchasing five goats up to twenty per month. He is requesting a loan of 700,000 Tanzanian shillings to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Floriza

texts.es:
Floriza es socia del Banco Comunal Las Brisas.
Floriza es soltera, tiene 22 años y 1 hijo, Floriza vende golosinas de manera ambulatoria en un paradero de transporte publico, además los días domingos viaja a la feria de Acosvinchos en donde vende ropa.
Floriza necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas.
Los sueños de Floriza son tener una tienda mayorista de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Floriza is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Brisas” (The Breezes). She is 22 years old, single, and has one child. Floriza sells candy as a street vendor at a public bus stop. In addition, she travels every Sunday to the fair in Acosvinchos to sell clothing.

Floriza needs a loan of 800 soles in order to buy candy. Her dream is to open a wholesale grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy to sell

loans.name: C2343 Abadatenguha Group

texts.en:
Petronille is 25 years old and is married with two children, the first being 2 years of age and the other 6 years. Petronille and her family live in the Gasabo district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda where her business is located. Petronille is the leader of her group which contains five people, all of whom are women.

Petronille has two years of experience in the business of selling fruits and vegetables; her business is very organized. She is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more fruits and vegetables to attract more customers.

Petronille hopes that this loan will change her family situation by enabling her to earn enough for their basic needs. Her business is open every day from five in the morning to two in the afternoon, except on Sunday.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nelly Antonia

texts.es:
Nelly es socia del Banco Comunal Las Brisas.
Nelly es casada, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Nelly es accionista de una empresa que presta servicios de mantenimiento, limpieza, a diferentes instituciones, Nelly es la gerente de la empresa.
Nelly necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de materiales de limpieza.
Los sueños de Nelly son ampliar su empresa a nivel nacional y tener otra empresa de otro giro
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Brisas” (The Breezes). She is 37 years old, married, and has two children. Nelly is a co-owner of a business that provides maintenance and cleaning services to different institutions. She is also the manager of the company.

Nelly needs a loan of 1000 soles in order to buy cleaning products. Her dreams are to expand her business nationally and start another business in a different industry.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cleaning products

loans.name: Yola   Marcelina

texts.es:
LA SRA. YOLA ES UNA CLIENTE ANTIGUA, MUY CUMPLIDA SIN DIAS  DE ATRASO MOSTRANDO SU RESPONSABILIDAD, ELLA ESTA CASADA CON DON ANASTACIO, SU ESPOSO ES CHOFER PROPIETARIO DE RADIO TAXI, TRANSPORTE URBANO, TIENE UNA HIJA MENOR, SU PUESTO DE VENTA SE ENCUENTRA EN LA CEJA, A UNOS PASOS DEL PUENTE CEJA-RELOJ.  LA SRA. VENDE LA HOJA DE COCA POR MENOR QUE LO ADQUIERE DEL MERCADO DE LA HOJA DE COCA EN VILLA FATIMA (LA COCA ES UN PRODUCTO TRADICIONAL DE BOLIVIA LO USABAN DESDE LA EPOCA INCAICA MUCHA GENTE CONSUME LA HOJA DE COCA PORQUE ALIVIA EL CANSANCIO, TAMBIEN PARA MATES Y COMO MEDICINA NATURAL. SU MAYOR ANHELO DE LA SRA. YOLA JUNTO A SU ESPOSO ES ARREGLAR SU CASA, AUMENTANDO CON UN PISO MÁS, PARA TENER MAYOR COMODIDAD Y VIVIR MEJOR. ES MUY TRABAJADORA Y CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA TRES PAQUETES DE COCA. ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDERR Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.

PARA SABER MAS SOBRE LA HOJA DE COCA VISITA ESTA PAGINA  http://images.google.com.bo/images?client=firefox-a&rls=org.mozilla:es-ES:official&channel=s&hl=es&source=hp&q=HOJA+DE+COCA&um=1&ie=UTF-8&ei=7at-S9OLEYq1tgefuryyDw&sa=X&oi=image_result_group&ct=title&resnum=4&ved=0CCEQsAQwAw
texts.en:
Yola is a long-standing client; she is very responsible and repays loans precisely on time. She is married to Anastacio. Her husband is an urban radio dispatch taxi driver. She has a minor daughter. Her sales stand is located in La Ceja a few steps away from the Ceja-Reloj bridge. She sells coca leaves at retail. She gets her merchandise at the coca leaf market in Villa Fatima. (Coca is a traditional Bolivian product that has been used since Inca times. Many people consume coca leaf because it alleviates fatigue; it's also brewed as an herbal tea and as naturalistic medicine) She and her husband dream with improving the conditions of their house, by adding a second floor, in order to be more comfortable and live better. She is very hard-working and will use the funds to buy three packages of coca leaf. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in her by granting the loan. To learn more about coca leaf, visit this web page: http://images.google.com.bo/images?client=firefox-a&rls=org.mozilla:es-ES:official&channel=s&hl=es&source=hp&q=HOJA+DE+COCA&um=1&ie=UTF-8&ei=7at-S9OLEYq1tgefuryyDw&sa=X&oi=image_result_group&ct=title&resnum=4&ved=0CCEQsAQwAw

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coca leaf.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Las Brisas.
Juana es casada, tiene 47 años y 2 hijos, Juana tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende cereales, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de maíz y trigo.
Los sueños de Juana son aumentar su mercadería y brindar una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Brisas” (The Breezes). She is 47 years old, married, and has two children. Juana has a vending post at the April 12th Market where she sells grain. She engages in her business every day.

Juana needs a loan of 1200 soles in order to buy corn and wheat. Her dreams are to acquire more merchandise and provide a better quality of life for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn & wheat

loans.name: C2893 Girubukire Group

texts.en:
Leoncie is 32 years old, married with two children who are 1 and 3 years old.  Leoncie and her family live in Kabuga, a region of Gasabo district.  Here, Leoncie is the representative of a group called girubukire and this group operates together the business of selling foodstuffs.  Leoncie and her team have started this business in 2007 and the hours of their business are from early in the morning until late in the evening hours.

Leoncie and her group are now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of satisfying the need of their customers through purchasing a large quantity of goods which seem to be highly demanded.  Those highly demanded foodstuffs are peas, rice and beans.  With this business expansion, this group hopes to earn more profits and these profits will be shared to the extent that they will reserve one portion of them (profits) for further reinvestment.

loans.use: The purchase more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Rodolfo Manuel

texts.es: Rodolfo Manuel habita en la zona # 8 de Nueva Guinea junto a su familia integrada por su esposa Gladinel y su hijo , graduado en Administración de empresa, trabaja en la Alcaldia Municipal como responsable de comunicacion social, este joven ha luchado por tener una vivienda propia para su familia, esta solicitando su 3er credito y espera ser beneficiado con el fondo kiva para construir su cocina y brindar mayor comodidad a su familia  ya que actualmente no tiene un espacio adecuado para ella, el mayor sueño que tiene es un hogar bonito y digno para familia, Rodolfo se caracteriza por ser un hombre con un alto espiritu de superación,  responsable, honesto, con buena conducta, tiene alto liderzgo en el municipio, expresa que se siente muy satisfecho con la atencion recibida en AFODENIC.
texts.en:
Rodolfo Manuel lives in District #8 of Nueva Guinea with his family, which consists of his wife Gladinel and their son. He graduated with a degree with business administration and works for the city as a communications director. This young man has strived to acquire a home for his family. He is requesting his third loan and hopes to be a beneficiary of Kiva funds so that he can build a kitchen and provide greater comfort for his family. At the moment, there is not adequate space in his home. His greatest dream is to have a beautiful and dignified home for his family.

Rodolfo is known as a high-spirited man of excellence who is responsible, honest, well-manned, and holds a position of high leadership within the city. He says he is very satisfied with the attention he has received from AFODENIC.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a kitchen in his house

loans.name: Norman De Jesús

texts.es:
Norman S. es casado y con dos hijos a los que les debe de proporcionar las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo en el municipio de Nagarote.
Es importante señalar que el señor Norman es muy trabajador y a diario se esfuerza en su centro de labores porque anhela mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. El crédito lo está solicitando para invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción como piedra cantera para la construcción de una tapia en su vivienda y de esta manera brindarle a su esposa e hijos las condiciones de vida necesarias para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Norman S. is married and has two children for whom he must provide everything they need to grow and develop; he lives in Nagarote. It's important to point out that Norman is very hard-working and does his best every day at his place of employment because he wants to improve his home's conditions. He will use the requested funds to buy building materials, like paving stones, to build a stone wall for his home thus providing his wife and children with the necessary conditions for their development.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Thacienne

texts.en:
Thacienne is 32 years old, Thacienne has lost her husband for few years ago.  Thacienne takes care for one child who is 8 years.  Thacienne lives in Nyarugenge District, one of the districts of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.  Thacienne has been in the business of selling clothes of women for about 15 years.  Thacienne operates her business for 8 hours per day.

Thacienne after a long time working as a self-employed businesswoman, she is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that she can purchase more attractive styles of women.  With these additional styles for sale, Thacienne will hopefully attract more customers and her sales also will increase.  With the use of this Kiva loan, Thacienne has a hope for building a secure future for her through the profits which she is expecting to earn.

loans.use: The purchase of additional women clothes for sale.

loans.name: Gloria Dolores

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Las Brisas.
Gloria es casada, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, Gloria junto a su esposo tienen carros D. transporte D. carga, servicio que realizan a la ciudad D. Lima. Además Gloria tiene una bodega en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes, bebidas.
Gloria necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños D. Gloria son ampliar su negocio, surtir con mas productos y comprar otro carro mas.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Brisas” (The Breezes). She is 42 years old, married, and has two children. Gloria and her husband have cargo vehicles in which they proviD. transport services within the city of Lima. In addition, she has a store in her home in which she sells groceries and beverages.

Gloria needs a loan of 2000 soles in order to buy rice and sugar. Her dreams are to expand her business, add more products to her inventory, and purchase another vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice & sugar

loans.name: Theodosie

texts.en:
Theodosie is 42 years old and married. She has four children between the ages of 6 and 14. Theodosie also cares for another person in her family. Theodosie lives in Gasabo District in Kigali Province, where her business is located. 

Theodosie owns a small shop that sells ikigage, a traditional beer made from sorghum. This business is profitable. Theodosie is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to buy more sorghum to make the ikigage. 

Theodosie's husband is a farmer, but his farm does not generate enough income to support his family, so Theodosie has decided to contribute to her family by selling the sorghum beer. Theodosie has an experience of six years in this field. Her business is open from 6:00 in the morning to 8:00 in the evening every day except Sunday.

loans.use: To buy sorghum to make into a traditional local beer

loans.name: Santiago Sabino

texts.es:
El señor Santiago Sabino se dedica con gran esfuerzo a su actividad agropecuaria dedicándose a la crianza de ganado en el municipio de Nagarote en León donde ha adquirido vasta experiencia en la crianza de estos animales. Está solicitando el crédito para ser invertido en la compra de cuatro vaquillas con el fin de criarlas y sacarle el máximo provecho por medio de la leche para comercializarla.

Espera ser beneficiado con el crédito para la compra de dichas vaquillas y así llevar a cabo su actividad en su localidad.
texts.en:
Santiago Sabino works hard as a small farmer. He raises cattle in the town of Nagarote in León, Nicaragua, where he has gained a great deal of experience raising these animals. He is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of four young cows. He hopes to raise these cows and use this as an opportunity to sell their milk commercially. He hopes that the loan will be funded so that he can buy the cows and continue with his work.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of four young cows.

loans.name: Ilberta

texts.es:
Ilberta es socia del Banco Comunal Las Brisas.
Ilberta es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, Ilberta viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende ropa variada y de las ferias compra quesos que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Ilberta necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos.
Ilberta sueña con que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Iberta is a member of the community bank Las Brisas. She is 36 years old, has three children and has a live-in partner. Iberta travels to the different fairs in the region where she sells varied clothing. At the fairs, she buys cheeses that she then sells at the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Iberta needs a loan in the amount of 800 soles (PEN) which she will invest in buying cheeses. Iberta's dream is that her children will complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cheeses to re-sell.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is 30 years old and single, but he supports his two brothers. Felix lives in the Nyarugenge District of Kigali Province. 

Felix runs a  cinema. Felix has chosen this business because there are many young people in his village who like to watch movies. This business is profitable. This is his first successful year in his business. He is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance to buy some new equipment and air conditioning, which is very important to attract more customers. 

Felix employs four people from his community so his business runs smoothly. This loan will help him to improve his business by buying modern equipment and supplies.  When Felix obtains more profits, he expects to save money and to reinvest in the business. 

His cinema is open from 6:00 in the morning to 9:00 (2100) in the evening every day except Sunday.

loans.use: To buy modern equipment, including air conditioning, for his cinema

loans.name: Silvio Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Silvio O. se ha destacado en su actividad de tapizado donde realiza diferentes tipos de tapices para muebles y otros artículos habiendo adquirido vasta experiencia en dicho ramo y habiendo ganado algunos clientes para la actividad.
Está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido directamente en la compra de tela Vinil en varios colores, compra de tela Damasco en varios colores y compra  de 4 colchones para llevar a cabo el trabajo y así satisfacer a sus clientes en este ramo.
texts.en:
Mr. Silvio has become well-known as an upholsterer. He makes different types of covers for furniture and other articles, having acquired vast experience in the field and earned a number of customers in the area. He is requesting a loan to invest directly in buying vinyl and damask cloth in various colors, and to buy 4 couches to work on, as requested by his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING CLOTH FOR UPHOLSTERY

loans.name: Bertha Dolores

texts.es:
Bertha García de 45 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento solo cuenta con luz y agua como servicio básico. 

Bertha desde muy pequeña le gusto hacer peinados, cuando creció decidió que esa iba a ser su profesión. Con un dinero ahorrado obtuvo los materiales para la peluquería empezó ir en casa en casa a dar de sus servicios como peluquera.

Ahora ella tiene su propio local. Trabaja todos los días desde las 08h00 haciendo tinturados, cortes de cabello, cepillados, etc. Una de las dificultades que tiene es la competencia de su sector.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar planchas, secadoras, utensilios para su salón de belleza. En el futuro quiere tener otro gabinete.
texts.en:
Bertha G. is 45 years old and lives in a peri-urban zone in the outskirts of Guayaquil. Her house if made of cement and she counts with only the basic services of electricity and water. Since she was young, Bertha liked styling hair and when she grew older she decided that this would be her profession. With her savings she bought hairdressing materials and she starting going from door-to-door to offer her services as a hairdresser. She now has her own place. She works everyday starting at 8 a.m. dying hair, doing hair cuts, styling hair, etc. One of the difficulties she has is the competition in her neighborhood. With this loan she wants to buy hair straighteners, dryers and utensils for her hair salon. In the future she wants to have another cabinet.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hair straighteners, dryers and other hairdressing utensils.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Las Brisas.
Delia es soltera, tiene 35 años y 4 hijos, Delia tiene un puesto en el mercado 12de abril en donde vende cereales variados, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Delia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Los sueños de Delia son seguir trabajando y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the communal bank Las Brisas. She is single, 35 years old, and has four children. She has a booth in the 12 de Abril market where she sells various cereals every day. Delia needs a loan of 1000 soles to invest in the purchase of cereals. Delia's dreams are to continue working and to have her children complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cereals

loans.name: María Aurora

texts.es:
María Aurora tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo de 13 años de edad en el distrito de Monsefú, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la confección de camisas y vestidos para bailar marinera (danza típica de la costa norte del país), ella nos comenta que trabajaba en una empresa confeccionadora de prendas de vestir de la ciudad de Chiclayo y que con su sueldo fue montando poco a poco su negocio. Durante los últimos meses ya estuvo trabajando para cumplir con algunos pedidos y hace tres meses empezó a dedicarle tiempo completo a su negocio.

Usualmente confecciona vestidos para bailar marinera, estas prendas son muy dificiles de confeccionar ya que van adornados con bordados, blodas y todo tipo de cintas. Los pedidos le están llegando de todas partes del país y ella poco a poco está haciéndose conocida en el mercado, precisamente para ampliar su negocio ante la creciente demanda por sus diseños, María Aurora se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de materiales como telas, hilos y cintas.

María Aurora desea ampliar su taller para darle trabajo a otras mujeres que como ella tienen aptitudes para la confección. Ella es una mujer alegre, empeñosa. Creativa y muy trabajadora. Sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima.
texts.en:
María Aurora is 33 years old, married, and lives with her husband and their 13-year-old son in Monsefú district, located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She makes shirts and dresses for the mariner's dance (a traditional dance of the northern coast). She used to work in a company in Chiclayo making clothing, and with her salary she built her business little by little. For the last few months she worked to finish her orders, and three months ago she began working at her own business full-time. She usually makes dresses for the mariner's dance. These outfits are very difficult to produce as they are adorned with embroidery and all types of ribbons. The orders come in from all parts of the country, and she is becoming known in the market little by little. In order to expand her business to meet the increasing demand for her designs, María Aurora is seeking a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa. She will invest the 1500 soles in the purchase of materials like fabrics, thread and ribbons. María Aurora wishes to expand her workshop so she can employ other women like her who have an aptitude for dressmaking. She is a happy, earnest, creative and very hardworking woman. Her neighbors and acquaintances hold her in high esteem.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to expand dressmaking business

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Fredy, pertenecen al banco comunal  “NUEVA VISION DE URUBAMBA”, nuestro socio está ubicado en el corazón del valle sagrado de los inkas, Urubamba está a 1 hora 10 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 40 años de edad es separado y tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 10 años de edad, el socio es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, el realiza trabajos de construcción civil, el siempre está tras de las instituciones buscando nuevas obras y proyectos para realizarlos, nuestro socio desea comprar algunos materiales entre ellos un  draibol para el trabjo, nuestro socio está como independiente desde el 2008. Nuestro socio comprará unos materiales para construcción civil.

Nuestro socio agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Fredy is a member of the communal bank "Nueva Vision de Urubamba". Urubamba is located in the heart of the sacred valley of the Incas, 1 hour and 10 minutes from the city of Cusco. Fredy is 40 years old and separated. He has two children who are 15 and 10 years old. He is a very hardworking and responsible person who works in civic construction. He is always after the institutions looking for new works and projects to build. He would like to buy some materials including drywall for his work. He has been independent since 2008. Fredy is thankful for this opportunity and promises to make his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Basilia Del Socorro

texts.es:
ESTA SRA. ES UNA GANADERA Y COMERCIANTE DE LA ZONA DE POTOSI EN LA FOTO SE OBSERVA EN PLENA FAENA DE TRABAJO PUES CUENTA CON UN MOLINO Y SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE GANADO MAYOR 
ES UNA MUJER CASADA MADRE DE 3 HIJOS LOS CUALES SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR PARA LOS CUALES ELLA TARABAJA CON MUCHO ESFUERZO Y DEDICACION 
 EL CRDITO LO SOLICITA PARA LA COMPRA DE UNOS NOVILLOS Y MANTENIMIENTO DE EL MOLINO PARA SEGUIR TRABAJANDO.
texts.en:
This lady is a cattle rancher and a merchant in the area of Potosi. In the picture she can be observed full at work since she has a mill and she raises livestock. She is a married woman with three school-aged children; she is dedicated and works hard for them. She is requesting the loan to buy some young bulls and maintain her mill so she can continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cattle and to repair and maintain mill

loans.name: C 3516 Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
M. is 56 years old and he is the president of a group called Abishyizehamwe. M. and his team sell charcoal wholesale. This is their second successful year in this business. The hours of their business are from early in the morning until late in the evening hours.

M. and his team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand their business by buying more charcoal to satisfy the demand of their customers. With this loan, this group hopes that their sales will increase, as well as their profits. The added profits will allow them to create many sources of income by reinvesting in the same business but in different locations. By expanding the business, each member of this group has a hope for the future.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: Don José M. es casado, padre de 4 hijos menores de edad estudiando educación primaria, habita en la comarca La tigra del Jicaro, jurisdiccion de Nueva Guinea, es pequeño productor cuya actividad principal es la ganaderia y agricultura, con mas de 30 años de experiencia en esta actividad, está solicitando su primer crédito a AFODENIC y espera contar con el apoyo del fondo kiva para comprar terneros de desarrollo, los cuales pretende engordar para venderlos cuando tengan un mejor peso y obtener ganancias al momento de la comercialización, y de esta manera garantizar la alimentación del nucleo familiar y tener mayores condiciones econòmicas, también espera aumentar su inventario ganadero. Cuenta con lo necesario para realizar esta actividad, ya que su finca presenta buenas condiciones tècnica para el desarrollo del hato, tiene infraestructura de corral, galera, manga, para el desarrollo del ordeño, cuenta con pastos mejorados y de corte, es una persona muy reconocida en su comunidad con gran liderazgo, en su futuro espera mejorar la calidad de vida del nucleo familiar.
texts.en:
José M. is married and has four minor children who attend elementary school. He lives in the La Tigra del Jicaro region in the New Guinea jurisdiction. He is a small producer, and his main activities are ranching and farming. He has over 30 years of experience in these activities. He is asking Afodenic for his first loan, and he hopes to get the support of Kiva funds in order to buy calves. He plans to fatten them in order to sell them when they weigh more. He will get income the moment he sells them. That way he can guarantee feeding his family and having better economic conditions. He also plans to increase his inventory of cattle. He has what he needs to do this. His farm has good technical conditions for the herd’s growth. The infrastructure has a corral, a shed, and a hose for milking. He has meadows that have been cut and improved. He is a well known person in his community, and he is a great leader. In the future he hopes to improve his family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy calves

loans.name: Las Dinamicas Group

texts.es:
EL BANCO DE EMPRENDIMIENTO LAS DINAMICAS SE ENCUENTRA EN SU SEGUNDO CICLO DENTRO DE LA INSTITUCION, LAS SEÑORAS SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER MUY SOLIDARIAS ENTRE SI, CUANDO UNA PERSONA ESTA POR LLEGAR ATRASADA O TIENE PROBLEMAS ENTRE ELLAS HACEN LA CUOTA DE LA PERSONA QUE FALTA.

LA SRA.
