Cada una de las integrantes recibe una suma del présatmo y lo destinan  a las actividades a las que se dedican cada una de ellas, como por ejemplo la señora Blanca A. quien se dedica a la venta de comidas. Ella alquila un pequeño salón en mercado de la ciudad hasta donde viaja cada muy temprano llevando todos los ingredientes para la elaboración de sus alimentos, en el mercado ella vende su producto a la gente que trabaja en el sitio como a la que visita el mercado, tiene buena venta y buen ganancia con mucho esfuerzo comenta doña Blanca. Se citan las actividades que se desarrollan en el comité por cada integrante.
1
Blanca A.
Venta de Comidas.
2
Clara Chamorro
Venta De Ropa Interior.
3
María G.
Venta de Bebidas.
4
Idalia M.
Venta de Comidas.
5

Venta de Pollo y Huevos.
6

Venta de Bebidas.

9

Venta de Cosméticos.
10

Venta de Frutas.
11

Venta de Comidas
12
Sara Benítez
Venta de Ropa Interior.
13
Mirtha Davalos
Venta de Joyas de Plata.
14

Venta de Frutas.
15
Cecilia G.
Venta de Ropas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Librada of Barrio Buena Vista, Ciudad del Este initiated this Committee. She contacted her neighbors and friends to form the committee in her community. The committee is called “Mujeres Comprometidas” (Committed Women) and is in its 5th loan cycle with 15 members. The group is well known in its neighborhood for being united, responsible among themselves, and to have solidarity. They carry out community tasks and activities for the committee and have savings of 5,253,868 in local currency. Each of the members will receive a portion of the loan and will use it in their own economic activity. For example, Mrs. Blanca is dedicated to selling meals. She rents a small space in the city market and travels there daily with all the necessary ingredients to make meals. She then sells her meals to the people who work there as well as to those who visit the market. She enjoys good sales and earnings with much effort, Blanca comments. A list of the activities of members of the committee: 1 Blanca sells meals 2 Clara sells underwear 3 Maria sells drinks 4 Idalia sells meals 5 Mariana sells chickens and eggs 6 Elsa sells drinks 7 Claudelina sells clothing 8 Librada sells clothing 9 Rocio sells cosmetics 10 Mirian sells fruit 11 Gabriela sells meals 12 Sara sells underwear 13 Mirtha sells silver jewelry 14 Maria sells fruit 15 Cecilia sells clothing

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MERCHANDISE SUCH AS FRUIT, VEGETABLES, MEAT, CLOTHES TO SELL

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Luis Alberto C. Ramírez, es casado, padre de dos hijos independientes, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos especialmente los cultivos de maíz,  trigo  y fríjol, tiene amplia experiencia en la agricultura y los créditos que ha solicitado con CEPRODEL  le han beneficiado para realizar sus labores de presiembra y pos siembra.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto C. Ramírez is married and has two, independent children. He is a farmer, particularly of corn, wheat and beans. He has ample farming experience and the loans that he has requested from CEPRODEL have been of use to him in his preplanting and postplanting labors.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies for the approaching planting season.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.en: Fifteen kilometers from Fundación Paraguaya's Paraguarí office, the 'La Esperanza' (Hope) group met to learn about the Women Entrepreneurs Program and the benefits it offered. The group is comprised of fifteen hardworking women who are in their tenth loan cycle. They work hard to improve the quality of their family's lives. These women will invest the loans, averaging 1,507,000 GS, in their respective businesses.

loans.use: Purchase thread, corn meal, cheese, eggs, fabric, sugar, flower, vegetables, fruit, dairy, sweets, drinks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Shalom 3 Group

texts.en:
Natividad is the coordinator of her group Shalom, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Hato Mayor, a poor agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her child.

Natividad is excited to be taking her seventh loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business making and selling candy by purchasing ingredients such as sugar and coconut as well as a machine to slice and dice the coconut. She will use the profits to invest in her home by buying furniture and a fan as well shoes and notebooks for her children. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Sugar, coconut and a machine for cutting and shredding coconut

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en: Modesto is 61 years old and married with three daughters who are grown up. As a father, he has fulfilled his duty, as his daughters are professionals and financially independent. Modesto works in transportation. He owns two buses in the Paraguarí bus company. His goal is to continue increasing the number of vehicles he owns and creating jobs in the region. Modesto has a desire to get ahead in life and is requesting this loan so that he can offer his passengers the best possible service.

loans.use: To purchase tires

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
La Sra. Eulalia, llego a ser cliente en nuestra institucion, gracias a la recomendación de una de las clientes que trabaja en bancos de emprendimiento, con el asesor Nicolas, La Sra. Eulalia vive en el Barrio 30 de agosto de la zona del plan 3000, junto a sus dos hijos y su esposo, tiene su tienda en la que vende diario alimentos de primera necesidad y complementarios;   el prestamo solicitado es para aumentar capital en su tiendita, su esposo el Sr. Efrain es taxista presta servicios de transporte urbano. Hace un año atras ellos cuentan con su casa propia y un vehiculo propio, gracias a sus esfuerzos. estos Sres. tuvieron un fracaso el que casi les ocasiona deshacerce de sus pertenencias, pasa que la esposa se presto un dinero para el viaje de su esposo al extranjero donde el tendria un mejor ingreso, ya estando fuera del pais lo encontraron indocumentado donde lo deportaron para Bolivia, siendo que acaba de viajar. despues de esto volvio a salir fuera del pais donde trabajo por mas de un año, donde consiguio ganar un tanto de dinero con lo construyo su casita y se compro su movilidad con la que actualmente trabaja y ayuda en los gastos de la casa. Ellos comentan que esa experiencia que pasaron les ayudo a valorar mucho la union familiar que es el pilar fundamental para superar cualquier tipo de problemas.

Estan muy agradecidos a Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito
texts.en:
Eulalia became a client of our institution thanks to a recommendation from one of the clients that works with communal banks under advisor, Nicolas. Eulalia lives in Plan 3000 zone's 30 de Agosto neighborhood with her husband and two children. She has a small grocery store where she sells basic needs items. She is asking for funding to stock her store. Her husband, Efrain, is an urban taxi driver. Thanks to their combined efforts, they have owned their own house and vehicle for a year now. The couple had a recent setback that almost caused them to lose all their belongings. What happend was: the wife lent herself some money to pay for her husband's trip abroad where work conditions would provide higher income. However, once abroad he was discovered to be undocumented and he was deported to Bolivia; he had just recently left. After this, he left the country again and stayed out working for over a year. He was able to earn enough money to build the house and buy a vehicle, which he currently uses to work and help with household expenses. They comment that the experience they went through taught them to value family unity which is the fundamental pillar needed to overcome any adversity. They are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in them by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Santos

texts.en:
Santos is a commercial truck driver based out of the Port of Oakland. After purchasing his own diesel engine semi-truck, he’s been in business for himself for one year.

A few months ago, however, Santos was faced with the challenge of finding money to retrofit his truck to comply with new California Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) emissions regulations. Without the expensive engine retrofit, he will be locked out from the Port of Oakland and forced to stop driving. “When the new regulations went into effect, I couldn’t believe how much the retrofit on my truck was going to cost! I thought I would need to sell my truck or move to another state that has easier emissions regulations in order to stay in business.” 

Santos is grateful that he was referred to Opportunity Fund as an alternative source of funding. As a self-employed trucker, his income is modest and his ability to access capital through traditional financing is limited - but his livelihood depends on keeping his truck in compliance and on the road. A $7,000 loan through Opportunity Fund, combined with a grant from the EPA, gives him the chance to keep working. 

Santos is confident that he will be prepared to adjust to tighter EPA emissions regulations in the future. “With two more years of work I will have saved enough to afford new equipment, and maybe even a new truck.”

loans.use: To retrofit his truck engine with a new filter to cut down on pollution emissions

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
La señora Reyna es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan de Dios” desde hace 8 meses, vive en el distrito y provincia de Lampa, departamento de Puno, tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 03 hijos. Ella estudió hasta tercero de secundaria, se dedica a la venta de artesanía.

Reyna nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar lana, bayeta (tela), etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es agrandar su negocio para poder obtener mayores ingresos.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal es como esta organizado "todo en orden".
texts.en:
Señora Reyna has been a member of the “San Juan de Dios” communal bank for 8 months. She lives in the district and province of Lampa, department of Puno. She is 36 years of age and a single mother with three children. She studied until the third year of secondary school and is engaged in the sale of handicrafts.

Reyna tells us that with the first loan she applied for from Movimiento Manuela Ramos, which was for 500 new soles, she was able to increase her working capital. She will apply for a loan of 800 new soles with which she will be able to buy wool, flannel, cloth, etc.

Her dream, for the future is to enlarge her business in order to increase her income. What she likes most about her communal bank is that it is organized efficiently.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool, flannel, etc.

loans.name: Melida Lisbet

texts.es: Melida Lisbet tiene 44 años, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de productos lácteos. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a esta humilde actividad, la inicia la intención de ayudar a mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos, pues actualmente todos trabajan y ayudan a su Madre en lo que pueden, Melida además labora en una pequeña escuela donde asisten los niños de escasos recursos, por lo que el salario no es lo suficiente para generar ingresos necesarios. Ella solicita este financiamiento con el fin de comprar materia prima y seguir con sus clientes. Ella sueña con seguirle proporcionando a sus hijos una casa donde puedan dormir y dejárselas para el día de mañana.
texts.en:
Melida is 44 years old, and her economic activity is selling dairy products. She has been engaged in this humble activity for more than 5 years. She was inspired to begin by the desire to improve the living conditions of her children, but today they all work and help their mother as they can. Melida also works in a small school for low-income children, but her salary from this job does not give her sufficient income. She is requesting this loan with the goal of buying raw materials and continuing serving her customers. She dreams of continuing to provide a home for her children where they can sleep in peace until the morning.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: 20 De Abril Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. emprendimiento 20 D. ABRIL fue fundada en la zona D. caliri, sus pobladores en su mayoria se dedican al lavado D. arena por estar ubicados al lado del Rio Irpavi. Son personas responsabes que aceptaron garantizarse entre si porque se conocen D. hace mucho tiempo. la asociacion cuenta con una mesa directiva elegida en asamblea D. la cual forman parte:

La Sra. Rosminda es la presidenta, esta casada y tiene hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar que se dedica al lavado D. arena en el rio y despues venD. a las personas que necesitan material D. construccion, con el dinero del credito comprara herramientas D. trabajo para facilitar el lavado D. arena.

La Sra. Saturnina es la tesorera esta casada y se dedica a la venta D. material reciclable recoge botellas D. plastico y papel para despues venderlo a distintas fabricas, con el dinero del credito ella quiere comprar una cocina D. 4 hornallas que le hace falta en su casa para su uso diario.  

y la Srta. Rita es la Secretaria, esta estudiando y tiene otra actividad D. la venta D. cosmeticos por catalogo y el dinero del credito lo utilizara en la compra D. producos D. belleza que se encuentran en promosion para poder venderlos despues al precio original y asi tener un poco mas D. ganancia. 

En su totalidad son 9 integrantes y cada una realiza una actividad distinta como los Sres Juan y Edwin se dedica al lavado D. arena en el mismo Rio Irpavi, la Sras Ceferina, Natalia  y Claudia venden ropa en las distintas ferias D. la ciudad. y por ultimo esta la Srta Mariela que trabaja como cajera en una tienda D. helados. el prestamo solicitado ellos lo invertiran en la compra D. material D. trabajo y asi generar mayores ingresos para todas sus familias.

Todas las socias estan Agradecidos con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurial group "20 D. Abril" was founded in the Caliri area, where most residents work washing sand because of their location next to Lake Irpavi. They are responsible and have agreed to guarantee each other because they have known each other for a long time. The group counts on a board of officers elected by the group: Mrs. Rosminda is the president, she is married and has school age children. She washes sand in the river and sells it to those who need construction material. With the loan money, she will buy tools to facilitate the sand washing. Mrs. Saturnina is the treasurer. She is married and sells recyclable materials, collecting plastic bottles and paper for later sale to different factories. With the loan money, she wants to buy a four-burner stove that she needs in her home for daily use. And finally, Ms. Rita is the secretary. She studies and sells catalog cosmetics. The loan money will be used to buy the latest beauty products in order to sell them above the original price and so make a larger profit. Altogether, there are 9 members and each one performs a different activity. Juan and Edwin, for example, wash sand in the Irpavi River, Ceferina, Natalia, and Claudia sell clothes in various markets in the city, and finally Ms. Mariela works as a cashier at an ice cream shop. The requested loan will be invested in work materials to generate more income for all of their families. The members are thankful to Emprender and Kiva for their support and for granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools to wash sand for resale

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la María B. del Barrio Remansito de _C.D.E. Ella Contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en su comunidad.
El comité se Denomina San Roque  están en el Séptimo  Ciclo   con 18  integrantes , es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias  y responsable entre ellas.

Cada una realiza una actividad diferente e independiente, con mucho esfuerzo para salir adelante.
La señora Juana P. es una de las integrantes del comité y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Mediante primer crédito que se le otorgó pudo comenzar con su actividad comercial, y actualmente quiere mejorar su negocio ya que cada día cuenta con más mercaderías y para ello ya quiere construir un salón para exponer sus productos, esta actividad los venia realizando visitando las casas de los clientes y también vendía sus productos en su casa, con esto pudo mejorar bastante su negocio. 
Así cada una realiza una actividad diferente con mucho sacrificio y con ello cada una ayuda a su familia, se citan las actividades de cada una. 
1
Juana P.
Venta de Cosméticos
2
Carmen L.
Venta de Ropas
3
