Y como es un hombre emprendedor, tiene planeado para el futuro seguir creciendo con sus negocios y sembrar en mayor cantidad para obtener mayores ganancias.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está seguro que cumplirá puntualmente, ya que no quiere perjudicar a sus compañeros de grupo, pues quiere devolver la confianza depositada en él. Liberato tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita para surtir su tienda con mayor cantidad de productos, y también comprará fertilizantes y abono para sus tierras.
texts.en:
Liberato is 53 years old and lives in his own house with his wife Yolanda (age 51) and his elderly mother. He has a son who lives and studies in the city.

Liberato has been farming almost all of his life. He currently grows potatoes and peas, and sells his harvest at the local markets near where he lives. Since getting married twenty years ago, he has been selling groceries from a small store in his home and has done very well because he does not face any competition. A few months ago, he opened a call center next to his store that is equipped with Internet kiosks. This has also turned out to be good investment because Liberato lives in a remote area where no such establishments exist. He hopes to continue making progress with the unconditional support of his wife. Since he is an enterprising gentleman, Liberato has plans in the future to grow his businesses and plant more crops in greater quantity so that he can generate more revenue.

This is his first loan with MFP. He will make sure to complete his payments on time because he does not want to create problems for the other members of his group who have placed their trust in him. Liberato plans to use the money to restock his store with a large quantity of products and will purchase fertilizers and compost for his farmland.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his store & fertilizers for his farmland

loans.name: Luisa Amparo

texts.es:
La señora Luisa R. se dedica a trabajar en el municipio de Somotillo porque tiene el compromiso de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda que hoy más que nunca requiere mejorarla porque debe brindarle a su familia las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo en su localidad.
Está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de algunos materiales de construcción para dar lugar al mejoramiento de dicha vivienda y así salir adelante dándole un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luisa R. works in the municipality of Somotillo because she is committed to improve her housing conditions; now more than ever her house requires improvements so she can offer her family the necessary environment for their development in their community. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of construction materials to enable improvements to her house and get ahead in life, giving her children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Sor Erlinda Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Sor Erlinda es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 43 años de edad, casada y con dos hijos estudiantes, su esposo trabaja en construcciones, el negocio de doña Sor Erlinda es la venta de ropa usada que por varios años es su fuente de ingreso, inicio este negocio con el deseo de poder ayudar a su familia y ser una mujer independiente, pues todo esta caro y los trabajos difíciles hay que esforzarse para poder salir adelante. La ropa que vende la compra por paca en donde viene una variedad de estilos de ropa para dama, caballeros y niños, que por ser barata y bonita se vende mucho en el barrio, antes salía a vender ambulante, ahora como ha captado clientes ya llegan solo a su casa en donde tiene mucha ropa. Con este crédito quiere comprar mas paca para incrementar las ventas, gracias a las ganancias ha logrado hacer las mejoras de su casa que poco a poco junto con su esposo han venido logrando. Y con  los financiamientos que la institución ha dado el cual esta sastifecha por el apoyo otorgado.
texts.en:
Sra. Sor Erlinda is an extremely hardworking woman. She is 43 years old, married, and has two children enrolled in school. Her husband works in construction. Doña Sor Erlinda has been selling used clothing for several years as her source of income. She started this business because she wanted to help her family and become an independent woman. Since everything is expensive and jobs are difficult to find, she summoned the strength to move forward.

Sor Erlinda purchases clothing by the bale and each one contains a variety of styles for women, men, and children. Since these items look nice and are inexpensive, they sell very well in the neighborhood. Sor Erlinda previously sold her merchandise as a traveling vendor, but now that she has regular customers, she is able to work from home where all the clothing is stored. With this loan, she wants to buy more bales of clothing to increase her sales. Thanks to the money she has earned, Sor Erlinda has been able to complete a few improvements to her home that she and her husband started. Along with the financing, she is satisfied with the support the Institution has provided.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bales of clothing

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Vive en la localidad de Santa Marta, municipio de El Torno, su actividad es la de construcción civil(Albañil), esta casado y tiene 4 hijos su esposa esta por emprender un negocio de venta de abarrote a lo cual se destinara el crédito solicitado, ya que tienen 4 hijos y su economía esta ajustada, y necesitan trabajar los dos para poder sacar ala familia adelante, por lo que decidieron poner un negocio ya que por la ubicación de su casa es una zona estratégica, y así colaborar  con los gastos familiares. El Sr. Juan es una persona responsable y trabajadora, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Juan lives in Santa Marta, El Torno municipality. He works in construction as a bricklayer. He is married and has 4 children. His wife is about to start up a grocery store and this is what the loan will be for because they have four children and their finances are pretty strained; they both need to work if they are to support the family. For this reason and to contribute to household expenses, they decided to set up a business because their house is located in a strategic position. Juan is a responsible, hard-working person; he is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in him by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock his wife's grocery store.

loans.name: Karen Maritza

texts.es: La joven Karen  vive en un barrio Arlen Siu,  de la capital de Managua, casada, y con dos hijos, es muy dedicada al trabajo para poder hacer las mejoras a su pequeña casa que junto con su esposo han venido realizando, el trabaja como cadete de taxi es propio y desde horas temprana sale a dar su servicios.  Ella trabaja en un supermercado impulsando productos y lleva varios años, lo que desea hacer con este préstamo es un anexo en la parte de enfrente de su casa como un porche para poder tener mas espacio ya que la sala es pequeña y no tiene mucha comodidad.  Ya que vive con su mama y abuelita que es la que cuida de sus dos niñas, su mama es costurera y trabaja en la casa y en conjunto se apoyan. Comprara materiales de construcción como: bloques, arena, cemento, hierro, zinc, perlines para comenzar la obra. Contenta con el préstamo que Afodenic a dado ya que solo mediante el financiamiento esta logrando las mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
The young woman, Karen, lives in the Alen Siu neighborhood, in the capital Managua. She is married, has two children, and is very dedicated to working so she can make improvements to the small home her and her husband have been building. Her husband works as a taxi driver and leaves early in the morning to start work. Karen has worked in a supermarket promoting products for several years. With this loan she would like to build an annex onto the front of their house to service as a porch. This way they could have more space since the living room is very small and not very comfortable since she lives with her mother and grandmother, who look after her two children. Her mother is a seamstress who works from home. They all help each other out. Karen will buy building materials like: blocks, sand, cement, iron, zinc, and beams to get the project started. She is happy with the loan Afodenic has given her, since this is the only way she can make home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials like: blocks, sand, cement, iron, zinc, and beams to start building her porch.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Help to grow coffee

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
La señora Carmela es socia del Banco Comunal “Cristo Blanco” desD. hace 1 año, vive en el distrito D. Juliaca, provincia D. San Román y departamento D. Puno, tiene 47 años D. edad, es separada y tiene 01 hijo. Ella estudió hasta quinto D. secundaria, se dedica a la compra y venta D. miel y polladas (comida al paso).

Carmela nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, compró miel.

Ella solicitará un crédito  D. S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar insumos para las polladas como: pollo, papa, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener un negocio fijo y poner una tienda D. abarrotes. 

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las reuniones con las socias y la responsabilidad
texts.en:
Carmela has been a member of the “Cristo Blanco” communal bank for 1 year. She lives in the Juliaca district, San Román province in the Puno department. She is 47 years old, is separated and has 1 child. She studied to the fifth year of secondary school. She buys and sells honey and barbequed chicken (fast food). Carmela tells us that with the first loan she asked the Manuela Ramos Movement for, which was for 500 PEN, she bought honey. She is asking for a loan of 600 PEN, with which she will be able to buy ingredients for the barbequed chicken like: chicken, potatoes, etc. Her dream for the future is to have a steady business and to open a grocery store. What she likes the most about her communal bank are the meetings with the members and the responsibility.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY CHICKEN, POTATOES ETC

loans.name: Matías

texts.es:
El señor Matias E. se dedica a la activiad agropecuaria y por ser un gran trabajador ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y le ha brindado a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
Está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de tres vacas para proceder a su crianza y también para extraerle la leche y comercializarla y de esta manera obtener los ingresos para continuar mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia en el municipio de Somotillo.
texts.en:
Matias works in the livestock farming sector and, by being a hard worker, has been able to improve his standard of living and has brought his family better living conditions.

He is requesting a loan to invest in buying three cows for breeding purposes as well as for milking and eventual sale. In this way he will receive the income he needs to continue improving the living conditions of his family in the town of Somotillo.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three cows

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Pablo S. es trabajador de enacal es fontanero el dinero los solicita para compra de materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, hierro y piedra para terminar de construir su casa, es casado tiene dos hijos su esposa es contadora trabaja en el seguro social, y si los crédito que ha tenido con ceprodel le han ayudado mucho ya que ha podido construir su casa con la ayuda de estos crédito y de su esposa y espera que ceprodel siempre les este financiando créditos. Ya ha tenido cuatro crédito con nosotros.
texts.en:
Juan Pablo works as a plumber. He is requesting this money to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, iron, and stone to complete the construction of his house. He is married, has two children, and his wife is an account working in social security. The loans he has had from CEPRODEL have helped him a lot as he has been able to build his house with the help of these loans and his wife, and he hopes that CEPRODEL will always grant them loans. He has already had four loans from us.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement, iron, stone, and sand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.es: La Sra. Brenda Lucia A. G. es trabajadora activa de la institución, seguro social el dinero los solicita para compra de materiales de construcción arena, perlines, piedra, hierro y bloque, es casada tiene tres hijos en edad escolar los crédito le han ayudado mucho ya que ha podido salir adelante con sus hijos con los pagos del colegio y ha podido ir construyendo su casa poco a poco.
texts.en:
Brenda Lucia A. G. is an active employee of Social Security. She needs funding to buy building materials like: sand, metal, stone, iron, concrete blocks. She is married and has three, school-age children. The loans have helped her a lot because they have made it possible for her to pay for her children's school expenses and she has been able to gradually build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sand, gravel and cement.

loans.name: Maria Fortunata

texts.es:
María Fortunata tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos en el caserío Las Juntas del distrito de Pacora, ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, como ovejas, chivos y aves de corral. Ella cría sus animales en un corral ubicado a espaldas de su domicilio. Este negocio es muy importante para su economía familiar ya que su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y esta actividad no le provee de ingresos permanentes.

María Fortunata se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de animales y en el arreglo de su corral, ya que planea ampliar su negocio para captar más ingresos.

Ella es una mujer bastante conocida y respetada por los vecinos de la zona, su más grande anhelo es darle a sus hijos una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
María Fortunata is 40 years old , married and lives with her husband and three children in the Las Juntas settlement in the Pacora district, located one hour from Chiclayo city. For 10 years she has raised and sold young animals, such as sheep, goats and fowl. She raises her animals in a corral located behind her home. This business is very important for the economy of the family since her husband works in agriculture and this business does not provide a permanent income. María Fortunata is asking for a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa of 1500 PEN which she intends to use for the purchase of animals and for the repair of her corral, since she plans to expand her business to earn more income. She is quite well known and respected by the neighbours in her area. Her greatest wish is to give her children a quality education.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals to increase her business and repair the corral

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and mend the corral

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo M. G. tiene 62 años, es casado, y  tiene cinco hijos.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Calzado Solidario es un recinto que se encuentra a quince minutos del Cantón San Miguel en la vía a la costa.  Son 19 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.

Eduardo trabaja en la agricultura y a la carpintería para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz y papas.  El maíz vende en la casa y las papas en el mercado del Cantón San Miguel.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero.  También, a Eduardo le gusta estudiar la Biblia.

Eduardo solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y para compra de materiales para el taller de carpintería.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos  que afectan a los cultivos y el precio de la madera.
texts.en:
Eduardo M. G. is 62 years old, married, and has five children. He lives in the San Miguel region of the province of Bolívar. The associate is a member of the Calzado Solidario rural district, which is a precinct that is located fifteen minutes from San Miguel on the way to the coast. There are 19 associates in all, the majority of whom are dedicated to agriculture and the breeding of smaller animals. Eduardo works in agriculture and carpentry to increase the family income. The crops that do best are corn and potatoes. The corn he sells from the house and the potatoes in the market of San Miguel. The main cultural event is the carnival that is celebrated every year in February. Also, Eduardo likes to study the Bible. Eduardo requests the loan to buy supplies for his work in the fields and to purchase materials for his carpentry workshop. His goal is to have a good income for his family. The challenges that he faces are the climatic problems that affect the crops and the price of wood.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for working his fields and supplies for his carpentry shop.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: La Sra. Maria, tiene 53 años de edad se encuentra casada con don Manuel que es profesor de provincia, La Sra. Maria tiene como actividad la tienda de barrio además de ser tambien profesora, los dos viven en casa propia, tienes 4 hijos que se encuentran en escuela y tambien en la universidad, es una persona responsable y trabajadora y tiene que sacar adelante a su familia, su deseo es ver a sus hijos profesionales y tambien poder agrandar su tienda, el dinero del credito es para la compra de abarrotes al por mayor. La tienda de abarrotes se constituye en una agencia, ya que vende por mayor a gran parte de las tiendas de la zona de Tacagua. Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion de creditos
texts.en:
Maria is 53 years old and is married to Manuel who is a teacher in the province. Maria has a neighborhood store as well as being a teacher. The two live in their own home, have four children who are in school and university. She is a responsible and hardworking person who wants her family to be successful. Her wish is to see her children become professionals and also to be able to grow her store. The money from this loan is to buy groceries for wholesale. The grocery store constitutes an agency because it sells wholesale to most of the stores in the Tacagua area. Maria is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidance the show in her by granting her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Angelino

texts.es: Angelino tiene 49 años de edad su estado civil es casado, tiene 1 hijo que depende de él. Toda la familia vive en domicilio propio. Con la actividad de transportista propietario que está afiliado a una Organización de Transportes, tiene 1 año de antigüedad, su esposa se dedica a cuidado de animales vacuno y ovino, en su otro domicilio que se encuentra en una comunidad de la provincia Aroma. Su competencia es media, porque esta Afiliado a la Organización de Transportes. Compra ganado vacuno para engorde, para su posterior venta. En sus créditos anteriores trabajo de manera optima,  tiene obligaciones con otras Entidades Financieras también trabajando de manera optima.
texts.en:
Angelino is 49 years of age, His marital status is married. He has 1 son that depends on him. All the family lives in their own residence. He has been working as a owner/operator truck driver affiliated with an Organization of Transportation for 1 year. His wife is dedicated to the care of sheep and cattle in his other residence that is located in a community of the province Aroma. His competition is average, because he is affiliated with the Organization of Transportation. He buys cattle to fatten, for subsequent sale. In his previous loans, he repaid in an optimum way. He has obligations with other financial companies, which he also repays well.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Maria Nela

texts.es: La Sra. Maria Nela T. García, es madre de un hijo en edad escolar, su oficio maestra de educación primaria, todos sus créditos que ha adquirido con CEPRODEL han sido para remodelación de su casa, construcción de una habitación y repello de las paredes de su casa.
texts.en:
Maria Nela T. García is the mother of a school-aged child; she is an elementary school teacher. All of her loans from CEPRODEL have been used for home remodel projects: building a room and replastering the walls.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, es una mujer muy alegre, vive en el Distrito de Yarina cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 31 años, es madre de dos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos y chupetes, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, actualmente se encuentra separada de su pareja. Rosa forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Dalinas II”, desde hace 2 años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra de gaseosas y agua embotellada, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 500 soles, que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas e insumos para sus chupetes y refrescos. La meta de Rosa es, tener una bodega bien surtida la cual le permita generar mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a very happy woman. She lives in the District of Yarina cocha, Ucayali region. She is 31 years of age and the mother of two under-age children. She is dedicated to the sale of refreshments and popsicles. She carries out this activity in her house. At present she is separated from her husband. Rose has been part of the “Las Dalinas II” Communal Bank for 2 years. The first loan that she received was of 300 soles, that was invested in the purchase of carbonated beverages and bottled water. Now she needs a loan of 500 soles, that will be invested in the purchase of carbonated beverages and supplies for her popsicles and refreshments. The goal of Rose is to have a well supplied convenience store, which will permit her to generate a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy carbonated beverages and supplies for making popsicles and refreshments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Luis Humberto

texts.es:
Luís Humberto M. M. tiene 67 años, es soltero, y no tiene hijos.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Calzado Solidario es un recinto que se encuentra a quince minutos del Cantón San Miguel en la vía a la costa.  Son 19 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.

Luís trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen es el maíz y también cría de aves.  Vende los productos en la feria de San Miguel y en su casa.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero y le gusta reunirse con sus amigos en la casa y cantar.

Luís solicita el crédito para comprar de fertilizantes y semillas para el trabajo del campo.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Luís Humberto M. M. is 67-years-old, single, and has no children. He lives in the district of San Miguel in the province of Bolívar. This partner is a member of the "Calzado Solidario" (Footwear Solidarity) rural development group, which is located in a precinct fifteen minutes from the district of San Miguel along the coast. There are 19 members in all, the majority of whom work in farming and raising livestock.

Luís works in farming in order to increase his family's income. His most successful crops are corn as well as poultry breeding. He sells his products both at the San Miguel fair and from his home. The most popular cultural event in the area is Carnaval, which is celebrated each year in February and is known for friends getting together at one another's homes to sing.

Luís is requesting a loan so he can buy fertilizer and seeds for his fields. His goal is to improve his family's livelihood. The challenges that he faces include bad weather and diseases that affect his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
Modesto vive con su esposa, la pareja tiene una vivienda que es propia. También cuentan con 3 hijos mayores los cuales son independientes. Modesto y su esposa tienen un taller de chapería y también tienen un vehículo con el cual trabaja como taxista. La competencia es alta en el rubro de chapería, pero cuenta con clientela  que demanda sus servicios por la calidad y acabado que imprime en los trabajos que realiza. En el auto transporte, la competencia es alta, pero la demanda también lo es ya que es el medio de transporte mas rápido, contando con clientes que requieren de este servicio.
Con el crédito procederá a la compra de llantas y realizara el correspondiente de mantenimiento y reparación de su vehículo. Este es su Cuarto  crédito al que accede, con excelente cumplimiento de pago demostrado en sus préstamos anteriores. Modesto tiene excelentes referencias personales y morales.
texts.en:
Modesto lives with his wife. The couple own their residence. They have 3 older children who are independent. Modesto and his wife have an auto repair business and a vehicle from which he works as a taxi driver. The competition is stiff in the business of auto repair, but they can rely on customers who demand their services because of their quality and the way they complete their work. In passenger transportation, competition is significant, but the demand for rapid transportation is also high, and Modesto relies on customers who require this service. With this loan, he will purchase tires and maintain and repair his vehicle. This is his fourth loan. He has an outstanding record of repayment and excellent references with regard to his moral character.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
La señora Clorinda es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Calceteras” desde hace 3 años atrás, vive en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos. Ella estudió hasta quinto de secundaria, se dedica a la compra y venta de ladrillos y golosinas.

Clorinda nos cuenta que  el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ahora ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  golosinas como: caramelos, chocolates, galletas, gaseosas, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es cambiar de negocio a la venta de gas. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el momento de distracción que tienen en cada reunión
texts.en:
Mrs. Clorinda has been a member of the community bank “Las Calceteras” for 3 years, and she lives in the District of Juliaca, Province of San Román, Department of Puno. She is 35 years old, has a live-in partner and two children. She has a fifth-grade education; she buys and sells bricks and snacks. Clorinda tells us that the first loan she requested from Movimiento Manuela Ramos was for S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles (currency of Peru) and she used it to increase her working capital. She is now requesting a loan for S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles which she will use to buy snacks such as candy, chocolates, cookies, sodas, etc. Her dream for the future is to switch her business to selling gas. What she likes the most about her community bank is the break she gets attending each meeting.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy candy, chocolates, cookies, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos es una persona de 31 años de edad, su estado civil es soltero, tiene un 1 hijo que depende de él. Juan Carlos trabaja como transportista de pasajeros, es decir es chofer de taxi. Si bien hay bastante competencia en el rubro del transporte de pasajeros de taxi, también hay bastante demanda del servicio por lo que se hace rentable el negocio y además de que Juan Carlos cuenta con experiencia en el rubro y sabe donde puede conseguir mayor cantidad de clientes a diferentes horas del día. El crédito fue solicitado para realizar mejoras en la vivienda donde habita, el vive en casa de su mamá junto también a su hijo. Juan Carlos no tiene una experiencia crediticia ya que este es su primer crédito.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 31 years old. His marital status is single, and he has one dependent child. He works transporting passengers, as a taxi driver. If there is substantial competition in his business, there is also substantial demand for taxis, which allows him to lease his business. In addition, Juan Carlos has much experience as a taxi driver and knows where to find a steady supply of customers at all hours of the day. This loan was requested to make improvements in his residence, which he shares with his mother and his son. As this is his first loan request, Juan Carlos has no credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home Improvement

loans.name: Gabina

texts.es:
La señora Gabina es socia del Banco Comunal “Cristo Blanco” desde hace 4 meses atrás, del distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 74 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 08 hijos. Ella estudió hasta segundo de primaria, se dedica a la elaboración de pan.

Gabina nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 200.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  azúcar, harina, manteca, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es vender mas y obtener mas ganancias. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones con las socias y la responsabilidad
texts.en:
Señora Gabina has been a member of the communal bank “Cristo Blanco” for the last 4 months. She is 74, from the Juliaca district, San Román province, Puno department, a widow with 8 children. She was schooled through the second primary level, her business is bread making. Gabina tells us that her first loan from Movimiento Manuela Ramos in the amount of $110 increased her capital. She is now requesting a loan of $75 in order to buy sugar, flour, butter, etc. Her dream for the future is to sell more and increase her profits. She especially likes the meetings and the responsibility of her communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Gladys María

texts.es: La Sra. Gladys J. es profesora de primaria el crédito lo solicita para reparación de su vivienda compra de zinc, perlines y mano de obra. Y si los créditos le han ayudado muchísimo ya que tiene 9 años de trabajar con ceprodel ha tenido catorce crédito y todos los ha invertido en su casa antes de 9 años no tenia casa y ahora tengo una hermosa y bonita casa y todo se lo agradezco a ceprodel que me han dado esa oportunidad de darme crédito. Soy casada tengo un niño y está en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Gladys J. is an elementary school teacher. She needs funding to do some home repair projects. She needs to buy zinc metal sheeting and pay labor costs. The loans have been much help to her because she has collaborated with CEPRODEL for nine years and has had 14 loans. She invested them in her home. "Nine years ago I didn't have a house and now I have a beautiful, pretty house. For all that I am grateful to CEOPRODEL for giving me the opportunity to have credit. I'm married and have a school-age son."

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy zinc metal sheeting.

loans.name: Ana Milena

texts.es:
Ana Milena A. Jiménez, es una joven negociante que vive en Barranquilla con su cónyuge que es conductor  y sus dos hijas de 4 y 7 años.
Desde hace mas de tres años se dedica al comercio    y en la actualidad vende  especialmente vestidos y calzados deportivos para damas, caballeros y niños; comenzó su negocio con la venta de  cosméticos y colonias mediante  catálogos empresariales, pero añoraba tener su capital de trabajo propio y mediante los créditos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo ha podido crearlo. Siempre le ha gustado ser independiente y ayudar en los gastos del hogar, sus principales clientes son empleados que están ubicadas en el sector de las Nieves, barrio donde ella vive, que se encuentra circundado por grandes empresas; su primer mercado domestico con el cual comenzó su negocio fue su familia y como es muy amigable consigue clientes muy rápidamente. En la actualidad está solicitando un crédito por valor de $1.300.000 precisamente para responder a pedidos de calzado deportivo, vestidos para damas, caballeros y niños que le han hecho sus clientes.
Su sueño grande es tener un almacén y una vivienda propia, tiene actualmente un e desafío muy importante y es el compartir su actividad como negociante con el cuidado y dedicación de sus hijos y las actividades domésticas propias de una mamá responsable..
texts.en:
Ana Milena A. Jiménez, is a young businesswoman living in Barranquilla with her spouse, who is a driver, and their two daughters ages 4 and 7. She has been in business for more than 3 years, and currently sells mainly sports clothing and footwear for women, men and children. She started her business selling cosmetics and colognes from catalogs, but she missed having her own working capital, and through loans from Mario Santo Domingo Foundation she was able to accumulate it. She has always enjoyed being independent and contributing to the household expenses. Her main clients are around the Las Nieves area, the neighborhood where she lives, workers she meets going to the large businesses. Her first domestic market, where she got her start, was her family, and since she is very friendly, she rapidly obtained additional clients. Currently she is requesting a loan of $675 in order to fill orders already made by her clients for sports footwear and outfits for women, men and children. Her biggest dream is to have a shop and her own home. Her challenge now is to juggle her business along with the childcare and the household work of any responsible mother.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stock to fill orders

loans.name: Serapio Jose

texts.es:
El Sr. Serapio Jose, tiene 38 años de edad, es soltero y viven en la ciudad de El Alto en casa familiar, tiene como actividad un punto internet con 20 maquinas, además de tener una tienda de articulos para animales, pues está estudiando para medico veterinario ya esta en octavo semestre de la carrera, es una persona responsable y trabajadora ya que estudia y trabaja, uno de sus deseos es salir profesional y muy pronto formar una familia.

El crédito solicitado es para comprar hojas bond por cajas, además de papel fotografico y realizar el mantenimiento respectivo de las maquinas. El internet se encuentra ubicado en la avenida buenos aires cerca a la agencia buenos aires, esta agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Serapio Jose, 38, is single and lives in the city of El Alto in his family's house. He has an internet cafe with 20 machines. In addition, he has a store where he sells items for animals, since he is studying to become a veterinarian. He is already in the 8th semester of this degree program. He is a person who is responsible and hardworking, given that he both studies and works. One of his wishes is to become a professional and in a short time to form his own family. The loan requested is to buy boxes of reams of paper, photographic paper, and also to carry out maintenance on his computers. His internet business is located on the Buenos Aires Avenue near the Buenos Aires Agency. He is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence provided in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy printer and photographic paper, and to do maintenance on his electronic equipment

loans.name: Sigifredo

texts.es:
Sigifredo M. M., tiene la edad de 74 años, está soltero, y vive solo. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono, fertilizantes, cal y herbicidas, para darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café, y así lograr una mejor calidad y obtener un mayor ingreso cuando sea tiempo de la cosecha. El tiene sembrada una hectárea de café.No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Sigifredo tiene más de 25 años de trabajar en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro mejorar su calidad de vida y obtener una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Sigifredo M. M., 74, is single and living alone. He needs this loan to improve his farm, specifically to grow coffee beans. He plans to purchase soil amendments, fertilizer, lime and herbicides for the optimal cultivation of the coffee plants for better quality and higher income at harvest time. He has planted one hectare with coffee. This is not his first loan through FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the services provided. Don Sigifredo has worked in agriculture for more than 25 years. He hopes in the future to improve his quality of life and have greater economic stability, to keep growing both as a person and as a provider.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for coffee agriculture

loans.name: Ianuari

texts.en:
Ianuari A. is 49 and married with 4 children (ages 7 - 16). She owns a business venture, selling ice-cakes (flavored ice in styrofoam cups).  Ianuari has 4 years of experience in this business.  Ianuari needs a loan of WST $1300 to buy sugar, styrofoam cups, and codial (flavoring).  She plans to use the earnings from her business to improve/expand the business.  Ianuari is a hard working client which she want to continue her business

Ianuari joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Ianuari's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Ianuari A. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy sugar, styrofoam cups, and codial (flavoring)

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su madre en el caserío Huertas Mariátegui de la ciudad de Lambayeque ubicado a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace un año se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros), el servicio lo brinda cubriendo rutas entre la ciudad de Lambayeque y sus caseríos. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta y le sirve para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar al sostenimiento de su familia.

El continuo uso brindado a su unidad móvil ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas mecánicas que necesitan de urgente reparación. Por ello, se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en los gastos de mantenimiento y reparación de su vehículo.

Roberto es un joven responsable y trabjador, el ya ha trabajado anteriomente con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Roberto, 22, is single, living with his mother in the Huertas Mariátegui suburb of the city of Lambayeque, one half hour from the city of Chiclayo. He has been providing transportation with his mototaxi (a motorized vehicle used to transport freight and passengers) for the last year. He has routes between the city of Lambayeque and its suburbs. This business is his only income, enabling him to take care of his personal expenses and help with the support of his family. The continual use of his vehicle has caused it to start having some mechanical failures that urgently need repair. Therefore he is requesting a loan of $425 from Edpyme Alternativa to cover the maintenance and repair expenses of his vehicle. Roberto is a responsible and hard-working young man, he has previously worked through our Institution and has shown himself to be a responsible and punctual client.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair and maintenance

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La señora GUILLERMINA G. S., tiene 72 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo , departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES AL PROGRESO.
La empresaria es analfabeta, refiere que por falta de recursos económicos empezó a trabajar desde niña. La socia es casada  y tiene 4 hijos todos mayores e independientes. GULLERMINA se dedica a  la venta de productos alimenticios en la tienda de comestibles que tiene en su casa.
El primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de productos alimenticios.
Con este crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles lo utilizará para la compra de mas productos alimenticios para abastecer su tienda como arroz, fideos, azúcar, menestras, etc.
Ella sueña con abastecer su tienda y tener todos los productos que sus clientes le solicitan.
texts.en:
Señora GUILLERMINA G. S.,72, lives in the district and province of Trujillo, La Libertad department, Peru. She belongs to the communal bank MUJERES AL PROGRESO. She is illiterate and has worked since a child because of economic necessity. She is married with 4 children, all grown and independent. Gullermina sells food products from the food shop in her home. Her first loan of $100 was used to buy food products. With this loan of $300 she will buy more food supplies, stocking her shop with rice, noodles, sugar, vegetable stew, etc. Her dream is to have a well-supplied shop with everything her clients need.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grocery stock

loans.name: Maryeth

texts.es: La Sra. Maryeth M. C. es profesora de primaria de un colegio del municipio de san Rafael, el crédito lo solicita para pago de energía eléctrica y compra de medicamentos ya que tiene enferma a su mama y necesita un medicamento que es caro y solo así puede comprarlo, es casada tiene tres hijos, dos ya mayores y uno menor que está en edad escolar, y si los créditos le han ayudado mucho ya que los créditos anteriores  lo ha realizado para remodelación de su casa   tiene tres años de trabajar con nosotros.
texts.en:
Maryeth M. C. is an elementary school teacher in a school in San Rafael. She requests funding to pay her electricity bill and to buy medicine because her mother is ill and needs medicine that is very expensive and she can only afford it if she gets a loan. She is married and has three children, two who are adults and one youngster, who is still school-aged. The loans have been of great help to her in that the previous ones have been used to remodel her house. She has been a client of ours for three years.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicine and pay a utility bill.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Sabina es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan de Dios” desde hace 8 meses atrás, del distrito y provincia de Lampa, departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 04 hijos. Ella estudio secundaria completa, se dedica a la venta de tejidos de artesanía.

Sabina nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 200.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 200.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar lana, bayeta, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es agrandar su negocio y así aumentar su ganancia.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal es como esta organizado todo con las socias.
texts.en:
Señora Sabina, a member of the communal bank “San Juan de Dios” for 8 months, is from the district and province of Lampa, Puno department. She is 35, living with her spouse and 4 children. She has completed her secondary education, her business is selling woven handicrafts. Sabina tells us that with her first loan of $75 from Movimiento Manuela Ramos, she was able to increase her working capital. With this loan of $75 she will be able to purchase wool, fabrics, etc. Her dream for the future is to enlarge her business and increase her profits. The thing she likes best about her communal bank is that it is all organized by the members.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of handicraft supplies

loans.name: Bellamis Astrid

texts.es:
Bellamis Astrid C. M.  vive en el popular barrio la Luz de Barranquilla, tiene 34 años de edad  y  junto a su cónyuge (a la izquierda de la foto) tiene un negocio de  elaboración y venta de alimentos, el cual inició cuando  este último quedó sin empleo después de trabajar durante 20 años en una empresa; desde ahí surgió la idea de elaborar los deliciosos   arroz de pescado y arroz de pollo. Es parte de la rutina de Bellamis levantarse  en la madrugada y desde las 2.00 am  iniciar  la tarea de preparar las ollas de arroz, para que más tarde  su esposo, salga a venderlo en un punto estratégico en la salida de la ciudad de Barranquilla, en el  departamento del Atlántico vía de la ciudad de  Santa Marta en el departamento del Magdalena.
Bellamis se vinculó a los programas de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo desde hace tres años y ha recibido  3 créditos; en la actualidad solicita financiación por valor de $1.500.000, porque con una parte  de este dinero, pretende ampliar la muy pequeña cocina donde casi no cabe su estufa industrial,  que precisamente compró al obtener su anterior crédito;  y con el saldo restante, comprar materias primas e insumos  en  mayor volumen, para obtener un mejor precio en sus materias primas y de esta forma aumentar las utilidades, que mucho le contribuyen a sacar adelante a sus  tres  hijos en las edades de 17, 16 y 1 año; Ella está muy de acuerdo con su esposo, en que hay mucho por hacer, pues  los 2  hijos mayores aun están estudiando bachillerato y el menor está en una guardería del estado
texts.en:
Bellamis Astrid C. M. lives in the Luz de Barranquilla neighborhood. She is 34, and together with her spouse (at left in the photo) she has a business making and selling foods, a business she started when her spouse was unemployed after having worked with one company for 20 years. From there she had the idea to make delicious dishes of rice with fish and rice with chicken. Part of her routine is to arise very early, starting the task of preparing the rice at 2:00 am, so that later her spouse can go out selling it at a strategic spot at the exit from the city of Barranquilla on the way to the city of Santa Marta. Bellamis joined the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation program three years ago and has received three loans. Currently she is requesting a loan of $800, partly to enlarge her tiny kitchen that hardly holds the industrial range that she bought with the last loan. With the rest she will buy raw materials and supplies in large volume, in order to pay the best price for her supplies and increase her profits. This will greatly help her 3 children, ages 17, 16 and 1, to get ahead. She fully agrees with her spouse that there is much to be done, because the two elder are studying for their BA and the younger is in a public daycare.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials and supplies

loans.name: Victorino

texts.es:
Victorino S. V., tiene la edad de 47 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa y 3 hijos. Sus hijos tienen 16,10 y 9 años, ellos son su razón de ser. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para dar mantenimiento al cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y  fertilizantes para darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo,y así lograr una mejor calidad, una mayor producción y obtener un mayor ingreso cuando sea tiempo de la cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Victorino tiene más de 30 años de trabajar en la agricultura, y lo heredó de su padre. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, además de poder brindar a sus hijos el estudio, además, poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Victorino S. V. is 47 years old, is married, and lives with his wife and three children. His children are 16, 10, and 9 years old and are his reason for living. He would like this loan in order to help out with his farm and specifically to maintain his coffee crop. His idea is to buy compost and fertilizer in order to adequately maintain the coffee and in turn achieve a better quality crop and higher production, as well as obtain a higher income when it is time to harvest. It is the first time that Victorino is requesting a loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the terms that they offered him. Don Victorino has been working in agriculture for over 30 years and learned from his father. He hopes to offer his family a better quality of life and more economic stability in the future, in addition to being able to send his children to school and being able to continue growing as a person and a producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Assistance for his coffee crop

loans.name: Aiga

texts.en:
Aiga T. is 55 and married with 5 children (ages 7 - 26).  She owns a business venture, selling ice-cakes (flavored ice in styrofoam cups).  Aiga has 2 years of experience in this business.  Aiga needs a loan of WST $1500 to buy sugar, styrofoam cups, and codial (flavoring).  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.  Aiga T. is a strong, motivated client and wishes to have not only the ice cake busines but also a back up business to assist her with planting and elei as well.

In 2009, Aiga joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Aiga's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Aiga T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                         2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy sugar, styrofoam cups, and codial (flavoring)

loans.name: Emilse

texts.es:
Emilse Jiménez Méndez vive en el barrio Ciudadela 20 de Julio cerca del Estadio Metropolitano donde juega el Junior, equipo de fútbol de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Su barrio está al sur de esta ciudad y es muy comercial, allí se mezclan viviendas y negocios que coexisten con centros comerciales. Está separada y tiene tres hijas de 22, 20 y 19 años. Es propietaria  de la “Peluquería Miche” desde hace 14 años y ahora solicita un crédito con el fin de remodelar el negocio, mejorar sus equipos de trabajo y comprar productos de belleza, al por mayor y de contado.
Inició su negocio en el barrio San José en el año 1996: después de haber estudiado la belleza y la enfermería, scogió la belleza y abrió su primera peluquería con solo una silla, un espejo y unas herramientas básicas. Un año después  se trasladó a la Ciudadela 20 de Julio donde ha vivido y trabajado en la misma vivienda hasta hoy. El sector, debido a su comercialización y su movimiento comercial, ha favorecido el negocio y se ve en el crecimiento que ha experimentado.
Emilse se vinculó a los programas   de la Fundación desde hace tres años y éste es su tercer crédito. Siente que el impacto de los créditos ha sido favorable y le ha permitido progresar tanto en el negocio como en su vida familiar. A pesar de su éxito, quiere seguir adelante y con este fin pronto se mudará  para el barrio Las Cayenas, donde también trasladará su peluquería, que quiere  acondicionar en una parte de su casa. Su hija de 19 años está terminando sus estudios en cosmetología y más adelante, quiere juntarse con dos de sus hijas para montar un spa las tres.
texts.en:
Emilse Jiménez Méndez lives in the suburb of Ciudadela 20 de Julio, near the Estadio Metropolitano where el Junior, the city of Barranquilla's football team, plays. Her area is in the south of the city and is very commercial, with a mix of homes and shops that co-exist with commercial centres. Emilse is separated and has 3 daughters - 22, 20 and 19 years of age. She has been the proprietor of “Peluquería Miche” for 14 years and is now seeking a loan to remodel her business, improve her work tools and purchase beauty products. Emilse began her business in the suburb of San José in 1996: after having studied beauty therapy and nursing she chose beauty therapy and opened her first hair-dressing salon with only one chair, one mirror and some basic tools. One year later she moved to Ciudadela 20 de Julio where she has lived and worked in the same house until today. The sector, owing to its commercialisation and commercial movement, has favoured the business and this is seen in its growth. Emilse has been connected with the Fundación's program for 3 years and this is her third loan. She feels that the impact of the loans has been favourable and they have permitted her to progress as far in her business as she has with her life. Despite her success she wants to move forward and with this end soon she will move to the suburb of Las Cayenas, where she will also move her hair-dressing salon which she wants to fit out in a part of her house. Her 19 year old daughter is finishing her studies in cosmetology, and in the future, she wants to come together with 2 of her daughters to have a spa.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rennovations to business, purchase work tools and beauty products

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel, de 43 años, vive feliz en su casa propia al lado de sus tres hijos: Lucero (17), Evelyn (14) y Ángel (3).
Desde hace 2 años, esta laboriosa mujer, se dedica al servicio de fotografías al instante; este oficio consiste en tomar fotos de diferente tamaño y revelarlas al momento. Su establecimiento  está ubicado en un centro comercial muy concurrido de su ciudad y a veces la ayudan sus hijas, pero la mayor parte del tiempo lo realiza sola. Maribel atiende de lunes a sábado durante todo el día y está muy satisfecha porque le genera buenos ingresos, los que le alcanzan para tener una buena calidad de vida. A su vez, le gusta mucho este trabajo porque no requiere de mucho esfuerzo, puede interactuar con sus clientes y además se entretiene mucho. Y como es una mujer emprendedora, para el futuro, tiene planeado ampliar su tienda de fotos, ya que en la actualidad le está quedando algo pequeña.

Este es el 2do préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible la obtención de su crédito, el que la ayudará a seguir progresando. Maribel tiene planeado invertir el dinero que ahora solicita en la compra de una nueva impresora de fotos para continuar laborando tranquilamente.
texts.en:
Maribel, 43 years of age, lives happily in her own house alongside her 3 children: Lucero (17), Evelyn (14) and Ángel (3). For 2 years this hard-working woman has worked in instant photography. This consists of taking photos of different sizes and developing them right afterwards. Her establishment is located in a popular commercial centre in the city and sometimes her daughters help her, but the biggest part of the business she does alone. Maribel attends the store from Monday to Saturday all day, and is very satisfied because she generates good earnings which allow her to have a good quality of life. She really likes this job because it doesn't require much force, she can interact with her customers and is entertained a lot. As she is a hard-working woman, in the future she has plans to expand her photo shop as now it is actually a little small. This is her second loan with MFP and she is very thankful to all those peoples that have made it possible for her to receive her loan, which willl help her to progress. Maribel plans to invest the money that she is seeking in the purchase of a new photo printer to continue working peacefully.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a photo printer

loans.name: Erick José

texts.es: El Sr. Erick M. S. solicita el crédito para compra de materiales como madera, clavos, piedra y cemento para terminar de construir su casa ya que la tiene a media no la había podido terminar de hacer, ha tenido tres créditos con ceprodel y los ha invertido en su casa, casado le tienen 3 hijos dos en edad escolar, los crédito que ha tenido con ceprodel le han ayudado mucho ya que ha podido salir adelante con su hogar ahora ya tienen un techo sus hijos donde estar antes no lo tenía con los dos créditos anterior con el primero compro el terreno y con el segundo la empezó a construir y ahora ya la va a terminar.
texts.en:
Erick M. S. is requesting the loan for the purchase of materials such as wood, nails, stone and cement to finish building his house since it is half finished and he has not been able to complete it. He has had three loans with Ceprodel and has invested them in his house. He is married with 3 children, 2 of whom are school-aged. The loans that he has had with Ceprodel have helped a lot since he has been able to get ahead with his house that now has roof;the place where he lived before didn't have one. With his first loan, he purchased the land, with the second he started to build and now he is going to finish it.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood, nails, stone and cement

loans.name: Nilea Irma

texts.es:
La señora Nilea es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” desde hace 3 meses atrás, del distrito de Acora, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y tiene 04 hijo. Ella  estudio primaria completa, se dedica a la compra y venta de ovinos.

Nilea nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar ovejas cara negra.

Su sueño para el futuro es comprar corderos y engordarlos.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad de las socias para cada reunión.
texts.en:
Nilea has been a member of the "San Pedro" communal bank for three months; it is located in Acora district, Puno department. She is 39 years old, married, and has 4 children. She completed elementary school and she is a sheep merchant. Nilea tells us that she used her first, 300 new sol, loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement to increase her capital. She is asking for an 800 new sol loan to buy blackface sheep. Her dream for the future is to raise sheep and fatten them up for sale. What she likes best about her communal bank is the punctuality each member shows for each meeting.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy blackface sheep.

loans.name: Jesús Mariana

texts.es:
Jesús Mariana L. Gómez tiene 19 años, es soltero, y no tiene hijos.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

La  socia es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Calzado Solidario es un recinto que se encuentra a quince minutos del Cantón San Miguel en la vía a la costa.  Son 19 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.

Jesús trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, papas y también a la cría de aves.  Vende los productos en la feria de San Miguel.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero.  También, a Jesús le gusta cuidar a los animales.

Jesús solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Jesús Mariana L. Gómez is 19, single, and doesn't have any children. She lives in the area of San Miguel in the provine of Bolívar. Jesúsis a member of the rural group Calzado Solidario which is a fairground located 15 minutes from Cantón San Miguel along the coastal road. There are 19 members in total, the majority of whom work in agriculture and breeding animals. Jesús works in agriculture to increase her family's economic well-being. The crops that she is most successful with are maize, potatoes and raising birds. She sells her products in the San Miguel market. Her principle business is the carnival is celebrated every year in February. Jesús also likes looking after the animals. Jesús is seeking a loan to purchase supplies for her agricultural work. Her goal is to have good economic activity for her family. The challenges that she faces are the climate problems that affect her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Iris Marvely

texts.es:
La joven Iris A. trabaja como asalariada en una escuela que queda en Puerto Morazán un municipio del viejo.
Ella va a utilizar este crédito para remodelación y mejorar su casa en compra de electrodomésticos, y laminas de zinc para reparar el techo. 
Ella ya tiene varios años de trabajar como profesora de primaria y gracias a ello ha podido salir adelante con su familia.
Iris es una joven que no tiene hijos, solo vive con su marido en casa de su familia y ambos trabajan para llevar el sostén al hogar.

La joven nos dijo que el trabajar con CEPRODEL, le ha servido de mucho ya que ha podido mejorar su vivienda y comprar algunos de sus electrodomésticos que ella utiliza en el hogar y que espera seguir trabajando con la Institución ya que le ha brindado la oportunidad de demostrar su responsabilidad, y honestidad dentro del campo laboral como personal.
texts.en:
Iris A. is a salaried employee of a school that is in Puerto Morazán. She will use the funds to remodel and improve her home and to buy appliances. She also needs to buy zinc metal sheeting to repair her roof. She has worked as an elementary school teacher for several years and this has made it possible to get ahead in life with her family. Iris is a young woman who does not have any children; she lives with her husband in her relative's house; both work to support their household. She told us that working with CEPRODEL has been very useful for her because she has been able to improve her home and buy some appliances she uses; she hopes to continue to work with the institution because it has offered her the opportunity to show her responsibility and honesty both in work and personally.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home improvements and to buy appliances.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina P. is 25 and married with 5 children (ages 1 - 12).  She owns a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  Selina has 2 years of experience in this business.  Selina needs a loan of WST $1500 to buy raw ingredients for cooked foods.  She plans to use the earnings from her business to assist her family with the business activities such as a food stall for the school canteen.

In 2009, Selina joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Selina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Selina P. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                         2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooked foods

loans.name: Preventiva

texts.es:
Preventiva, de 37 años, vive en una casa alquilada, en compañía de su pareja Guillermo (36), quien es albañil, y de sus dos hijas; Jackye (13) y Ana Luz (6).
Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la crianza de animales; como cuyes, conejos, carneros y pollos, a los que cuida con mucho esmero hasta que crezcan y engorden y los pueda vender a los comerciantes de los mercados de su localidad. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que se entretiene mucho con los animales y no es difícil, además tiene la ayuda de sus hijas. Con las ganancias obtenidas puede ayudar a su esposo con los constantes gastos del hogar, además paralelamente siembra papa y maíz, cuya cosecha comercializa en los mercados de su zona.
Siendo una mujer emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado comprar mayor cantidad de animales, ya que sabe que este negocio es muy rentable.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas, ya que sabe que solo así podrá acceder a otros préstamos en adelante. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de carneros, cuyes y pollos, los que engordará para luego comercializar.
texts.en:
Preventiva is 37 years old and lives in a rented house with her partner Guillermo (age 36) and their two daughters, Jackye (age 13) and Ana Luz (age 6).

For the past four years she has been raising animals such as guinea pigs, rabbits, sheep, and chickens. She takes great care in looking after her animals until they are large enough to be sold to merchants at the local market. What she enjoys about her work is that it is easy and the animals keep her entertained. At the same time, it helps her support her daughters. The money she has earned has allowed her to help her husband with the constant household expenses. Preventiva also grows potatoes and corn, which she sells at the local markets. Being an enterprising woman, she has plans in the future to buy more animals because she knows this business is very profitable.

This is her first loan with MFP. She promises to complete her payments on time because that is the only way for her to access additional loans in the future. With the money she is requesting, Preventiva will buy more sheep, guinea pigs, and chickens to fatten so that she can sell them later.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep, guinea pigs, and chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase compost & fertilizers to maintain his coffee crop

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.es:
La señora Nemesia es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan de Dios” desde hace 3 años, vive en el distrito y provincia de Lampa, departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y tiene 02 hijos. Ella estudio hasta quinto de secundaria, se dedica a la venta de pokor (bocadito de maíz).

Nemesia nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital e iniciar su negocio.

Con este crédito  de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles comprará maíz, aceite, sal, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es agrandar su negocio y así mejorar sus ingresos.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las capacitaciones que dan las promotoras y la organización de las socias.
texts.en:
Nemesia has been a member of the communal bank "San Juan de Dios" for 3 years. She lives in the district and province of Lampa, in the Puno department. She is 39 years old and is married with 2 children. She completed her secondary studies through the 5th year, and she has a business selling pokor (corn snacks.) Nemesia tells us that with the first loan she requested from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization, which was for 300 Peruvian soles, she was able to increase her capital and start her business. With this loan of 500 Peruvian soles she will buy corn, cooking oil, salt, etc. Her dream for the future is to increase her business and in this way improve her income. What she likes most about her communal bank are the training sessions that are given by the promoters and the organization.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy corn, cooking oil, salt, etc.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.es: El Sr. Rudy S. A. trabaja en el minsa  es micro copista, tiene 20 años de trabajar para esta institución el crédito los solicita para ampliación de vivienda compra de materiales de construcción como piedra cantera, zinc, hierro, estribos, cemento y pago de mano de obra. Es casado le tienen dos hijos los dos en edad escolar. Y si el crédito anterior le ayudo a levantar su casa y ahora necesita terminarla y si está agradecido con ceprodel ya que estos créditos es una forma de ayudarnos a nosotros los pobres que no podemos construir nuestra de una sola vez tenemos que ir poco a poco.
texts.en:
Rudy S. A. has worked as a microscope technician for the Ministry of Health for 20 years. He needs funding to enlarge his home. He needs to buy building materials like: paving stones, zinc metal sheeting, iron, beams, cement as well as pay labor costs. He is married and has two, school-age children. The previous loan made it possible for him to build his house; now he needs to finish it. He is grateful to CEPRODEL because "these loans help us poor people to help ourselves," "we can't build our houses all at one time, we have to go bit by bit."

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone, gravel and cement.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocío, de 36 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su pequeña hija Fabiana (11), y de sus hermanas. 
Desde hace un par de años se dedica a la venta de salchipapas (papas y salchichas fritas) en la puerta de su casa. Hace un mes su hermana le traspasó su bodega y ahora está muy contenta porque durante todo el día atiende su tienda de comestibles y por las noches se ocupa de su puesto de salchipapas, el que tenía desde hace tiempo atrás. Ambas actividades le gustan mucho y le generan buenas ganancias, lo que le permite brindarle a su hija una adecuada calidad de vida. A su vez, tiene planes de ampliar su tienda y con el tiempo implementar un pequeño restaurante donde ofrezca sus salchipapas y otras variedades de comida rápida.

Este es el 4to préstamo que tiene con MFP y está dispuesta a ser puntual en el pago de todas sus cuotas, ya que sabe que pertenece a uno de los bancos comunales más organizados y no quiere defraudarlos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo destinará a la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para su tienda y también se abastecerá de comestibles (aceite, papas, huevos) para su puesto de salchipapas, con esto busca seguir progresando cada día.
texts.en:
Rocio is 36 years old and lives in her own home with her young daughter Fabiana (age 11) and her sisters.

For the past two years, Rocio has been selling salchipapas (fried potatoes and sausages) from the doorstep of her house. One month ago, her sister moved her grocery store over to her house and now she is happy because she gets to tend to the store during the day. At night, Rocio still operates her food stand as she has done for some time. She enjoys managing both businesses because they generate good revenues and enable her to provide her daughter with an adequate quality of life. For now, she has plans to expand her store and eventually open a small restaurant where she sells salchipapas and other types of fast food.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Rocio is already used to making all of her payments on time because she does not want to disappoint her Communal Bank, which is known for being one of most organized groups. The money she requested will be used to buy a large quantity of merchandise for her store as well as ingredients (oil, potatoes, and eggs) for her salchipapa stand so that she can keep progressing each day.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store & ingredients for her food stand

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina, de 56 años, vive en una casa alquilada, al lado de sus dos jóvenes hijos; Aquira (30) y Julio (23).
Desde hace 7 años se dedica a la venta de artículos para el hogar; como sábanas, edredones adornos de sala y juguetes. Según la temporada del año trata de adecuarse a las necesidades de su habituales clientes, quienes generalmente le hacen pedidos de los artículos que necesitan. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque es tranquilo y lo hace desde su vivienda, donde acuden sus amistades y vecinos; además le genera buenas ganancias, pues su mercadería la consigue a bajos precios. Valentina sabe que el éxito de su negocio radica en la manera cómo trata a sus clientes, por lo que se esmera que brindarles un trato muy amable. Por otro lado, está muy satisfecha porque sigue trabajando como enfermera en un hospital de la localidad donde vive, siendo esa la profesión que estudió. Adicionalmente a su trabajo, recibe el apoyo económico de su hijo mayor, quien es dentista. Para el futuro, tiene planeado instalar un local de venta de todo tipo de artículos para el hogar donde pueda atender a sus clientes en un lugar fijo.

Este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y desde ya está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que puedan hacer posible su préstamo, ya que podrá seguir adelante con las metas que se ha propuesto en la vida. Valentina tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en artículos para el hogar, ya que tiene varios pedidos por cumplir.
texts.en:
Valentina is 56 years old and lives in a rented house with her two children, Aquira (age 30) and Julio (age 23).

For the past seven years, she has been selling household products such as bed sheets, quilts, living room decorations, and toys. Based on the time of year, she adjusts her inventory based on the needs of her regular customers who place orders with her whenever they want specific items.
