Valentina enjoys her job because it is quiet and she is able to work from home, which is where her friends and neighbors go to place their orders. She generates good revenue because she offers products at low prices. Valentina knows that the success of her business is determined by how she treats her customers, so she works hard to make their experience pleasant. On the other hand, she is satisfied that she is still able to work as a nurse at the local hospital since she studied to be in this profession. In addition to the income from her work, she receives financial support from her eldest son, who is a dentist. For the future, Valentina plans to open a store where she sells all types of household items so that she can serve her customers from an established location.

This is her first loan with MFP. Valentina is grateful to everyone who made this loan possible because it will help her move forward to achieve her goals in life. She plans to use the money to purchase more house wares so that she can fulfill her outstanding orders.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to fulfill her outstanding orders

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Teofilo Absalon

texts.es:
Teofilo Absalon León Martínez tiene 56 años, es casado, y  tiene tres hijos.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Calzado Solidario es un recinto que se encuentra a quince minutos del Cantón San Miguel en la vía a la costa.  Son 19 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.

Teofilo trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz y chochos.  Vende los productos en la feria de San Miguel.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero y la fiesta del patrón.  También, a Teofilo le salir con la familia.

Teofilo solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para el trabajo del campo.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia y construir su casa.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Teofilo Absalon León Martínez is 56 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in the District of San Miguel in the Province of Bolívar. Teofilo has been member of the Communal Bank “Calzado Solidario”, which meets in an enclosed area 15 minutes away from the District of San Miguel along the coast. There are a total of 19 members in the group, which is composed mainly of farmers and livestock breeders.

Teofilo works as a farmer to improve his family’s financial situation. The crops he grows the best are corn and legumes. He sells his products at the San Miguel Fair.

The main cultural event is Carnival, which is celebrated every year during the month of February along with the patron saint festivals. Teofilo enjoys going out with his family.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizers for his work on the farm. His goal is to generate good economic activity to support his family and build a house. Changes in weather are among the problems he faces that impact his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds & fertilizers

loans.name: Tautala

texts.en:
Tautala H. is 50 and married with 4 children (ages 13 - 29).  She owns a business venture, catching & selling ocean-caught fish .  Tautala has 3 years of experience in this business.  Tautala needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase a fishing boat.  She plans to use the earnings from her business to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Tautala joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Tautala's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Tautala H. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                         2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma, de 46 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Javier (53), que es taxista, y con uno de sus 2 hijos; Alexis (9), porque el mayor está casado y vive aparte. 
Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de ropa y todo tipo de calzado, ella sabe que posee un gran poder de persuasión para convencer a sus habituales clientes –amigas y vecinas- sobre qué tipo de ropa o calzado le queda mejor y esto la llena de satisfacción, ya que obtiene muy buenas ganancias que le alcanzan para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. 
Paralelamente, cuida de un anciano y recibe muy buena paga por ello, motivo por el cual está orgullosa de sus labores, pues durante toda su vida ha sido muy trabajadora. Para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda de ropa y calzado en algún centro comercial de su ciudad para tener mayor estabilidad y aumentar sus ventas.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser puntual en cada una de sus cuotas, ya que está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hacen posible este crédito para que pueda salir adelante. Vilma tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en ropa y zapatos, pues tiene muchos pedidos por cumplir.
texts.en:
Vilma is 46 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Javier (age 53), who works as a taxi driver, and one of their two children, Alexis (age 9). The oldest child is married and lives separately from the rest of the immediate family.

For the past year, Vilma has been selling clothing and all types of shoes. She knows that she must utilize her persuasive skills to convince her regular customers (friends and neighbors) about which types of clothes and shoes fit best and keep them satisfied. She earns a good income that allows her to help her husband with the household expenses.

At the same time, Vilma works as an elder care provider and is compensated well for this job. She is very proud of what she has accomplished because she has worked hard all of her life. In the future, she plans to open a store at a shopping center where she sells clothing and shoes. This will provide stability to her business and help increase her sales.

This is her first loan with MFP. Vilma is very grateful to everyone who made it possible for her to receive this loan and promises to make each of her payments on time. She will use the money to purchase a large quantity of clothes and shoes so that she can fulfill her outstanding orders.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing & shoes

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal “Dios es Amor” desde que se fundó, vive en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y tiene 04 hijos. Ella estudió primaria completa, se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes.

Margarita nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital y comprar productos para su negocio.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  azúcar, aceite, arroz, fideos, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es abrir varias sucursales de tiendas. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las facilidades para los préstamos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Margarita is a member of the community bank “Dios es Amor” since the group was founded. She lives in the District of Juliaca, Province of San Román, Department of Puno. She is 49 years old, married and has 4 children. She completed her elementary school; she buys and sells groceries. Margarita tells us that the first loan she requested from Movimiento Manuela Ramos was for S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles (currency of Peru) and she used it to increase her working capital and to buy products for her business. She is now requesting a loan for S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles which she will use to buy sugar, oil, rice, noodles, etc. Her dream for the future is to open several store branches. What she likes the most about her community bank is the ease and support in getting loans.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, oil, rice, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La señora Sofía es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan de Dios” desde hace 3 años atrás, del distrito y provincia de Lampa, departamento de Puno, tiene 53 años de edad, es casada y tiene 03 hijos. Ella estudio hasta sexto de primaria, se dedica a la venta de artesanías como llijllas.

Sofía nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar lana, bayeta, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es incrementar sus ventas y capacitarse mejor.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones con las socias y las capacitaciones que da la promotora.
texts.en:
Sofia, 53, has been a member of the "San Juan de Dios" communal bank for three years; it is in the Lampa district and province, Puno department. She is married and has three children. She finished 6th grade and she is a crafts merchant, especially llijllas (a type of poncho). Sofia tells us that she used her first, 300 new sol, loan from Manuela Ramos Movement to increase her capital. She will ask for a 500 new sol loan to buy wool, flannel, etc. Her dream for the future is to increase her sales and to become better trained. What she likes best about her communal bank is the get-togethers with her fellow members and the training sessions they get from their advisor.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool, flannel, etc.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge C. González tiene 78 años, es casado, y  tiene tres hijos.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Calzado Solidario es un recinto que se encuentra a quince minutos del Cantón San Miguel en la vía a la costa.  Son 19 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.

Jorge trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, también a la cría de aves y un poco a la ganadería.  Vende los productos en la feria de San Miguel y los animales vende en la casa.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero y la fiesta del patrón San Miguel.  También, a Jorge le salir con la familia en las festividades.

Jorge solicita el crédito para comprar semillas e insumos para el trabajo del campo.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Jorge C. González is 78 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in the District of San Miguel in the Province of Bolívar. Jorge has been member of the Communal Bank “Calzado Solidario”, which meets in an enclosed area 15 minutes away from the District of San Miguel along the coast. There are a total of 19 members in the group, which is composed mainly of farmers and livestock breeders.

Jorge works as a farmer in order to improve his family’s financial situation. The crop that he grows best is corn, but he also raises poultry and a few heads of cattle. He sells his produce at the San Miguel Fair and his animals from home.

The main cultural event is Carnival, which is celebrated every year during the month of February along with the patron saint festival of San Miguel. Jorge enjoys going out with his family to enjoy the festivities.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds and supplies needed to perform his work on the farm. His goal is to generate good economic activity to support his family. Changes in weather are among the problems he faces that impact his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds & farming supplies

loans.name: William

texts.es:
William, de 38 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposa Luz (28) y su hija Josuth (2). Él tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante por el bienestar de su familia.
Desde hace un par de años se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi, le gusta mucho su trabajo porque es tranquilo y puede interactuar con sus pasajeros ocasionales. También cuenta que se distrae mucho porque es un hombre muy comunicativo, además este trabajo le genera las ganancias económicas necesarias para darle una buena calidad de vida a su familia.
A su vez, cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposa, quien atiende la tienda de comestibles que implementaron en su casa. De esta forma buscan progresar y salir adelante; para el futuro quisiera comprarse un auto nuevo y darlo en alquiler.

Aunque este es su primer préstamo con MFP, está muy seguro que será puntual en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas, ya que le gusta trabajar honradamente. William tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la reparación de su auto, ya que últimamente ha presentado algunas fallas mecánicas y quiere seguir trabajando con tranquilidad.
texts.en:
William is 38 years old and lives in his own home with his wife Luz (age 28) and their daughter Josuth (age 2). He has great desire to succeed so that he can provide for his family’s wellbeing.

For the past two years, he has been providing taxi services. He enjoys his job because it is quiet and he can occasionally interact with his passengers. At the same time, he can get distracted because he is very talkative. This work enables him to earn the income necessary to provide his family with a good quality of life. William has the unconditional support of his wife, who manages a grocery store in their home. In order to keep progressing and move ahead, he wants to buy a new car in the future that he can rent out to another driver.

Although this is his first loan with MFP, William is confident that he will complete each of his payments on time because he likes to work honestly. He plans to use the money to pay for repairs to his car, since it has recently experienced some mechanical failures and he needs to work without any problems.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Cayetana

texts.es:
La señora Cayetana es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan D. Dios” desD. hace 8 meses atrás, vive en el distrito y provincia D. Lampa, departamento D. Puno, tiene 51 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene 04 hijos. Ella estudio hasta sexto D. primaria, se dedica a la compra y venta D. carne, queso, chuño.

Cayetana nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  D. S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar carne D. alpaca, res, cordero, queso, chuño, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es agrandar su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos.

Lo que mas le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cayetana has been a member of the community bank “San Juan D. Dios” for 8 months, and she lives in the District and Province of Lampa, Department of Puno. She is 51 years old, widowed and has 4 children. She has a sixth-graD. education; she buys and sells meat, cheese and chuño (artisan freeze-dried potato; traditionally maD. in Peru). Cayetana tells us that the first loan she requested from Movimiento Manuela Ramos was for S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles (currency of Peru) and she used it to increase her working capital. She is now requesting a loan for S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles which she will use to buy alpaca meat, beef, lamb, cheese, chuño, etc. Her dream for the future is to expand her business to increase her income. What she likes the most about her community bank are the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy alpaca meat, beef, lamb, cheese, chuño, etc.

loans.name: Mele

texts.en:
Mele A. is 60 and married with 6 children (ages 20 - 30).  She owns a business venture, selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community.  Mele has 1 year of experience in this business.  Mele needs a loan of WST $1000 to buy raw ingredients for cooked foods.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Mele is a client who wishes to join the program to restart her business.

In 2010, Mele joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Mele's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Mele A. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooked foods

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Yessica, de 27 años, vive en la casa de sus padres; con ellos, su pareja Manuel de 28 años (taxista) y con sus dos pequeñas hijas: Kiara (10) y Samantha (2).
Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de productos naturales chinos para adelgazar, como infusiones y pastillas que ayudan a reducir la grasa del cuerpo. Este peculiar negocio empezó cuando ella misma comprobó sus bondades y empezó a consumirlos, ante las preguntas de sus amigas sobre cómo había bajado de peso se animó a vender estos productos.
Yessica confiesa que siempre le ha gustado trabajar en diversos negocios, pero éste es muy rentable, pues tiene muchos clientes -hombres y mujeres- que suelen hacerle pedidos con regular frecuencia. 
Paralelamente, trabaja en algunas ferias comerciales de la zona ofreciendo masajes capilares con unos aparatos modernos anti estrés y por esta actividad, que generalmente realiza los fines de semana, también obtiene buenas ganancias que le permiten ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que acceda al crédito, pues le permitirá seguir progresando. Yessica tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería (productos chinos adelgazantes) y también quiere adquirir otra máquina anti estrés.
texts.en:
Yessica is 27 years old and lives in the home of her parents with her partner Manuel, who is 28 years old and works as a taxi driver, and their two young daughters, Kiara (age 10) and Samantha (age 2).

Four years ago, Yessica began selling natural weight loss products from China, such as herbal teas and pills that help reduce body fat. She started this business after she learned about the benefits of these products and began using them herself. When her girlfriends asked her how she lost weight, Yessica was encouraged to start selling these products.

Yessica admits that she has enjoyed working in a variety of businesses, but this one has proven to be the most profitable. She has many customers, both men and women, who place orders with regular frequency. At the same time, she works at a few of the trade fairs offering massages using modern anti-stress equipment. Yessica works at the fairs mostly on the weekends, but she generates a good income that allows her to help her husband with the household expenses.

This is her first loan with MFP. Yessica is very grateful to everyone who helps to provide credit, since it helps her to continue progressing. She plans to use the money to purchase more merchandise (Chinese weight loss products) and acquire another anti-stress machine.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase weight loss products & an anti-stress machine

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” desde hace 1 año atrás, del distrito de Acora, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene 03 hijos. Ella  estudio hasta cuarto de secundaria, se dedica a la compra y venta de ovinos.

Lidia nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar una vaca.

Su sueño para el futuro es aumentar sus ventas para así vivir mejor.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las charlas que da la promotora.
texts.en:
Lidia, 37, has been a member of the "San Pedro" communal bank for a year; it is in Acora district, Puno province and department. She is married and has three children. She finished 10th grade and she is a sheep merchant. Lidia tells us that she used her first, 500 new sol, loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement to increase her capital. She will now ask for 2500 new soles to buy a cow. Her dream for the future is to increase her sales to live better. What she likes best about her communal bank is the chats her advisor gives.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es:
A primera vista es claro que Rosa Mercedes E. R. es una persona muy emprendedora. Tiene 40 años, vive en el barrio Villa del Carmen de Soledad y tiene dos hijas de 11 y 2 años de edad. Se dedica a muchas cosas para seguir adelante, sobre todo a la confección y al comercio. Ha estado vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo durante 3 años y este es su tercer crédito, el cual invertirá en la compra de mercancías, especialmente en útiles escolares, en productos de belleza y en telas e insumos para la confección.
Aprendió a coser empíricamente e inició su negocio hace 10 años elaborando colchas, sudaderas y ropa encargada por sus amigas. Como iba obteniendo experiencia, obtuvo ganancias que usó para comprar una multifuncional que le permite ofrecer fotocopias a sus vecinos y tambien para comprar una vitrina en la cual vende productos de belleza y píldoras naturales para la salud. Es más, es una conocedora de la comida: ofrece comida frita como deditos, empanadas y papas en horas de la tarde y hallacas los fines de semana,todo esto lo prepara con la ayuda de su mamá y una cuñada. Dice que con los créditos microfinancieros ha logrado desarrollar su negocio y que no contaba con recursos económicos antes de acudir a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.
A raíz de su separación hace dos años, ha tenido que enfrentar sola los desafíos de su familia y su meta es comprar una casa propia para ella y sus hijas. También quiere montar un restaurante ofreciendo comida colombiana tipo afro-caribeño que incluye mucho pescado. Con este fin a la vista, realiza actualmente un curso en el SENA de Técnico en Cocina. El horario desde las 10 de la noche hasta las 5 de la madrugada es duro, pero se muestra entusiasmada con el sueño del restaurante.
texts.en:
At first glance, it's clear that Rosa Mercedes E. R. is a very entrepreneurial woman. She is 40 years old, lives in the Villa del Carmen de Soledad neighborhood, and has 2 daughters, ages 11 and 2. She holds several jobs to improve her life, mostly tailoring and retail sales. She has been a client of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for 3 years and this is her third loan, which will be invested in the purchase of merchandise, specifically school supplies, beauty products, fabrics and supplies for tailoring. She taught herself how to sew and started her business 10 years ago, making bedspreads, sweatshirts, and custom clothing for her friends. As she gained experience, she earned more income that she used to buy a multifunctional printer/copier that allowed her to offer photocopy services to her neighbors, and a display case to sell beauty products and herbal supplements. Rosa is also a connoisseur of food: she makes fried foods such as deditos (cheese roll), empanadas, and french fries in the evenings and hallacas (meat and vegetables wrapped in cornmeal and banana leaves) on the weekends. She prepares these foods with the help of her mother and her sister-in-law. She says her micro-loans have helped her develop her business because she never had access to financial resources before working with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Since her divorce 2 years ago, Rosa has had to face many challenges alone while caring for her family. Her goal is to buy her own house for her and her daughters. She also wants to open a restaurant offering Afro-Caribbean food, which consists of a lot of fish dishes. With this end in mind, she is currently taking a culinary course at SENA de Técnico, a technical college. The schedule, 10:00 at night until 5:00 in the morning, is difficult, but she is motivated by her dream of starting a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and supplies for tailoring and purchase of merchandise, specifically school supplies and beauty products.

loans.name: Sii

texts.en:
Sii A. is 35 and married with 3 children (ages 4 - 18).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Sii has many years of experience in this business.  Sii needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2006, Sii joined SPBD.  This is her 5th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Sii's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Sii A. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.3 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.9 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                1.6 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Shirley Eva

texts.es:
Shirley, es una mujer dinámica, vive en el Distrito D. Yarina cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 34 años, es madre D. dos menores D. edad, ella se dedica a administrar su bodega, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo, quien trabaja en una triplayera.  Shirley forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Dinámicas”, desD. hace un año y medio, el primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra D. mercadería para su bodega.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito D. 700 soles, que será invertido en la compra D. diversos productos como: leche, arroz, frutas, etc. y también destinara el préstamo a la construcción D. una ramada para ampliar su bodega. La meta D. Shirley es tener una maloca (puesto) en donD. pueda vender diversos productos gastronómicos.
texts.en:
Shirley is a dynamic woman who lives in the District of Yarina Cocha, Ucayali Region. She is 34 years old and the mother of two dependent children. Shirley manages a grocery store in her home and has the support of her husband, who works at a lumber company. She joined the Communal Bank “Las Dinámicas” (The Dynamic Ones) 1½ years ago. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 PEN and used to buy merchandise for her store. Now she is requesting a loan of 700 PEN to buy various products such as milk, rice, fruit, and other items. She will also use part of the loan to build a covered patio to expand her store. Shirley’s goal is to have a place where she can sell a variety of edible delicacies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase milk, rice, fruit, and other items; build a covered patio to expand her store

loans.name: Levene

texts.en:
Levene E. is 48 and married with 4 children (ages 6 - 19).  She owns a business venture, selling bamboo handicrafts to tourists and local community members.  Levene has 2 years of experience in this business.  Levene needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Levene joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Levene's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Levene E. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.4 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                1.6 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Bertha es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” desde hace 1 ciclo atrás, del distrito de Acora, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 21 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 01 hijo. Ella  estudio secundaria completa, se dedica a la compra y venta de carne.

Bertha nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar carne de: alpaca, cordero, res, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es comprar corderos y engordarlos.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad de las socias para cada reunión.
texts.en:
Sra. Bertha is a member of the San Pedro Communal Bank and has participated in one loan cycle. She lives in the District of Acora, Province and Department of Puno. Bertha is 21 years old and a single mother with one child. She completed her high school education and earns a living by buying and selling meat.

Bertha says her first loan from Manuela Ramos was in the amount of 500 PEN, which was used to increase her operating capital. She is now requesting a loan of 1000 PEN in order to buy alpaca, lamb, beef, and other types of meat. Her greatest wish for the future is to buy lambs for fattening. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank is the punctuality of all the members when submitting their payments at each meeting.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various types of meat

loans.name: Gladys Marleny

texts.es:
La señora GLADYS MARLENI R. D. D. M., tiene 62 años, vive en el distrito D. TRUJILLO, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal JESÚS EN TI CONFIO. 
La socia  presenta estudios hasta 6TO D. Primaria, tiene 4 hijos mayores e independientes. GLADYS se dedica a la venta D. alimentos como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, menestras, papas, etc. en el puesto D. un mercado cercano a su casa. También se dedica por las tardes y noches a atender un restaurante en donD. se venD. pollo a la parrilla, anticuchos, salchipapas, gaseosas, cerveza, etc. 
Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles lo utilizó para la compra D. alimentos al por mayor como: arroz, azúcar, menestras, aceites, etc. Y ahora con su próximo crédito D. 1,000.00 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar más alimentos como: arroz, menestras, leche, azúcar, fideos, gaseosas y cerveza al por mayor.
Ella  sueña con aumentar sus ventas y así obtener mayores ganancias para sus gastos personales.

Actualmente Gladys se encuentra afiliada al seguro D. vida que MANUELA RAMOS le facilito por lo cual ella refiere que se encuentra tranquila  ante cualquier desgracia que le pudiera suceder porque con este seguro tiene la tranquilidad y el respaldo que sus gastos D. sepelio y entierro podrá ser cubierto y así no generará preocupaciones ni incomodidades a sus familiares.
texts.en:
Sra. Gladys Marleni R. D. D. M. is 62 years old, has four grown children, and lives in the District and Province of Trujillo, Department of La Libertad, Peru. Gladys is a member of the Communal Bank “Jesús en ti Confio” (Jesus in You I Trust). She has a sixth graD. education.

Gladys sells food products such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil, dried vegetables, potatoes, and other items from her vending post at the market near her home. In the afternoons and evenings, she manages a restaurant where she sells grilled chicken, anticuchos (skewered meats), salchipapas (sausages and fried potatoes), sodas, beer, and other dishes.

With her first loan of 300 PEN, she bought food in bulk such as rice, sugar, dried vegetables, oil, etc. Now she needs another loan in the amount of 1000 PEN in order to buy more food products such as rice, dried vegetables, milk, sugar, noodles, sodas, and beer in bulk. Her dreams are to increase her sales and generate better earnings so that she can cover her personal expenses.

Gladys currently has life insurance acquired through Manuela Ramos because she is concerned about any misfortune that might happen. The insurance provides peace of mind because her funeral and burial expenses will be covered so that her family does not have to be concerned or inconvenienced.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, dried vegetables, milk, sugar, noodles, sodas, and beer

loans.name: Koreti

texts.en:
Koreti P. is 26 and married with 2 children (ages 1-month and 3yrs).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Koreti has 5 years of experience in this business.  Koreti needs a loan of WST $800 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

You can view pictures of a typical plantation in Samoa, taken by a Kiva Fellow, at: http://picasaweb.google.com/agnes.p.chu/SamoanPlantation

In 2007, Koreti joined SPBD.    This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Koreti's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Koreti P. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.8 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Susana Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La Sra. Susana tiene una pequeña ventecita de golosinas y helados en su casa de habitación que queda en el municipio del Viejo.
Además ella recibe ingresos de su salario ya que trabaja como profesora en una escuela primaria.

Ella va a utilizar este crédito para comprar cebadas, chillas, linazas, frutas, etc. Para hacer frescos y vender, 
Susana es casada tiene 3 hijos y su esposo también trabaja para llevar el sostén al hogar. 

Ella dice estar muy agradecida con CEPRODEL,  ya que le ha ayudado a engrandecer su pequeño negocio y salir adelante en su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Sra. Susana has a small candy and ice cream shop in her home, which is located in the town of El Viejo. She also receives income from her salary as an elementary school teacher. Susana is married and has three children. Her husband also works to support the family.

Susana will use her loan to buy barley, chia, flaxseed, fruit, and other ingredients for making beverages to sell. She is very grateful to CEPRODEL because the support she has received has already helped her succeed in her small business and in her family life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase barley, chia, flaxseed, fruit, and other ingredients

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lizeth Nora

texts.es:
La señorita Lizeth es socia del Banco Comunal “Cristo Blanco”, es socia nueva, vive en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Ella estudió superior incompleto, se dedica a la compra y venta de cosméticos.

Este es su primer crédito, ella requiere S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, piensa invertirlo en la compra de labiales, cremas, perfumes, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es terminar la carrera y graduarse, además que su negocio crezca. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones con las socias
texts.en:
Sra. Lizeth is a new member of the Communal Bank “Cristo Blanco” (White Christ). She lives in the District of Juliaca, Province of San Román, Department of Puno. Lizeth is 20 years old, single, and does not have any children. She did not finish her college education, so she earns her living buying and selling cosmetics.

This is her first loan. She is requesting 300 PEN to buy lipsticks, creams, perfumes, and other products. Her dreams for the future are to finish her degree and graduate, as well as grow her business. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the meetings with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lipsticks, creams, perfumes, and other products

loans.name: Julia Beatriz

texts.es:
Julia Beatriz C. C. tiene 51 años, es casado, y  tiene ocho hijos.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Calzado Solidario es un recinto que se encuentra a quince minutos del Cantón San Miguel en la vía a la costa.  Son 19 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.

Julia trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen es el maíz y también se dedica a la ganadería.  Vende los productos en la feria de San Miguel y  en San Pablo.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero.  También, le gusta salir con la familia en las festividades.

Julia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y compra de animales.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Julia Beatriz C. C. is 51 years old, married, and has 8 children. She lives in the San Miguel county of Bolívar province. She is a member of the rural development fund Calzado Solidario. The premises are found 15 minutes outside San Miguel on the way to the coast. Juila's group has 19 members, who work in farming and raising small livestock. Julia works in farming to increase her family's income. Her most profitable crop is maize. She also raises livestock. She sells her products in markets in San Miguel and San Pablo. The biggest cultural event in San Miguel is Carnaval, which is celebrated every year in February. Julia also likes to go out and celebrate with her family during holidays. Julia is requesting a loan to buy supplies for farming and purchasing animals. Her goal is to have a good job to support her family. The challenges she faces are bad weather and illnesses that affect her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of farming supplies and animals.

loans.name: Juana Elia

texts.es:
La señorita Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Dios es Amor” desde hace 3 años atrás, del distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Ella estudió superior completo, se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes.

Juana nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es aumentar su negocio y sus ganancias. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es participar en las charlas que imparte la señorita promotora.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana has been a member of the Communal Bank “Dios es Amor” (God is Love) for three years. She lives in the District of Juliaca, San Román Province, Department of Puno. Juana is 28 years old, single, and does not have any children. She completed her college education and makes a living buying and selling groceries.

Juana says her first loan from Manuela Ramos was in the amount of 300 PEN and used to increase her capital. She is now requesting a loan of 1500 PEN in order to buy rice, sugar, noodles, oil, and other products. Her wish for the future is to increase her business and her earnings. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the seminars conducted by her loan officer.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, noodles, oil, and other products

loans.name: Taei

texts.en:
Taei F. is 38 and married with 6 children.  She owns a business venture, selling BBQ (sausages, chicken, plantains).  Taei has 3 years of experience in this business.  Taei needs a loan of WST $2250 to buy BBQ meat, ketchup, plastic plates & utensils, and coal.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Taei joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Taei's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Taei F. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.8 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy BBQ meat, ketchup, plastic plates & utensils, and coal

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal “Dios es Amor” desde hace 3 años atrás, del distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y tiene 03 hijos. Ella estudió hasta segundo de secundaria, se dedica a la compra y venta de golosinas.

Elizabeth nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  galletas, chocolates, caramelos, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es aumentar su negocio y sus ganancias. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las charlas que imparte la promotora.
texts.en:
Sra. Elizabeth has been a member of the Communal Bank “Dios es Amor” (God is Love) for three years. She lives in the District of Juliaca, San Román Province, Department of Puno. Elizabeth is 32 years old, married, and has three children. She completed her education through the second year of high school. Elizabeth buys and sells candy.

Her first loan from Manuela Ramos was in the amount of 300 PEN and used to increase her capital. She is now requesting a loan of 500 PEN in order to buy cookies, chocolates, caramels, and other items. Her wish for the future is to increase her business and her earnings. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the seminars conducted by her loan officer.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sweets

loans.name: Amado

texts.es:
Amado V. H., tiene 60 años de edad, está soltero, y vive con su hijo de 11 años. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar insumos como el abono, fertilizantes y herbicidas, para darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café, y así lograr una mejor calidad y obtener un mayor ingreso cuando sea tiempo de la cosecha. No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que siempre se le han brindado. Don Amado tiene una hectárea y media sembrada de café y desde hace varios años se dedica a la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su hijo los estudios, una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Amado V. H. is 60 years old and single. He lives with his 11 year old son. He wants the loan to help with his farm. Specifically, it is for his coffee crop. His plan is to buy supplies like natural fertilizer, chemical fertilizer, and herbicides to give his coffee crop adequate maintenance. This way he will obtain a better quality and get greater income at harvest time. This is not his first loan with Fudescosur. He is very happy with the services they have always given him. Amado has one and a half hectares of coffee planted. He has been a farmer for several years. In the future he hopes to give his son an education, a better quality of life, and greater economic stability. He hopes to be able to keep growing as a person and as a producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Help with coffee crop

loans.name: José Miguel

texts.es:
Josè Miguel Guzmán C. tiene 21 años, es soltero, y  no tiene hijos.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Calzado Solidario es un recinto que se encuentra a quince minutos del Cantón San Miguel en la vía a la costa.  Son 19 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.

Josè trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, papas y una  siembra  pocas cantidades de legumbres.  Vende los productos en la feria de San Miguel. 

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero en donde se reúnen todas las familias.

Josè solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y semillas para el cultivo de legumbres.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
José Miguel Guzmán C. is 21, single, and does not have children. He lives in the San Miguel district in the Bolívar province. He is a member of the Calzado Solidario Communal Bank. It meets in an area that is 15 minutes from the San Miguel district on the way to the coast. There are a total of 19 members in the group, which is composed mainly of farmers and livestock breeders. José works as a farmer in order to improve his family’s financial situation. He grows corn, potatoes, and a small amount of vegetables. His products are sold at the San Miguel Fair. The main cultural event is Carnival, which is celebrated every year during the month of February. José is requesting a loan to buy supplies for his field work and seeds for his vegetable crops. His goal is to generate good economic activity that will support his family. The main challenges that he faces are climate problems and diseases that impact his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and seeds to cultivate his crops

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” desD. hace 3 años atrás, vive en el distrito D. Acora, provincia y departamento D. Puno, tiene 47 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 05 hijos. Ella  estudio hasta segundo D. primaria, se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganado vacuno.

Francisca nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela R., que fue D. S/. 200.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  D. S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar una vaca.

Su sueño para el futuro es aumentar sus ventas para así vivir mejor.

Lo que mas le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad D. las socias para cada reunión.
texts.en:
Sra. Francisca has been a member of the San Pedro Communal Bank for the past three years. She lives in the District of Acora, Province and Department of Puno. Francisca is 47 years old, married, and has five children. She has a second graD. education and earns a living buying and selling cattle.

Francisca says the first loan she received from Manuela R. was in the amount of 200 PEN and used to increase her capital. She is now requesting a loan of 1500 PEN in order to buy a cow. Her dream for the future is to increase her sales so that she can live better. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank is the punctuality of the members for each meeting.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cow

loans.name: Luafitu

texts.en:
Luafitu T. is 40 and married with 2 children.  She owns a business venture, making clothing.  Luafitu has 4 years of experience in this business.  Luafitu needs a loan of WST $1750 to purchase additional equipment & tools such as needles & threads.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 1000 talas or US $417 per week) to improve/expand the business.

You can view pictures of sewing lavalavas and puletesis, taken by a Kiva Fellow, at: http://picasaweb.google.com/agnes.p.chu/SewingLavalavasAndPuletesi#

In 2007, Luafitu joined SPBD.    This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Luafitu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Luafitu T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.8 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment & tools such as needles & threads

loans.name: Johanna Monserrate

texts.es:
La señora Johanna tiene 28 años y tiene tres hijos; desde hace cuatro  ciclos forma parte del Banco Damas De Éxito que se reúnen cada 15 días en la ciudadela Pachecos en casa de una de las  19 socias que integran este grupo femenino emprendedor, ésta localidad está ubicada  en  la ciudad de Portoviejo en la Provincia de Manabí localidad turística por sus hermosas playas que atraen al turista nacional y extranjero durante todo el año.
 
Johanna  junto a su esposo se dedican a su soda bar donde ofrecen  comida  rápida llevan  dos años  con su negocio  que lo han ido equipando  poco a poco para dar un buen servicio a sus clientes, sus actividades inician al atardecer hasta la noche aquí ella ofrece tostadas, batidos, hamburguesas entre otros bocaditos.

La señora Johanna el préstamo invertirá en surtir su negocio sobre todo en la  compra de papas, cebolla, panes, colas, salsas y las carnes necesarias para preparar sus bocaditos, a más de  este negocio durante el día vende  ropa para damas, caballeros y niños  y una parte del préstamo invertirá en ropa para la temporada playera como ternos de baño.


Su sueño que es poder terminar de construir su casa y espera seguir trabajando para ahorra y lograrlo.
texts.en:
Johanna is 28 and has three children. She has been part of the Damas De Éxito Communal Bank for four cycles. They meet every 15 days in the Pachecos residential area in the house of one of the members. There are 19 members in this enterprising female group. This place is located in the city of Portoviejo in the Manabí province. It is a tourist location, which has beautiful beaches that attract national and foreign tourists all year long. Johanna, together with her husband, has a soda fountain where they offer fast food. They have been in the business for two years. Little by little they have been equipping it in order to give their customers better service. Their work starts in the late afternoon and continues until nighttime. She sells tostadas, milk shakes, hamburgers, and other snacks. Johanna will use the loan to stock her business. Above all she will buy potatoes, onions, bread, soft drinks, salsas, and the meat that is needed to make her snacks. In addition to this business, during the day she sells clothing for women, men, and children. She will use part of the loan to buy clothes like bathing suits for the beach season. Her dream is to be able to finish building her house. She hopes to continue working to save and be able to do it.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy potatoes, onions, bread, soft drinks, salsas, meat, and clothes for women, men, and children to stock her businesses

loans.name: Sara Concepción

texts.es:
Sara Concepción C. R. tiene 47 años, es casado, y  tiene seis hijos.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

La socia es miembro de la ventanilla rural Calzado Solidario, es un recinto que se encuentra a quince minutos del Cantón San Miguel en la vía a la costa.  Son 19 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.

Sara trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, papas y habas.  Vende los productos en la feria de San Miguel y envía mercadería a la ciudad de Quito.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero y aprovecha esta fiesta para reunirse con la familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Sara Concepción C. R. is 47 years old, is married, and has six children. She lives in the canton of San Miguel, in Bolívar province. She is a member of the Calzado Solidario ("Shoes for the Poor") communal bank, which is located fifteen minutes from San Miguel on the coastal road. There are 19 members altogether, most of them working in agriculture and animal husbandry. Sara works in agriculture to improve her family's economic situation. Her most successful crops are corn, potatoes and beans. She sells the crops at the market in San Miguel and sends merchandise to Quito. The main cultural event in her aR. is Carnival, which is celebrated every February. Sara uses this time to get together with family. She is asking for this loan to buy farm supplies. Her goal is to be able to support her family. The challenges she faces are climate problems and crop diseases.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of farm supplies

loans.name: Musuva

texts.en:
Musuva I. is 28 and single with no children.  She owns a business venture, selling fabric handicrafts to tourists and local community members.  Musuva has 2 years of experience in this business.  Musuva needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Musuva joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Musuva's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.


The following social metrics for Musuva I. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.8 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria De Los Ángeles tiene 46 años, su actividad económica es la venta de refrescos. Tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Ella es muy famosa en su pequeño puesto en las afueras de su humilde vivienda, pues pasa todo el día ofreciendo sus delicioso refrescos, a pesar de no tener muchos conocimientos mucha educación, porque sus padres no pudieron brindarle esa oportunidad por no tener los recursos necesarios para que ella pudiera estudiar, a pesar de esto no se detiene pues todos los días aprende algo nuevo con su negocio. Maria solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de naranjas, melones, mandarinas, zanahoria, cebada y cacao. Ella desea construir su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria De Los Ángeles is 46 and works selling juice drinks. She has 2 young children in her care. She is very famous with her small stand in front of her humble house. She is outside all day long selling her delicious drinks. Despite the fact that she has had little formal education, because her parents didn’t have the financial resources to pay for schooling, she doesn’t stop learning something new every day in her business. Maria is asking for a loan for working capital that she will use to buy oranges, melons, tangerines, carrots, barley and cacao (for chocolate). She would like to build her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señor Gloria L. Areas es dueña de una pulpería ubicada en el Reparto San Jose, es una señora de 55 años de edad emprendedora quien junto con su esposo administran el  negocio .El cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$5,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de un préstamo hace 15 años, ella empezó vendiendo en un puesto pequeño agua helada y gaseosa poco a poco fue incrementando su negocio esto debido a la demanda de productos y ahora cuenta  con una pulpería estable y solida. Ahora cuenta con 2 muchachas que despachan a las que les brido un trabajo para que  pudieran seguir estudiando.  

 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; Como es la compra inventario para surtir la pulperia para competir con la competencia.

Ella esta casado, con 4 hijos y 1 de ello a su cargo, actualmente se encuentra en la universidad.
 
Lleva 2 créditos en  CEPRODEL a lo largo de 2 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando sus productos, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.
texts.en: Sra. Gloria L.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her store

loans.name: Rosa Aminta

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es una socia del Banco Comunal Damas De Éxitos, se reúnen cada 15 días en un sector a las afuera de la ciudad de Portoviejo en la Provincia de Manabí localidad turística por sus hermosas playas que atraen al turista nacional y extranjero durante todo el año.

Rosa tiene 5 ciclos en el bankito con los prestamos que ha obtenido a podido seguir en su negocio como comerciante informal  de zapatos, ella junto a su hija tiene un puesto en el  casco comercial de Portoviejo desde hace 20 años, su horario de atención  es de 08 de la mañana a  6 de la tarde de lunes a domingo ofreciendo calzado para toda la familia.

La señora Rosa nos comentó que fue un hermano quien la ayudo para que ella tenga su propio  negocio  ya que toda la familia se dedica a esta actividad. Con este nuevo préstamo viajara a Guayaquil donde compra a los mayoristas  calzada deportivo, casual, informal y sandalias para la temporada playera y obtener una mejor gananciasobre todo  estos meses del año que  son muy buenos para el negocio.

 Rosa al igual que las otras socias tiene su sueño y no descarta la posibilidad de  tener un local más amplio y cómodo para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank Damas de Exitos. They meet every two weeks in an area outside the city of Portoviejo, Province of Manabi. This is a tourist area because of its beautiful beaches that attract national and international tourists all year long. Rosa has gone through 5 cycles with the little bank with the loans she has gotten to be able to continue with her business as a street vendor of shoes. With her daughter she has had a spot in the business district of Portoviejo for 20 years. Her work schedule is from 8 in the morning until 6 in the afternoon, Monday through Sunday, offering shoes for the whole family. Rosa tells us that it was her brother who helped her to have her own business, since the whole family participates in this kind of activity. With this new loan she will travel to Guayaquil, where she will buy athletic, casual and informal shoes and sandals from wholesalers for the beach season. She will then make more profit, especially during this time of year which is very good for business. Rosa, along with the other memebrs, has her dream and doesn't discount the possibiilty of having a more spacious and comfortable locale to give a better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase athletic, casual and informal shoes for the beach season

loans.name: Flor Civilina

texts.es:
Flor Civilina Guaman C., tiene 25 años, vive en unión libre, y  tiene dos hijos.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

La socia es miembro de la ventanilla rural Calzado Solidario, es un recinto que se encuentra a quince minutos del Cantón San Miguel en la vía a la costa.  Son 19 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.

Trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, papas y en pocas cantidades siembra legumbres.  Vende los productos en la feria de San Miguel y vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Quito.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero y  la fiesta del patrón San Miguel además aprovecha esta fiesta para reunirse con la familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar terrenos para sembrar en tierras propias y obtener ingresos para ayudar a la familia sobre todo a los hijos en la educación.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Flor Civilina Guaman C., age 25, lives in a common law relationship and has two children. She lives in the canton of San Miguel in Bolívar province.

Flor is a member of the Calzado Solidario communal bank, which is located 15 minutes from the San Miguel canton on the road to the coast. This has 19 members in all, most of who are engaged in agriculture and the raising of small animals.

She works in agriculture in order to increase the finances of her family. The crops that do best are corn and potatoes. She also plants a small quantity of vegetables. She sells her products in the San Miguel market and in the city of Quito’s wholesale market.

The principal cultural event of the area is the Carnival, which is celebrated every year in February. She also enjoys the festival of the patron saint San Miguel for a reunion with her family.

Flor is applying for a loan in order to buy land so that she can plant crops on her own fields and obtain income to help her family and, above all, help with the education of her children. Her goal is to have a good business for her family. The challenges she faces are climate problems and sicknesses that affect her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of land.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi L. is 34 and married with 2 children.  She owns a business venture, selling pancakes (fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam).  Naomi has 2 years of experience in this business.  Naomi needs a loan of WST $1500 to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Naomi joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Naomi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Naomi L. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.8 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags

loans.name: Geoconda Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Geoconda tiene la edad de 35 años, desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos. Casada, y con dos hermosos hijos los cuales cursan la secundaria. Su esposo es de profesión  ebanista. En su trayectoria de vida a trabajado en varios trabajo para poder apoyar a su familia con los gastos, se ha desempeñado como domestica, un trabajo muy cansado y mal pagado, con parte de sus ahorros  y dinero que su esposo dio, pudo comprar ropa y cosmético para comenzar a vender para poder ganar su propio dinero,  también los fines de semana vende comida, baho, vigoron y sopa lo cual aprovecha para mejorar sus ganancias y así poder ir mejorando su casa. Con esta solicitud desea terminarlo ya que es de tierra y desea poner cerámica para una mejor higiene a si como comprar ventanas ya que la tiene con unas tablas y es de necesidad comprarlas para una mejor seguridad. SusPlanes es seguir invirtiendo en su venta de comida los fines de semana. Como aumentar las ventas de ropa y lograr un mejor inventario para poder dar a sus hijos lo que necesiten en sus estudios y que logren una buena educación.
texts.en:
Geocanda is 35, and she has been selling clothes and cosmetics for several years. She is married and has two beautiful children who are in high school. Her husband is a cabinetmaker. On her life’s path she has worked at various jobs to be able to help her family with the expenses. She has worked as a domestic employee, which is very tiring work for poor pay. With part of her savings and with money that her husband gave her, she was able to buy clothes and cosmetics to start selling in order to earn her own money. Also, on the week ends she sells food, “baho” (a traditional Nicaraguan stew), "vigoron" (a typical Nicaraguan dish of cabbage and yucca), and soup. She takes this opportunity to improve her earnings and be able to improve her house. With this request she hopes to finish it. The floor is dirt, and she wants to put down ceramic tile to be more hygienic. She also wants to buy windows because what she now has are wood. She needs to buy them for greater security. Her plans are to keep investing in her food sales on the week ends. She will increase her clothing sales and get a greater inventory. Then she will be able to give her children what they need for their education, and they will get a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cermanic tiles and window for better hygienge and more security for her family

loans.name: Silvia Zoila

texts.es:
Silvia Zoila G. M. tiene 50 años, es casado, y  tiene cinco hijos.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

La socia es miembro de la ventanilla rural Calzado Solidario, es un recinto que se encuentra a quince minutos del Cantón San Miguel en la vía a la costa.  Son 19 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.

Trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, papas y también tiene matas de tomate de árbol.  Vende los productos en la feria de San Miguel y en el mercado de Guaranda.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero y aprovecha esta fiesta para reunirse con la familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y semillas para el trabajo del campo.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Silvia Zoila G. M. is 50 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in the county of San Miguel in the province of Bolivar. She is a member of the rural group, Calzado Solidario, a precinct located fifteen minutes from the county of San Miguel on the road towards the coast. They are 19 members total, the majority of whom are dedicated to agriculture and the rearing of animals. She works in agriculture in order to increase the family's income. The most popular crops are corn, potatoes, and she also has tomato tree plants. She sells the products at the San Miguel fair and in the Guaranda market. The most important holiday is carnival, which is celebrated every year in February and she takes this opportunity to get together with her family. She is applying for a loan so that she can buy fertilizers and seeds to work the land. Her objective is to have a good economic situation for her family. Her difficulties are the climate and the diseases that affect the crops.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and seeds for work.

loans.name: Sauiluma

texts.en:
Sauiluma F. is 38 and married with no children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Sauiluma has 4 years of experience in this business.  Sauiluma needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Sauiluma joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Sauiluma's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Sauiluma F. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.8 out of 3
