Quality of Household Assets:                2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Jessica Francisca

texts.es:
La Sta. Jessica C. es una joven que trabaja como obrera en ARNECOM, que esta ubicado en la ciudad del viejo.

Ella va a ocupar este crédito en la compra de electrodomésticos para tener sus propias prendas.

Este es el primer crédito que tiene con CEPRODEL, pero espera llegar a tener varios y salir adelante demostrando su responsabilidad y honestidad.
texts.en:
Jessica C. is a young woman who works at Arnecom Corporation, located in the city of Chinandega El Viejo, Nicaragua. She will use this loan to puchase electrical appliances so that she can have her own things. This is her first of what she hopes will be several loans with Kiva partner CEPRODEL. Jessica hopes to move forward by demonstrating her responsibility and honesty.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses: purchase of electrical appliances

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer muy emprendedora de 36 años, está separada hace muchos años del padre de sus 3 hijos, con los que vive en su casa propia, pero que está a medio construir.
Desde hace 15 años se dedica al tejido de chompas, negocio en el que viene surgiendo poco a poco, especialmente con diseños típicos para los turistas, gracias a la demanda de estas prendas en los últimos tiempos. Por esta razón, Ana alquiló un puesto en un lugar muy concurrido, lugar cercano a una zona de embarque para viajar fuera del país. Desde entonces ha mejorado considerablemente su situación, pues le han pedido que adicione bordado a sus chompas y ella no dudo en hacerlo, por lo que gana mucho más de que antes. 
Su trabajo lo realiza con mucha facilidad, ya que tiene habilidad en las manos para el tejido desde niña, pero jamás imaginó que este arte heredado de su madre sería el pilar de su economía. 

Este es su 20avo crédito con MFP y promete seguir trabajando con la misma responsabilidad en sus cuotas, ya que para ella es muy importante contar con créditos posteriores, por ser una herramienta fundamental para su progreso. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de lana, hilos de diversos grosores y plantillas para bordado.
texts.en:
Ana is an enterprising woman of 36 years old. She has been separated for some time from the father of her 3 children, who live with her in her own house, but which is only half constructed. For the past 15 years, she has dedicated herself to the weaving of jackets, a business in which has grown little by little, especially with designs typical for tourists, thanks to the recent demand in these types of pieces of clothing. As a result, Ana rented a stand in a busy area, a place very near the embarkation for trips leaving the country. Since then, she has improved considerably her situation. She has been asked to add embroidery to her jackets and she doesn't hesitate to do so, which means she is making a lot more than before. She does her work with ease, since she has always had skillful hands at weaving since she was a little girl. However, she never imagined that this art form, inherited from her mother would be the basis of her income. This is her 20th loan with MFP and she promises to continue to act responsibly in her payments because it is important for her to be able to depend on future credits that will be a fundamental tool in her business' progress. She plans to invest the money that is applying for in the purchase of wool, threads of various thicknesses, and embroidery templates.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool and other textile materials

loans.name: Angel Jonathan

texts.es: El joven ANGEL JONATHAN M. M.  labora para UPONIC como profesor de danza es soltero, no tiene hijos, además es estudiante universitario, es el primer crédito que trabaja con CEPRODEL  este será utilizado para compra de material didáctico para su año universitario y para pago de Aranceles en la universidad se siente contento con la atención que le brinda CEPRODEL.
texts.en:
Angel Jonathan M. M. is a young dance instructor at UPONIC, a university in Managua. He is single with no children, and he is also a student at the university. This is his first loan with Kiva partner CEPRODEL. The loan proceeds will be applied toward purchase of teaching materials throughout the academic school year and toward payment of university fees. Angel is happy with the assistance that CEPRODEL offers him.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of university teaching materials

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María es una mujer muy jovial de 58 años, hace 5 años quedó viuda. Tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales vive con Gabriela, su hija menor y estudiante universitaria. La casa donde habitan es propia y está ubicada en un barrio populoso de la ciudad de Lima.

Con el buen sentido del humor que la caracteriza cumple a diario su labor de costurera desde hace 8 años. Esta actividad le gusta mucho porque emplea toda su imaginación para realizar los encajes y los acabados de los vestidos que confecciona. 
Inicialmente trabajaba para otra persona, pero al pasar los años se independizó, siendo mucho más rentable tener un negocio propio, y fue con estas ganancias que afrontó la enfermedad de su esposo, hasta los últimos días de su vida.
Después de estos momentos dolorosos, se sobrepuso y ahora piensa en ampliar su negocio, para ello quiere alquilar un local en el mercado de su zona, ya que su mayor placer es la costura y tiene muchos clientes, pese a la competencia en su barrio, pues la prefieren a ella por su trabajo oportuno y de buen acabado.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y promete seguir trabajando con la misma responsabilidad como lo viene haciendo hasta ahora, ya que éste préstamo es de mucha ayuda para el crecimiento de su negocio. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de tela para la confección de más vestidos; pero también comprará algunos ya hechos para alquilarlos y así obtener dinero extra.
texts.en:
María is a very cheerful woman, aged 58, who became a widow five years ago. She has three children. She lives with her youngest daughter Gabriela who studies at the university. They live in their own house, which is located in a densely populated neighborhood in Lima. With her characteristic sense of humor she has performed her daily work as a seamstress for eight years. She really likes her activity, because she can let her imagination run to sew great laces and finish off her dresses. In the beginning, she worked for someone else, but as the years passed she became independent and earned much more money in her own business. It was this income that allowed her to face up to her husband's terminal illness until the last days of his life. Later on she overcame these painful times, and now she plans to expand her business. She wants to rent a stall at her local market, as her greatest pleasure is sewing and, despite competition in her neighborhood, she has many customers who prefer dealing with her because of her timely work and good finishing. This is María's third loan with the microfinance institution Microfinanzas Prisma. She promises to continue working with the same responsibility as she has done so far, since this loan is very helpful for the growth of her business. She is going to use part of the requested money to buy more fabric to sew her dresses and part of the money to buy some finished dresses for rent and get some extra money.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and dresses

loans.name: Leonardo Fabian

texts.es:
Leonardo Fabián Guaman C. tiene 22 años, vive en union libre, y  tiene un hijo.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es miembro de la ventanilla rural Calzado Solidario, es un recinto que se encuentra a quince minutos del Cantón San Miguel en la vía a la costa.  Son 19 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.

Leonardo trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen es el maíz.  Vende los productos en la feria de San Miguel y en su casa. 
La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero y aprovecha esta fiesta para reunirse con la familia.

El socia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Leonardo Fabián Guaman C. is 22 years old, and lives with his common-law wife and his son. They live in the county of San Miguel in the Bolivar province. Leonardo is a member of the communal bank "Calzado Solidario," located in a compound that is 15 minutes outside of San Miguel county, on the road to the coast. There are 19 members in total, who work in agriculture and livestock production. Leonardo works in agriculture to support his family. His main crop is corn. He sells his products in the market of San Miguel and from his house. Each year in February the main cultural event is Carnival, a time when families take advantage of the celebration to get together. Leonardo requests a loan to buy supplies for his work in the fields. His goal is to produce a good income for the family. The challenges he faces are problems with the weather that affect his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies for his work in agriculture

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: El señor Santos S. Blanco  es trabajador de la Alcaldia de Managua es Ingeniero tiene dos hijos a su cargo menores de edad , el crédito solicitado a CEPRODEL  será utilizado para realizar exámenes a su mama quien se encuentra mal de salud y consultas , que tiene que hacer.
texts.en:
Santos S. Blanco works as an engineer in the mayor's offfice in Managua, Nicaragua. He cares for his two children, who are minors. The loan he is seeking through Kiva partner CEPRODEL will be used to pay for necessary medical tests and consultations for the children's mother, who is ill.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for medication, medical exams and doctor's visits.

loans.name: Maria Evarista

texts.es: LA señora Maria Evarista S. ha trabajado 4 creditos con CEPRODEL LOS CUALES LOS HA UTILIZADO PARA MEJORAR SU VIVIENDA SE SIENTE AGRADECIDA CON CEPRODEL POR EL APOYO QUE HA OBTENIDO , EN LOS CUATRO CREEDITOS OTORGADOS YA QUE HA LOGRADO MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Maria Evarista S. is the recipient of four loans through Kiva partner CEPRODEL. She has applied the proceeds of these four loans to making improvements to her home. She is grateful to CEPRODEL for the support she has received in the way of the four authorized loans, given that they have helped her to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Faaifo

texts.en:
Faaifo U. is 32 and married with 4 children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale.  Faaifo has 2 years of experience in this business.  Faaifo needs a loan of WST $2250 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

Faaifo joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Faaifo's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Faaifo U. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.7 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Dalia Susana

texts.es: La señora DALIA SUSANA S. S. labora para la Alcaldia de Managua como secretaria es el primer crédito que solicita en CEPRODEL  lo utilizara para compra de utiles escolares matriculas  de sus hijos que están estudiando y pagar una deuda que actualmente la esta agobiando y es tarjeta de crédito ya que estas son mucho mas caras que un crédito de microfinanzas , esto me sacara problemas y me sentiré un poco desahogada ya que eso me esta aficciando.
texts.en:
Dalia Susana S. S. works as a secretary in the mayor's office in Managua, Nicaragua. This is the first loan she is seeking through Kiva partner CEPRODEL. She will use it to pay for educational materials for her children, who are students, and to reduce the credit card debt that is weighing her down. The credit card debt is much more costly than a microfinance loan, which could get her out of trouble and make her feel more well-off.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal educational expenses.

loans.name: Luis Humberto

texts.es: Este cliente es un ganadero de la zona de el viejo este sr cuenta con 30 años  de experiencia en el rubro ganadero  es casado y padre de 4 hijos y con mucho esfuerzo ha venido saliendo adelante el crédito lo utilizara para comprar ganado de desarrollo y aumentar su hato ganadero
texts.en:
Luis Humberto J. is a livestock breeder in Chinandega El Viejo, Nicaragua. He has 30 years experience in the field of livestock ranching. He is married and the father of four children. He has exerted much effort in order to gradually get ahead in his business. The requested loan would be used to purchase livestock to develop and grow his business.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: María Margarita

texts.es:
María Margarita tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en el anexo San Miguel del caserío Cruz del Médano, ubicado en el distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desde hace más de 3 años. Usualmente cría aves de corral en un ambiente ubicado en la parte posterior de su vivienda. Los animales que cría los vende a los comerciantes y negociantes que visitan regularmente la zona en donde vive. Este negocio es de mucha ayuda a la economía de su familia debido a que su esposo, al igual que la mayoría de hombres de la zona, se dedica a trabajar como obrero agrícola y los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para solventar sus gastos personales.

María Margarita desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más aves de corral, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una persona bastante humilde y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle sus menores hijos una educaión de calidad que les garantice un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
Maria is 25 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the San Miguel annex of the Cruz del Médano neighborhood, located in the Mórrope district, 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has been raising and selling animals for the past three years, including poultry in an area behind her home. She sells the animals to business people who visit her area regularly. This business is financially very helpful to her family, as her husband works as a farm laborer, as do most of the other men in the area, and his income is not enough to meet their needs. Maria would like to expand her business by purchasing more birds, so she is asking for this first loan of 500 PEN ($175) through Edpyme Alternativa in order to help meet this goal. She is a very humble and hard working woman. Her main desire is to be able to provide for a quality education for her children, which will guarantee them a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy poultry for resale

loans.name: Faapepele

texts.en:
Faapepele L. is 25 and married with 2 children.  She owns a business venture, selling fabric handicrafts to tourists and local community members.  Faapepele has 2 years of experience in this business.  Faapepele needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Faapepele joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Faapepele's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Faapepele L. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.7 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Magda Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora MAGDA ELIZABETH B. Q. labora para CEPRODEL , es soltera , pero tiene dos niños a su cargo que son sobrinos de ella y ella les ayuda económicamente , los créditos anteriores lo ha utilizado para mejoras de vivienda , este ultimo crédito lo va a utilizar para matricula y compra de material didáctico para sus sobrinos ya que estamos en época de apertura de año escolar. Agradece a CEPRODEL `por la oportunidad de mejorar la calidad de  vida y ayudar a sus sobrinos a superarse.
texts.en:
Magda Elizabeth B. Q. works for Kiva partner CEPRODEL. She is single but is the primary caregiver and financial supporter for two children, who are her nephews. Her previous loans were used for home improvements. The loan currently being requested will be applied toward tuition and school supplies for her nephews, who are approaching the start of a new school year. She thanks CEPRODEL for the opportunity to improve their collective quality of life and to help her nephews to better themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tuition and purchase of school supplies

loans.name: Walter Cesar

texts.es:
Walter tiene 37 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos en el caserío Puente Tabla, distrito de Túcume, ubicado a cincuenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, una zona donde predominan las actividades de agricultura y crianza de animales para venta.

Desde hace 17 años se dedica a la construcción de viviendas. El es muy recomendado por la zona y en los caseríos cercanos ya que los trabajos que realiza son de muy buena calidad. Este trabajo es su única fuente de sustento por lo que siempre da lo mejor de si para salir adelante.

Walter está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1800 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de utensilios y herramientas que le faciliten su trabajo.

Walter es un padre honrado y muy trabajador. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y a sus hijos una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Walter is 37, married and lives with his wife and their three children in the farming village Puente Tabla, Túcume district, about 50 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. This is an area that is devoted predominantly to agriculture and the raising and sale of animals. Since he was 17 years old, he has worked building homes. He is recommended throughout the area and in the nearby farm villages since his work is of very high quality. This work is the only income for his family and thus he always tries to do his best to get ahead. Walter is asking for a loan of 1800 new soles for the first time with Edpyme Alternativa . He plans to buy tools and materials that will make his work easier. Walter is a hard-working and respected father. His greatest goal is to offer his family a better quality of life and that his children have a quality education.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials to facilitate his work

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi S. is 40 and married with 2 children (ages 5 and 7). She owns a business, raising pigs for sale. Naomi has many years of experience in this business. Naomi needs a loan of WST $2500 to renovate an existing shelter for her livestock. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US$250 per week) to improve and expand the business. In 2008, Naomi joined SPBD, and this is her fourth loan. SPBD's loans are Naomi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To renovate an existing shelter for the borrower's livestock

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Aurora es una mujer trabajadora de 51 años, está casada con Enrique de 47; ambos viven junto a sus 2 hijos: Estrella de 17 y Julio de 12, en su casa propia.
La atención de su bodega es su principal actividad y gracias a ella puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, puesto que él se dedica a la carrocería y esto no alcanza para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia. 
Desde muy joven, Aurora se acostumbró a trabajar en variedad de oficios y gracias a la experiencia ganada en todos ellos optó por tener algo propio, es así que inició con su bodega, la cual le da la ventaja de permanecer en su casa realizando las labores del hogar, atender a sus hijos y a la vez lograr ingresos para su casa
Aurora se siente feliz de realizar su trabajo y es por ello que le pone mucho empeño en abastecerlo con todas las necesidades de su clientela; por tal motivo, también vende carne de pollo y verduras, para que así sus clientes no deban caminar hasta el mercado y le compren a ella.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y le gusta mucho su trabajo con sus compañeras de grupo, porque todas se conocen y son buenas amigas. Debido a la campaña escolar, con el dinero que solicita y aprovechando la ocasión, quiere vender útiles de escritorio en su tienda, para incrementar sus ganancias de estos meses.
texts.en:
Aurora is a hard working 51 year old woman. She is married to Enrique, 47 and they live together in their own home with their two children: Estrella, age 17; and Julio, age 12. Her main activity is attending her store and thanks to it, she is able to help her husband with the household expenses. He works on vehicles and his income is not enough to meet the needs of his family. Aurora became accustomed to working in different areas when she was young. Thanks to this experience she decided to start her own business, so she opened her store in her home. This way she is able to stay home, do her household chores, care for her children, and earn an income at the same time. Aurora is happy being able to run this business and puts a lot of effort into stocking it with all her customers’ needs. She also sells chicken and vegetables so that her customers will not have to walk to the marketplace. This will be her first loan through MFP. She really likes the work they do and likes the rest of the members of the group because they all know each-other and are all friends. Given the school campaign, she would like to use the money from this loan to stock her store with writing supplies in order to increase her income during this period.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy writing supplies for resale

loans.name: Rosa Lila

texts.es:
La Sra. J. es ganadera y agricultora cuenta con 15 años de experiencia en la ganadería el crédito lo necesita para la compra de ganado lechero 
Es casada y madre de 3 hijos los cuales trabajan en conjunto para aumentar las utilidades
texts.en:
J. is a farmer and raises cattle. She has 15 years of experience raising cattle. She needs the loan to buy a dairy cow. She is married and has three children. They work together to increase the profits.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre de 52 años, es soltera y vive en su casa propia junto a su hija de 15 años de edad.
Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de ceviche (platillo tradicional peruano, elaborado en base a pescado y limón). Ella tiene un puesto afuera de su casa y cuenta con la ayuda de su hija para la preparación de esta comida, pues se requiere de varias manos que corten los limones y  piquen las cebollas, que es la labor más molesta. Sin embargo, ya se ha acostumbrado a trabajar con rapidez, pues sus clientes son muy exigentes y debe despachar a la mayor cantidad de porciones para generarse buenos ingresos.
Para el futuro, Delia ambiciona instalar un restaurante y está realizando algunas mejoras en su casa para implementarlo allí, por lo que necesita mejorar sus ganancias para poder ahorrar y hacer su sueño realidad.


Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta de trabajar con esta institución, ya que sabe que no tendrá inconvenientes con los pagos gracias a su gran responsabilidad. Con el dinero que solicita comprará algunos muebles, utensilios de cocina e ingredientes para el ceviche.
texts.en:
Delia is a hardworking and cheerful woman. She is 52 years old, single, and lives in her own home with her 15 year old daughter.

For the past two years, Delia has been selling ceviche (a traditional Peruvian dish prepared with a base of fish and citrus juice). Her vending stand is located outside of her house and she has the help of her daughter in preparing this dish. Many hands are required to slice the lemons and chop the onions, which are the most time-consuming tasks. However, Delia is already accustomed to working quickly because her customers are very demanding and she must sell a large number of servings in order to generate a good income. Delia hopes to open a restaurant in her home sometime in the future, so she is already making improvements. She hopes to increase her profits so that she can save enough money to make her dream a reality.

This is her first loan with MFP. Delia is happy to be working with the Institution and knows that she not have any problems with her payments as long as she works responsibly. The money she requested will be used to buy furniture, cooking utensils, and ingredients for making ceviche.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture, cooking utensils, and ingredients

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni es una carismática mujer de 42 años, vive con su pareja Rafael, de 55 años, quien trabaja en una empresa de telefonía, y con sus hijos: Karen de 19, Pier de 17 y André de 13 años de edad.

Su actividad principal es la atención de su peluquería, la cual implementó en su propia casa, esto gracias a su esfuerzo y al de su esposo, quien la apoyó en todo. A Marleni siempre le gustó el mundo de la cosmetología, puesto mejorar la imagen de las personas le resulta muy gratificante. Gracias a los buenos cortes y bonitos peinados que realiza, su negocio no tardó en llenarse de clientela, la cual en la actualidad le es muy fiel, debido a que Marleni aparte de ser buena cosmetóloga es buena consejera. En un futuro, quiere mejorar su local comprando muebles y máquinas secadoras, peines, cosméticos, etc., para así mejorar el servicio que brinda.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se encuentra contenta de haber conformado un banco comunal con sus vecinas y amigas, ya que entre ellas se conocen y saben de su responsabilidad. Con el dinero que solicita comprará máquinas secadoras, cosméticos, entre otros artículos que requiere su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Marleni is a 42 year old charismatic woman. She lives with her partner Rafael (age 55), who works for a telephone company, and their children: Karen (age 19), Pier (age 17) and André (age 13).

She operates a beauty salon in her house, thanks to the efforts of her husband who has supported her in everything. Marleni has always liked the world of cosmetology because she finds helping people improve their image to be very rewarding. Thanks to the haircuts and beautiful hair styles that she provides, her salon quickly filled up with customers who have become regular clients. In addition to being a fine beautician, Marleni has become a good counselor. In the future, she wants to improve her business by acquiring furniture, hair dryers, combs, cosmetics, and other items that she needs to provide better service.

This is her first loan with MFP. Marleni is happy to have formed a Communal Bank with her friends and neighbors because she knows them and is confident that they can work together responsibly. The money she requested will be used to buy hair dryers, cosmetics, and other items that she needs for her salon.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase equipment & supplies for her salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase weaving materials

loans.name: Yude

texts.es:
Yude es una emprendedora mujer de 24 años, vive con su pareja Humberto, de 27 años, y con sus dos hijos: Jacqueline de 4 y Gean de 2 años.

Hace 2 años decidió tener un negocio propio y así ayudar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, ya que el trabaja en un restaurante como mozo y sus ingresos no resultaban suficientes. Por tal motivo, empezó a vender productos de belleza, ayudando así a generar ingresos extras para el beneficio de su familia.
Esta actividad tiene la ventaja de que puede disponer de su tiempo y organizarlo según su conveniencia para cuidar a sus hijos menores, quienes necesitan aún de ella. A Yude le gusta su trabajo, pues visita a sus amistades y vecinas ofreciéndole sus productos, además también aprovecha en tener amenas conversaciones, lo que ocasiona que cada vez tenga mayor cantidad de clientes, por su buen trato al trabajar.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y se siente muy cómoda con su grupo, ya que todos se conocen y saben muy bien de su responsabilidad. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más cosméticos para tenerlos en stock y así satisfacer el pedido de sus clientes cuando se lo soliciten.
texts.en:
Yude is a 24 year old entrepreneur who lives with her partner Humberto (age 27) and their two children, Jacqueline (age 4) and Gean (age 2).

Two years ago, Yude started her own business so that she could help her partner with the household expenses. She previously worked at a restaurant as waitress, but her earnings were not sufficient. For that reason, she began selling beauty products so that she could generate extra income to benefit her family. The advantage of this job is that the schedule is flexible and she can arrange her time based on when she needs to look after her children. She enjoys her work because she gets to visit friends and neighbors when offering her products. In addition, she benefits from having interesting conversations that allow her to attract more customers and provide them with better service.

This is her first loan with MFP. Yude feels very comfortable working with her group because she knows everyone will assume their responsibilities. She will use the money to buy more cosmetics to keep in stock so that she can fulfill her customers’ orders immediately upon request.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Roman

texts.es:
Roman tiene 48 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su familia en el caserío Molino El Carmen del distrito de Motupe, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la agricultura desde hace cinco años, cuenta con un terreno de cultivo propio de una hectarea y media en el cual suele sembrar maíz. Esta actividad es la única fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta para solventar los gastos familiares por lo que día a día da todo de si para mantener su cultivo en óptimas condiciones.

Durante esta temporada ha sembrado en su terreno maíz, el cual está creciendo con normalidad. A. desea brindarle mantenimiento aplicándole abonos e insecticidas pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Roman es un padre de familia honrado y muy trabajador. Su mayor anhelo es mejorar la producción de su cultivo para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Roman is 48 years old, married, and lives with his family in the village of Molino El Carmen, which is in the District of Motupe and located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been farming for the past five years. Roman owns a hectare of land, half of which is used for growing corn. This is the only source of income available to meet the family expenses, so every day he must do everything he can to maintain optimal conditions for his crops.

His corn crop is growing normally so far this season. In April, he wants to maintain the crops by applying compost and insecticides, but he does not have sufficient capital to acquire what he needs. For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 soles.

Roman is an honest family man and an extremely hard worker. His greatest wish is to improve his crop production so that he can provide his family with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & insecticides

loans.name: Chona

texts.en: Ms. Chona L., a thirty-year-old single mother from Remedios, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental is our featured entrepreneur. She has one son. To make a living, she presently operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She has been in the business for six years and earns an average net income of not less than PHP 3,000. Upon hearing the about Paglaum MPC, she joined the cooperative in the 2009. As an active member, she can request a loan of up to PHP 5,000 for capital to invest in her sari-sari store and in her other line of business, in which she buys and sells dried fish and longganisa (sausage). The future income from this loan will be used for loan repayments, sustaining her family's basic needs, and saving for her child's future.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store and for her business buying and selling dried fish and longganisa

loans.name: Fiapito

texts.en:
Fiapito T. is 36 and married with children (age range of 1-12yrs).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting.  Fiapito has many years of experience in this business.  Fiapito needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Fiapito joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Fiapito's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Fiapito T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.87 out of 3
Level of Education:                         2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD:  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un padre D. familia D. 43 años D. edad que vive junto a su familia en el caserío Chochope del distrito D. Motupe, ubicado a 45 minutos D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace ocho años al cultivo D. maíz, para ello cuenta con un terreno D. cultivo D. una extensión D. 2 hectáreas. Este negocio es L. única fuente D. ingreso familiar con L. que cuenta por lo que el considera muy importante trabajar para que su producto tenga muy buena calidad al momento D. L. cosecha.

Es siguiendo este objetivo que desea adquirir semillas certificadas para obtener un buen producto D. L. parceL. que desea sembrar, como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, se ha visto en L. necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro D. su objetivo.

Juan es un padre D. familia trabajador y responsable, su mayor anhelo es poder obtener una  buena producción para otorgarle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.En L. imagen Juan aparece en el terreno ya preparado y listo para ser sembrado.
texts.en:
Juan is a 43 year old father who lives with his family in the village of Chochope within the District of Motupe, which is located 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past eight years, Juan has been growing corn. He has a piece of farmland that measures two hectares in area. This business is the only source of income for his family, so it is very important work and requires that his harvest be of good quality.

To continue with his objective, Juan wants to purchase certified seeds so that he can obtain good output from his planted fields. However, he does not have sufficient capital to take further action. For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 soles so that he can achieve his goal.

Juan is a hardworking and responsible father. His greatest wish is to obtain a good harvest so that he can proviD. his family with a better quality of life. In the photograph, Juan is standing on the ground that has been prepared and is ready for planting.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Las Populares De Loma Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “Las Populares de Loma”, en honor a la telenovela “Atrévete a Soñar”, que es del gusto de las clientas y a la comunidad de donde son originarias las integrantes del grupo. Está ubicado en la comunidad de Loma Alta Villa del Carbón, en el Estado de México.  El grupo está conformado por  14 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicita un crédito a CrediComún. Sin embargo, la mayoría de ellas ya ha tenido experiencia crediticia con otras instituciones.

La señora Marcelina A. R., conocida por todos como “Doña Marce” es integrante del grupo. Tiene 49 años y no tiene estudios, es comerciante y ama de casa. Tuvo 8 hijos, 4 mujeres (1 ya falleció)  y 4 varones. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 23 años. Después de haber trabajado en un restaurant en el D.F. y motivada por la experiencia y los deseos de superación, fue como decidió iniciar su negocio. No obstante, en aquellos años ella no contaba con la infraestructura suficiente, por lo que empezó cocinando en su propia casa y buscando en las calles a sus posibles clientes,

Platica Doña Marce que su casa también era muy pequeña, no había dinero para hacer otro cuartito e independizar el negocio. Poco a poco, la gente la empezó a buscar hasta que consiguió pedidos de comidas y desayunos para maestros de las escuelas de su localidad, para  médicos del centro de salud, e incluso para gente que tiene sus negocios en los alrededores y para  los visitantes del lugar también, pues como sus vecinos ya la conocían siempre la recomendaban y así es como ha crecido su negocio. Actualmente ella ya amplio su casita y ahí mismo sigue atendiendo el negocio pero ya con un espacio mejor acondicionado.
 
Solicita el préstamo para “comprar una estufa”, porque la que tiene ya no le es suficiente para elaborar diariamente sus pedidos de comida y también para “comprar un exprimidor” que le permita hacer más rápidamente los jugos que vende. Sus clientes disfrutan de su buena sazón y su carisma. La siguen también porque les ofrece buenos precios, pues dice Doña Marce “Todos estamos amolados y nos tenemos que ayudar”. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente Ilusionada porque desea que su negocio siga creciendo y que así como le ha permitido mejorar su casa y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos cuando él no tiene trabajo, ahora realice su sueño de comprar un terrenito que se ubica frente a su casa sobre la carretera, para construir en él un local y establecer su cocina económica.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Populares de Loma” in honor of the Mexican soap opera "Dare to Dream", which is enjoyed by many of our clients and the community in which these group members live. The group originates from the community of Loma Alta Villa del Carbón, in the State of Mexico. There are 14 members and this is the first time they have applied for a loan from CrediComún. However, many of them have had previous experience with other credit institutions. Sra. Marcelina A. R., known to everyone as “Doña Marce”, is a member of the group. She is 49 years old and the mother of eight children, four daughters (one is deceased) and four sons. Despite not having an education, she has managed to become both a businesswoman and a homemaker. Doña Marce has been selling food for 23 years. She previously worked at a restaurant in Mexico City. Motivated by this experience and her desire to succeed, she decided to start her own business. During that time, however, she had inadequate facilities, so she started cooking at home and then combed the streets in search of potential customers. Doña Marce’s home was also very small, but she did not have enough money to build a separate room for her business. Over time different people began approaching her to order breakfast and lunch, such as school teachers, doctors from the local clinic, business owners who worked in the surrounding area, and even visitors to the city. Her neighbors have always known her and knew that her business would grow, so they recommended her to other people. She has expanded her house and currently runs her business out of a space that is well-equipped. Doña Marce is requesting a loan to buy a stove because the one she has now is insufficient for preparing her daily food orders. She also wants to buy a juicer so that she can prepare juices faster. Her customers enjoy being around her and appreciate her charismatic personality. She also has a loyal following because her dishes are offered at low prices. “Everyone works so hard, so we have to help them,” says Doña Marce. Upon requesting this loan, she was optimistic about growing her business since this will allow her to make improvements to her home and support her husband with the household expenses whenever he is not able to find work. Doña Marce now dreams of buying a piece of land along the highway in front of her house where she can build a shop and establish her food business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a stove & a juicer

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is a young mother with two children. She is twenty-three years old and married. Her oldest child is only seven years old. She started farming in 2006 and shares that her business is going well and she is thankful she now owns her own land to till. She said she wants her farm to grow to be able to sustain her family’s needs and also to enable her to save for her children’s education. She recently joined CEVI to gain access to its program in order to raise capital for her farm. She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000. She told CEVI she would use this loan for farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Mrs. Arlene J. is a forty-three-year-old resident of P2 Minsubong, Tangub City. She is married to Concordio J., a security guard who is currently receiving an average salary of not less than PHP 4,000 per month. To help her husband meet their family's daily needs, she decided to begin a business buying and selling dried fish and longganisa (sausage). She has been able to maintain this business for three years. She is earning an average net income of not less than PHP 3,000 per month, an amount that is so beneficial for her family. She joined Paglaum MPC nine months ago. She has the opportunity to borrow up to PHP 13,000 as her third cycle loan. She would use the money as capital to invest in her existing business buying and selling dried fish and longganisa. The future income from this loan will be used for their daily needs, loan repayment, and to save for their future needs. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business buying and selling dried fish and longganisa

loans.name: Rizalinda

texts.en:
Mrs. Rizalinda M. experiences a lot of challenges in her farming, but she makes sure to be positive at all times. She continues to work hard because she believes her farm will grow someday and that it will help her improve her family’s living condition. At the age of forty-four, she is now married and has seven children. Her oldest child is only seventeen years old. Her children are also one of the reasons she makes sure to have an income; she wants to be able to provide them with a proper education. 

Rizalinda is a new member of CEVI. She joined CEVI to get financing for her farm. She would like to request a loan of PHP 6,000. With this amount, she would be able to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

texts.en:
Mrs. Georgen F. is a twenty-seven-year-old resident of Tigbao, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married, and her husband is a motorcycle driver. They have two children, one of whom is in elementary school. She manufactures raw materials into finished products, and she primarily makes "macaroni crackers." She owns and operates this business by herself and sells her finished products to neighborhood sari-sari (variety) stores. Not only does she make macaroni crackers, but she also makes camote candy (sweet potato candy), special polvoron (shortbread), and binangkal (sesame-seed doughnuts). She knows how to make these items because she frequently attends livelihood programs.
      
She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000. This is her third cycle, and she will use the loan as additional capital for her business, which she hopes will enable the business to expand in the future. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

texts.en: Twenty-year-old Janice wants to develop her business skills. She manages a rice farm in her hometown in Agusan Del Sur. To finance her farm, she used to borrow money from lenders who charged high interest rates. She said that because of it, earning was really hard for her. Now that she is a member of CEVI, a Kiva partner, she is hoping to earn more because of the lower interest rate offered. She requested a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used for purchasing farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to have an abundant harvest to help her family with their finances.

According to her, farming is quite tiring but because she and her husband are in it together, she finds comfort knowing she has a partner to lean on. Like other mothers, she wants all her children to have a proper education so she works hard to achieve it. She also joined CEVI, a Kiva partner, to gain financial assistance. She applied for a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos. She told CEVI that she would use the loan for farm supplies she needs, like seeds and fertilizers.

A married woman with five children, she works hard to supply her family with food, clothes and their other needs. One of her priorities is to give all her children a proper education.

Luzminda joined CEVI, a Kiva partner, in January to gain access to its program. She requested to borrow 6,000 Philippine pesos, which she will use to buy the farm supplies she needs, such as seeds, fertilizers and other items.

texts.en:
Jimmy, 32, earns a living by planting rice. He is from Agusan Del Sur. He is married to Leony and they have five children. He wishes for all of them to have a proper education and a bright future. He wants to take care of his business because it provides his family food to eat and clothes to wear. It also helps him save for his children’s education. 

He shared with CEVI, a Kiva partner, that he started planting rice already but he still needs additional farm inputs. He asked for a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos. He will use it to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies he needs.

loans.name: Sareta

texts.en:
Sareta S. is 57 and married with 6 children (ages 16 - 28).  She owns a business venture, selling clay handicrafts to tourists and local community members.  Sareta has many years of experience in this business.  Sareta needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 550 talas or US $229 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2008, Sareta joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Sareta's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Sareta S. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                1.6 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en: Ma. Elena, 26, is requesting a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., to provide supplies for her small food canteen. She is also selling banana cue (caramelized fried bananas) as additional income for her business. She started her business in 2008 with a small amount of capital. Now she wants her business to grow in order to earn a bigger income. She is 26 years old with an 8-year-old child. Her business is doing well, especially on weekdays, when she has many customers.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Mrs Avelina S. is from the village of Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 54 years old and married with three children. To make living, she has a dressmaking business and her husband is a carpenter. Her husband provides their daily basic needs. She has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns 4,000 PHP a month.

She joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to engage in other business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. That loan was used for additional capital. Now she has a new loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. It is her second loan from PMPC. Aside from additional capital, this loan is intended for the expansion of her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her dressmaking business

loans.name: Celestina's Group

texts.en:
Celestina E. is from the city of Santa Cruz Tangub City. She is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Celestina is 52 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Celestina sells a variety of products such as canned goods, sugar, salt, noodles, vinegar, candies, and other daily use products, to the local community. Celestina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 20000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Celestina joined GDMPC to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celestina successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. Celestina is requesting her third loan from GDMPC, for 8000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Our featured entrepreneur is the mother of three children with a passion for bamboo furniture making. She is Mrs. Mildred P. as shown in the picture together with her one of her daughters. She is 26 years old, married to Ramil P. and blessed with three children. Two of her children are of school age and one is still a minor dependent. Her husband is the one who makes the arts and some carpentry works. She assists in the preparation of the finished bamboo poles used to make the furniture. They’ve been in this kind of business for 10 years and at this time, they earn an average net income of not less than P5,000 a month. Their business is still existing and progressing. She joined PAGLAUM MPC a year ago.  She was given the privilege of borrowing P14,000 as her third loan to add to their capital for purchasing raw materials for their bamboo furniture making business. The future income from this business will be used for their daily needs, loan repayments and savings for her children’s future. The couple plans to have an outlet for display in the future. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Cesinia has been engaged in her business for nine years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Cesinia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cesinia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Cesinia is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory, as working capital and to build a house for lease. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

You can view pictures of a typical plantation in Samoa, taken by a Kiva Fellow, at:   http://picasaweb.google.com/agnes.p.chu/SamoanPlantation

In 2010, Anasii joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Anasii's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Anasii S. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2.5 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena manages a sari-sari store. She is 41 years old with three children. The eldest child is 18 years old. She lacks capital to run her business. That’s why she sought help from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. for a loan of 15,000 PHP. This will help her buy more stocks of groceries for her store. With the profit she will earn, she can send her children to school and provide the needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan, 35, operates video games to earn a living. Her video game machines are placed in different locations around her community. During fiesta, her business earns a lot. She wishes that she could expand her business. She started her business in 2004. Now she’s requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to help her financially to operate the business. She has three children to support. The eldest child is 12 years old. The loan will be helpful for her to purchase more video game machines.

loans.use: To buy video game equipment

loans.name: Necito

texts.en: 26-year-old Necito is a fisherman. He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to invest in his fishing business. While single, he spends most of his time exploring for the success of his business. He started fishing in 1995. He also sells the fish he catches in the market. This loan will keep him going doing business in his community. He likes the program of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. because it has a low interest rate and helps entrepreneurs like him.

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
With skills in manicure and pedicure, our featured entrepreneur in this story is Mrs. Primitiva F.. She is 44 years of age, married, and a resident of Maloro, Tangub City. Together with her in the picture is her customer. Her husband is an employee of the Local Government of Tangub City. She is blessed with four children who are all adults and teenagers. With this condition, she felt financial hardships, especially in raising their children and in sending them to school. She decided to engage in manicure and pedicure services and a little hog raising activity. This time she is earning an average net income of not less than 3,000PHP from her services rendered to her loyal customers and friends. She joined PAGLAUM MPC three years ago. She was given the privilege of taking a loan of 14,900 PHP. Her recent loan in the same amount will be used to finance feed for her hog raising activity and for purchasing additional pedicure and manicure sets for her business activity. The future income from this business will be used for daily basic needs, savings and loan repayments. She is hoping that someday she can build another building for her hog raising business.

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed for hogs and manicure sets

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia B. is from the village of Salvador, Calamba, Misamis Occidental.  She is 61 years old, a widow and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Patricia owns & operates a sewing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from sewing clothes in the local community. Patricia has been engaged in her business for 35 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Patricia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Patricia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory. Patricia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 13th loan taken out by Patricia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for sewing

While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans is a 42-year-old married man with four children in school.  He has a hardware shop that he has been running for 10 years.  He is a member of Faulu Kenya and he plans to take his first loan of Kes. 20,000 to educate his children.  He has learned how to keep business records and customer service from Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to expand his business and offer a quality education to his children.  He sees himself owning a prominent workshop in the future.

loans.use: To educate his children

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 35-year-old married man with two children.  He has a pharmacy that he has been running for five years.  He was formerly employed in a pharmacy.  He also sells water to earn extra income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to keep his business records well.  He hopes to have a stable business. He has requested a loan of Kes. 50,000 to buy more medicine to sell.  He also hopes to have a stable family and a well-established company in the future.  He describes himself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: To buy more medicine
